Reviews.Title: “What are you waiting for get yourself to the Swissotel Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: bloom1
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, so central, lovely clean rooms, very friendly staff, nothing too much trouble your wish is their desire also the breakfast is unbelievably fresh with plenty of choice. Berlin is such a great find for a city break. I stayed here with a group of girlfriends of a certain age and felt very safe when walking around this wonderful Capital. So much to see and do plus loads of shops, restaurants and coffee houses on the door step of this wonderful hotel. All modes of transport also within walking distance of hotel. Lastly but not least the people of Berlin are the friendliest people you could wish to meet.

Reviews.Title: “Business stay”
Reviews.Author: Heghine Y
Reviews.Content: Though aim a great traveller and am a member of Marriott and Sheraton group but this hotel was totally different. The smell once you enter the hotel makes you feel that you enjoy your time in a nature, and the staff triets you as if you are a family member. I wanted to stay there for a week thuogh we stayed there for 22days and I reLly enjoyed it. I promise once I am back to Berlin I'll be there guest again, with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaikenSO
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin for 4 days and Swissotel was a great choice to stay. Nice staff, great breakfast and restaurant, clean rooms. And the price was not bad either. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, central and good service”
Reviews.Author: Vinegarhill
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel pretty much does what it says it will, it gives a good very clean room, very good service but if im honest in a bit of a generic hotel atmosphere. It seems to lack a little character but other than that it delivers what youd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelstar1972
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel and the staff were great so friendly helpful accommodating- great service Location is brilliant so easy to walk anywhere, lots of shops restaurants, bars and cafes nearby Highly recommended! Very modern and up to date decor without being too sterile Great place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Irune Z
Reviews.Content: Great service, great attention and great rooms!!! It includes a nespresso machine in the room so you can enjoy a good coffee any time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Carl1973
Reviews.Content: We were thouroghly pleased with our stay at the Swissotel. The service from the staff was impecable from arrival to check out. We got good tips from the concierge regarding shopping areas, restaurants etc. Room was spacious, clean and had everything we expected from the high ratings on Tripadvisor.com.

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: tilosreturner
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this fabulous hotel. We really enjoyed being pampered by the amazing staff. They obviously have had excellent training in dealing with the public - GOLD STARS all round for service. In addition the location of the hotel is ideally situated for sight seeing. Could not fault this hotel in any way. Forgot to say we were only B&B but the breakfast was something to die for!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good breakfast, very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Skypelover
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very welcoming staff. Nicely decorated room (i.e. modern) with Nespresso coffee maker. Beds not very comfortable, but OK. Two single beds pushed together, WITHOUT a king-size bedding mattress joining them, but WITH one single duvet - strange combination of bedding if you ask me! What did bother us was the travel of noise in the building: Whenever a door closed nearby - not necessarily on our floor - or someone walked by our room, we could hear it. Unfortunately, vibrations in the headboard of our bed when doors were closed nearby our room woke us up the first morning, much earlier than we had planned. When bringing the matter up with the front desk, the staff was very understanding, but claimed they had never heard about this phenomena before, something I find hard to believe. We got another room at a more quite location in the hotel and although we still felt the same noise and vibrations, the number of people passing by our door was a lot fewer and it did not disturb us much. We got a good deal that included a substantial breakfast and that would be a good reason to stay at this hotel again. AND the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Wish British hotels were as good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Justincdf
Reviews.Content: From start to finish an exceptional experience for the money. The staff were all attentive at all times. Well done such a great job in your training. Stayed over Easter weekend and have recommended this hotel to friends already . 5 stars are deserved.

Reviews.Title: “2 days in Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: lowl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days. Excellent location. Very clean and contemporary hotel. Personnel very professional and helpful. Rooms are very functional and modern , always clean. Very functional bathrooms. For me , location was perfect. One is practically at the center of a main Berlin street Ku-damm. All of the most important stores and magazines are over there. By the way , we skipped hotel breakfast, and eat at the basement ( food floor) of the magazine, next door. We also skipped on Ubahn ans S bahn. Go to tourist information, almost across a street and buy a daily transportation pass ( better deal, for us, than welcome card ). Multiple buses and especially line 100. You can see city much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Posh yet Unobtrusive”
Reviews.Author: B.G._Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Berlin over Easter weekend and we were thrilled with the hotel. The staff was incredibly respectful and unobtrusive. I know that those descriptors may seem odd, but we always knew they were there to assist yet they did not bombard us with unneeded tourist advice. The room was quite comfy, although we found the bed to be a little small for the both of us. The bar was also quite posh. As for location, this hotel is located in West Berlin. There are some great restaurants nearby, and you can shop to your heart's content in this area. Please be aware, however, that the majority of the tourist sights are in East Berlin. The train was approximately three blocks away, and a cab ride was approximately 15 euros into East Berlin. The next time we visit Berlin, we may consider staying a little closer to the main attractions. Our decision would definitely be difficult, however, given our wonderful stay at the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous service, great location”
Reviews.Author: taraonhols
Reviews.Content: We were on a tour of Germany, dashing from one place to another so you can't imagine how glad we were to find ourselves at the doorsteps of Swissotel Berlin, greeted by the most gracious doorman, in English. Everything was ace from thereon. Efficient and helpful receptionists, gorgeous interiors, spacious room... It was a lovely touch to have everything translated into English. For a foreigner in Germany who doesn't know the language, it was a relief that we need not do anymore guessing work. The staff in the hotel speaks great English too. The location is perfect, 3 minutes from Kurfürstendamm station, known as Ku'Damm to locals. That's where the shopping is. We had a few walking tours and the meeting point, Zoologischer Garten, is about 5 mins away. Internet is not free but you get free access in their lounge. I quite enjoyed sipping a cuppa whilst checking my emails in the airy lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Swissôtel Berlin ITB 2012”
Reviews.Author: AfricanProfileSafari
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise, this hotel really overshot my expectations. From the moment you arrive and attentive doorman takes your luggage and you are whipped up to the reception for check in. This went really quick with all details you completed on your booking on the internet all ready filled in so basically your signature is the only thing needed! The specifications I asked for on the internet when booking the room was 100% met, with a room towards the end in a quiet part of the hotel. Since my stay was a bit longer i got a bigger room, the bathroom and amenities is really good, with separate bath & shower. The first night I bought some antipasti from the Karstadt conveniently situated next door, and without extra charge room service provided me with cutlery and plates. The breakfast was extensive and after the first day they even remembered that I took hot chocolate and not coffee! Informal dinner was well prepared and the choices of wine (which one could taste before) was excellent. This was really one of my best stays ever in any hotel. I liked the way you could call housekeeping and receive your choice of different pillows FOC! Attention to detail, clean, perfect situated a great package!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: amtm
Reviews.Content: I should have written this before! mostly I love the location of this hotel, right on Kudamm!. I also liked how modern it is and staff are willing to please all your needs, ultra clean which is really important to us. Nice breakfast in the room, you can get really great offers on expedia which is where I booked my nights at Swisso. Would defenitely recommend this hotel for picky hotel stayers :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas_Tgb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Swissotel Berlin. Service was as what you would expect of any 5-star hotel, but concierge counter was not manned all the time (same as the ground floor reception). The need to pay for internet access also marred the experience slightly. Clean and comfortable room with a great view of the Kurfürstendamm, but room size could have been slightly bigger (our room was odd in shape with a central divider serving as the wardrobe). Overall, still a satisfying experience at the Swissotel Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Max92
Reviews.Content: Maybe because we asked for (and got) courtyard rooms on a high floor, but I have never had such a quiet room in any hotel. The hotel is also fantastically clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and courteous. I booked directly with the hotel, and the non-refundable advance rate was unbeatable value. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: bertie2
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel. We stayed for 3 nights midweek and the hotel did seem rather quiet. We had a 10th outwardly/street facing room which was great because I am happy to watch the world go by from the nearly floor to ceiling windows. Even the bathroom has two floor to ceiling windows so you could like in the bath and watch the skyline. The only challenge was that because it was the top floor there was a lip on the roof which obscured the skyline unless you were standing on the window base/sill. Our room was on the curve of the building and we though it rather small. You could not adequately walk around the bed without climbing over the chair. The chair itself did not have a foot stool like other rooms because frankly it wouldn't fit I expect. The Nespresso Coffee is a nice addition but the lack of alternatives such as hot chocolate and tea was dissapointing. The Staff were great, helpful and friendly as you might expect from a five star hotel. We had a room only rate and did not have breakfast in the hotel because frankly at €21 for an American Breakfast is too expensive and so is a €14 continental. I gave the hotel a 4 out of 5 because of 3 things only. The size of the room, charging €12.50 per 24hours of internet and the pillows* *They give you 4 pillows on the bed but I would think that you would need 8 pillows to have it, in any way, emulate an actual normal pillow. You do get a pillow menu but they are for anti allergy and neck support pillows. They didn't offer "standard" pillows. I had to use the chair cushion and on the last night the dressing gown to support my head. I have attached pictures of our room and view. Location is great dependant on your needs. There are a number of places around the lunch and evening meals, the transport links like all of Berlin are superb(U-Bahn,S-Bahn and R-Bahn). Shopping is right on your doorstep. Take a trip to KaDaWe(Europes largest Department Store). Would we return? Yes but we would like to maybe stay around the Mitte district next.

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: broomie
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is a classic noughties minimalist hotel built in a very high quality. Staff are extremely kind and professional- I asked for an early check-in for Monday in an email Sunday afternoon- they responded and hav mananaged that I am able to check in at 1130! Athough at first the room was on a lower floor, at my request they moved me into a higher one- where the view is indeed better. In any case, if you have the budget to stay there, do stay in the Ku'damm view rooms as the internal courtyard is quite sterile to look at. The room is very comfortable, with big desk and a very comfy lounge bed to do your reading. The gym is indeed on the small sidebut with ample cardio rooms. Maybe the only little downsize is the breakfast- at 21 Euro i would have appreciated a little more attantion to detail (melon cuttings included raw bits, the swiss bircher musli was quite poor and the quality of pastries was also mediocre)- these are minor things, but this is a hotel aiming to be in the top bracket..... For anyone in a business trip or a weekend getaway with a focus on the West side, this is a very good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra K
Reviews.Content: A good choice for anyone who likes comfort. I chose this hotel because of its good reputation and it didn't disappoint me. The food was incredibly delicious. The staff were so friendly and helpful that I felt almost at home. The hotel is clean and it's a pleasure to walk its tastfully decorated corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: havenrules
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 4 day trip at the Swissotel Berlin and have to thank them for the fantastic service we received. We stayed in the standard room which was more than big enough for 2 people. The double bed was in fact 2 beds together but that only made it really big and we found it/them comfortable. The storage space in some hotel rooms is poor but not so at the Swissotel. There were plenty of drawers, a sizeable wardrobe and space to hang coats etc, as well as adequate storage space for the suitcases. The cleaning of the room was spot-on and the housekeeping worked extremely hard in the rooms and around the public areas. The staff on reception, the doormen and especially the bar staff were a real credit to the company - they couldn't do enough for you. A special thank you to the 2 males on duty in the bar who gave us information about getting to the Olympic Stadium and Potsdam. They went off to get us accurate details on travelling by S Bahn and as a result we had a great visit. They seemed to work long hours in the bar area but didn't rush anyone. The company obviously have taken on the criticisms in some reviews as the Wifi in the reception was free to us and we didn't have to pay to print off our boarding passes. My husband used the fitness centre several times and felt that the equipment there was of a very good standard. We both used the sauna and there are plenty of towels, dressing gowns and slippers to use afterwards. We went out each day and either walked or used our Berlin Welcome Cards to visit lots of the sites, and coming back to this hotel at the end of a tiring day still made us feel that the enjoyable experience didn't end when we were in our room. Like others we didn't eat in the hotel as we wanted to visit different restaurants and felt that if the breakfast was 21 Euros then the meals in Restaurant 44 would probably be very expensive as well. We managed to get a deal - stay 3 nights get the 4th free so overall we felt it was well worth it. The location is very near the transport terminus so it is easy to get out and about, however most historical sites aren't that close. There is excellent shopping in the locality which I particularly enjoyed, not so sure my husband did! We would go again to a Swissotel if they are all as good as this one. It was the icing on the cake for a very enjoyable first trip to Germany. Thank you to all the hard working staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jameskc_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Christmas. The location is great - a couple of minutes walk fromthe tube station from which travelling all over the city is easy.The hotel was immaculate and the service we encountered from the reception staff was fantastic - the best we have recieved at any hotel. They could not have been more helpful. The room service and housekeeping staff also provided an excellent service. The room service breakfast was huge - one was enough for two people. The room has a good coffee maker, the only thing I could say to improve would be to provide more milk! The staff bought to our room a lovely little complimentary nut/sweet dish to celebrate Christmas. The room was spacious, clean and the bath was sooo deep! We used the computer/internet they provide for use free of charge in reception to print our return tickets - very useful! Overall, we had a great stay and would not hesitate to stay at a Swissotel again on the basis of our excellent stay at the Swissotel Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could wish for to support you!”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: I attended a two day conference recently of Europes top telecommunication management and the selection of the Swisshotel in Berlin could not have been better, the meeting held was over two days, about 100 people from across EMEA and from the moment of arrival they really looked after all my and the other attendees wishes. The event was amazingly well organised by an organisation called VelocityRDT as they laid on an evening tour of Berlin on a historic bus, followed by dinner and drinks (unlimited local brew beers) in the old east german part of Berlin. The 2nd day was filled with meetings, and the hotel set the rooms up, and then arranged a fantastic lunch in their 44 restaurant, also the location for breakfasts....again amazing. There is a large lounge area, free wifi in these zones, a good sized bar, and separate coffee bar. The rooms are excellent, very good standard, with a nespresso coffee maker, full bar, air con that works...oh and being a Brit.. Sky news! Well done Swissotel, you think of the Brits! People have said the beds are hard, sure, but they have mattress toppers and a pillow menu...selection of about 6 types, great bathroom, separate shower. Check in was swift, the receptionist came to the lift to demo the pass card to work the lift, simple touch but effective. Everyone you met from the waiter to the room maids welcomed you and it felt as though they ment it. Special mention to Miriam and Thomas from the management and Romy from the catering staff who was exceptionally efficient. I don't often give top marks to hotels, but these guys deserved it, and earns it and above all the prices did not break the bank! I'd book again without fail, the conference meeting was excellent and the area where the hotel is positioned is perfect! Well done all, excellent trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. The hotel is very modern, very clean and is in central Berlin. The staff are extremely helpful. Will definitely stay here again. Only slight issue is that Wifi wasn't free in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying at the Swissotel every year”
Reviews.Author: keschpo
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel was 3 years ago. My flight was cancelled and the hotel I was at did not have availability. I stayed at the Swissotel one night and now I come back every March. The rooms are decent size and always clean. They beds are very firm but they offer feather beds if you want a softer mattress. In the morning they have an amazing breakfast buffet with eggs to order. Great service in the dining room, concierge and lovely front desk staff. If I had to give one criticism it wold be the fitness center which is pretty lame. Highly recommend the Swissotel. I already made my reservation for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, great location in the centre of the shopping centre. The staff are amazing bend over backwards for you. The room we were on the executive level and couldn't fault it, even though the actual executive room was closed for a refurb. We had room service on many occassions and once it was cold, we called and our food was changed very quickly.There is a pillow menu, make sure you make the most of it! There is a coffee machine but if you are like me and only drink tea then just call reception and they will bring you up a kettle! We stayed here for the new year celebrations and they were also amazing, the street party was great. A bit of a nightmare trying to get home, but what do you expect when 1.2million peole leave the place at the same time!! Anyways all in all we will definately be backto this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying here!”
Reviews.Author: FoodieNL
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is great. I was there for business, ITB 2012, and this was the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and will be back again next year. The rooms are spacious, the location is fantastic and breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “Time to plan another visit!”
Reviews.Author: maggieholder
Reviews.Content: Before I plan my next trip to Berlin I always call the hotel to speak with Timo Baudisch, Conceierge Dept. who always goes "the distance" to help with my requests. Kai, in the front office always has a pleasant word and we get welcomed back every year like an old friend with good to see you again M/M Holder. I do not book my plane tix till I get hotel confirmation for availability. Yes, there are many wonderful hotel in the city, but Swissotel Berlin is perfect for us. The rooms well designed, the food, especially at breakfast well prepared and delicious. However, the staff is at the top of our list. Thank you one and all and Bob and I look forward to seeing all of you again in October.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: A hotel which truly deserves its excellent reviews. It's in a fantastic location for shopping and public transport and very close to an underground station. The rooms are fairly large and very well equipped with an excellent bathroom. The staff are knowledgeable and extremely helpful and friendly, nothing seems to be too much trouble. The continental breakfast is the best I've ever had and is set at a reasonable price for the quality. My husband and I booked a meal in the restaurant which was wonderful. The only (very small) downside is that Wifi is only free in the lobby. When we visit Berlin again we will certainly book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: located along the Ku'damm with easy access to shopping and a short walk to KaDeWe. The hotel offers outstanding service, polite staff and comfortable and modern rooms. There are a number of great restaurants conveniently located

Reviews.Title: “We are staying there every year”
Reviews.Author: LondonAsa_2
Reviews.Content: It's really lovely hotel in a great location if you are willing to stay near Kurfursterdamm. We stay there every year with my husband to be close to the Christmas Market. The rooms are fair size nad nicely decorated. You also git nice coffe machine in your room. Very nice and always welcoming staff. Last year we also got an upgrade mainly becasue we visit regurarly. I remember breakfast to be quite good too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: EllenB933
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a 3 night/ 4 day trip to Berlin and stayed at the Swissotel. The Swissotel is located at an ideal location if you enjoy shopping but is also very near to several bus (including hop on/off), train and tube stations so you can explore the rest of the city. We thought staff at the Swissotel were very professional, friendly and accommodating. We received a free upgrade and were given lots of help to find our way around the city. One night we ordered in room service, which was top notch! The room was spacious (standard room) and had a mini bar and Nespresso machine (unfortunately we don't drink coffee, but nice anyway). The (bath) room was clean and had some handy 'extras' like iron, hair dryer and flat screen TV. The bed was spacious although a bit too firm but we were able to order a mattress cover. The TV had free Sky but there were only 4 English channels. We would have liked to pay for some films of our choice but they didn't have 'pay per view'. We didn't use a laptop in our room but were able to use the Internet for free in the lobby. We have been to many European capitals but we felt Berlin was the most relaxed capital of all, we've had a great time and I am sure staying at the Swissotel has contributed to this experience! :-)

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: honey-jac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend to for my 30th Birthday. The hotel and their staff were lovely and did everything they could to make our stay amazing. Breakfast was lovely and we wil be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripReporter177
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is located very centrally right at the Kurfürstendamm, also called Kudamm by the Germans. There is a subway stop right next to the hotel, so it is very easy to get around by local transport. The room I stayed in was not realy spacious, but okay - and there was a Nespresso machine in the room, so one could have fresh, well-tasting coffee at any time. Breakfast is great, there is a large variety of food to chose from, and waiters are very attentive. There is also a wellness area which is okay.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: TheShis
Reviews.Content: Considered as one of the best hotels in Berlin, this hotel did not disappoint. We got an outrageously good deal and spent 4 nights at the hotel. Our room was absolutely great, with comfy beds, coffe machine and a good turndown service. The hotel is within a walking distance from the famous Kaiser-Wilhelm church, Kranzler café and a good set of shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TCAC1
Reviews.Content: Little to add that hasn't been said, but need to review as an acknowledgement of how well they do it! Lobby, rooms, service, breakfast, lighting, pillows, bed views- really an excellent, professional hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi would be the 5th *”
Reviews.Author: JustGiveMeAirCon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent and I would have given it 5*s were it not for the lack of free (or even reasonable) wifi throughout the hotel. It should be an absolute basic but it is way overpriced, apart from the free wifi in the lobby. Otherwise the beds are sooo comfortable, with a great and it's a perfect location for restaurants, bars, transport & shops. The staff were helpful, friendly and gave us a great upgrade to a Ku'damm view room (although the breakfast staff could do with checking for coffee orders a little more). The breakfast is fantastic and there's loads of it.

Reviews.Title: “My best location in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sivskatan
Reviews.Content: Immaculate service, good breakfast and extremely good location. The lobby and the bar - lovely! Very very good value for money compared to other cities, however the interesting architecture doesn't make for good sleep when it's windy outside! I stayed on the 8th floor but was kept awake by people screaming in the street (it was a Wednesday night) AND the wind playing with the geometries of the outside (curved building). The beds are also very hard - Ilike it, but I guess some people might find them a bit on the hard side. Complimentary Nespresso coffee (every room has a machine) of nice variety was just what I needed when I arrived late in the afternoon. Other from this, most rooms are quite plain for being a five star hotel, but they serve their purpose.

Reviews.Title: “High class service and really good breakfast, boring rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveloholicman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was thought of being offices but during one of the crisis the office was tourned out to be a hotel. The rooms are quite regular compared to other similar in Berlin. But their hospitality is perfect and they serve a breakfast in their restaurant worth waiting for, suits my personal thoughts, good really youghurts, good bread and cold cuts as well as omelettes and cook to order.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annabibs
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant, the service is first class and the rooms are very nice. The breakfast has everything you could imagine and the lounge area is great. We had a wonderful stay - very helpful concierge and staff all around.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: livinginthefjords
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed the big sized clean rooms, wery friendly staff, delicious food and the perfect location. We will definitely come back:-)

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: AdhisheshS
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Swissotel to celebrate our last weekend and it was a tremendous experience from the word GO. The location of the hotel is great. Bang on the shopping district of Berlin, the Kurfurstendamm, the hotel is only a 5 minutes walk from the station of the same name & a 7 minute walk from the Zooligscher Garden station. There are city tour buses, that start from 100m from the hotel. You can choose between a whole city tour bus or whether you want to see only the east/west side of Berlin. The hotel is also very close from one of the good museums in Berlin - The Story of Berlin. There are immense shopping options on the street next to the hotel, with flagship stores of Germany specific brands like Jack Wolfskin. Our check in was around afternoon. The welcoming staff on the front desk was brilliant. One noticeable thing was the separation of responsibilities. The front desk and the concierge was separate. The concierge handles all the touristy information requests and the front desk pays all attention to the fact that their guest is checked in with all warmth and brilliance. We dealt with Benjamin on the front desk and right from the way he spoke to the way he showed us to our room was simply wonderful. The interior of the hotel is strikingly beautiful. The lobby has warm color schemes and has a soothing effect on your eyes. The room was perfect for a couple. Good lighting, great view of the Kurfurstendamm, the elite shopping street of Berlin. There was a expresso coffee machine and the presentation of the variety of coffee in a leather box was superb. Unlike many hotels in Germany, this one had english channels on the menu and that was an added advantage. The cleanliness of the rooms was super and so was the bathroom. The room service was exceptional. We had a little issue with the coffee maker and we had a person on our door within 5 minutes of our call. The hotel also has a luggage room for those who dont want to pay for an extra night but are touring the hotel during the day. We didnt even have to carry and drop our luggage to the luggage room. The guy serving us on the check out asked us to leave it right where we were standing and the rest was taken care of. The staff is also very prompt in rolling out a Berlin city map in front of you as soon as you have a question and they would make sure that they marked the ways and locations on the map for you to carry around. There are many restaurants around the Swissotel. One that deserves a mention is an Italian joint called the Vapiano, right across the street. The food is great, is served freshly cooked in front of you and is the most comfortable, if you want to just walk out of the hotel to grab a bite. The only downside is, its a self service restaurant. (Also, that it is very full all the time, so dont be very assured of a seat immediately). The only thing that stopped us from rating it excellent instead of Very Good is the cellphone reception at the hotel. We could not make any calls while we were at the hotel, neither did the internet on our phones work, even when there were full signal bars. There was free wifi at the reception which was a good thing but we had to make calls from the hotel phone and it was quite expensive. All in all, the Swissotel was a treat. It was one of the best hotels that we have stayed at. Both thumbs go up for this fantastic hotel & stupendous service!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Sljamesuk
Reviews.Content: Booked into the swissotel on my boyfriends birthday and was immediately offered an upgrade which we kindly accepted! Lady that served us at reception was brilliant and couldn't have been more attentive - even showing us up to our room!!! Hotel inside is lovely and room was perfect size for a couple - added bonus was a couple of English channels on the TV for when we came in at night and the expresso machine for the morning! In terms of location the hotel was about a twenty minute train ride away from the airport (going to the zoo bahn) and five minute walk from the station to the hotel. Subway station was just round the corner so was easy to travel about, and if you fancy a cheap bus tour (without the guide) jump on the 100 bus outside the zoo bahn station and they will take you round all the sites on the price of a bus ticket. Don't make the same mistake as us and think the 200 will take you on the same route - it doesn't and takes a lot longer (we almost missed out flight jumping on it!). The only point i would make about location is that we said next time it would be nice to stay on the east side - the location was good for shopping but the historical sites were all on the east! Make sure you try the Italian restaurant across the road!! Brilliant - take a card when you arrive from the front desk then go to the pizza or pasta counter of your choice, pick what you want and see it made in front of you. You can then go back as many times as you like just putting the food on your card! Brilliant idea and the food was gorgeous and obviously fresh!!! Also on the subject of food we had room service for breakfast every day and it was cheaper than the 20 odd euros it is to go downstairs to the main breakfast room. Obviously you don't get the choice but if you don't eat much or are lazy like us its an option to be considered! Overall this hotel is fantastic and Berlin is a fantastic city to visit. We were amazed at how helpful everyone was to us - we got lost on a numerous number of occasions and we always found someone to direct back on the right route! Thank you Berlin and swissotel for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, nespesso nice touch”
Reviews.Author: Bobmagee
Reviews.Content: good location very close to k'dam subway station and short walk to zoo garden station. walking distance to several good restaurants eg the Austrian "Ottenthal"

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kate67usa
Reviews.Content: Good: Great location close to the Gedaechnisskirche, very clean, nice rooms, hotel bar makes great cocktails (try the Swimmimng pool !), friendly service. Not so great: Rooms are relatively small, you can occasionally hear traffic noise at night time

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable City Break”
Reviews.Author: barnes750230
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin as I had a week off work and felt like a bit of sightseeing. I stayed in a classic room on the sixth floor for three nights. All the staff that I encountered from check-in to room service to check-out were professional and efficient. The location of the hotel is fantastic, great for shopping and dining but also for transport links. A visit to the food-hall at the department store KaDeWe (five minute walk away) is a must, I could have eaten everything! The room was spot on with a comfortable bed (with pillow menu) and refreshing rain shower. Only downsides were my laptop did not fit in the in-room safe and the window howled when the wind blew. I loved Berlin, but it's a big city, my feet hurt when I got back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: GenerallyWandering
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, well functioning with a great location. Maybe not the most spectacular rooms designwise, they could do with some personal touch or modernization - but nothing to complain about. Good location with easy access to subways and taxis. Helpful staff and a good atmosphere (not too posh as the Adlon, or too tourist-crowded as some of the Hiltons)

Reviews.Title: “fine but businessy and sparse”
Reviews.Author: TobyAndEleanor
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very helpful and the lobby is attractive, but the high rating on TripAdvisor made me expect more. The rooms are very small and strangely lacking in amenities: no clock of any kind, no DVD player or game machine, no iron, no radio or ipod player, tiny TV. Also, there is no free wifi, even in the lobby, and the daily rate to buy it is outrageous. There are a couple of iMacs in the lobby you can use if no one else is on them. My impression is that the hotel is aimed at business travel so it doesn't have any extras in the rooms. Also, the street noise can be quite loud, even in the middle of the night and several floors up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, best location , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Steph181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel from December 26 till December 30. The location of the hotel cannot be beaten (near main shopping centers and the Zoo). The Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful on any request we had. Breakfast was rich and abundance. We recommend this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KNW01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of 2011 for 3 nights, based on Trip Advisor reviews. We flew into Tegel and got the X09/109 bus (using a 72 hour travel pass for 21 Euro that covers metro/trams as well) into the Zoo Garden and walked down to the hotel from there, which took about 5 mins. The Hotel is on the Kurfürstendamm, but the entrance is just around the corner. As well as being close the the Zoo Garden which is a main travel hub with buses and the S-Bahn & U-Bahn lines the hotel is right near the Kurfürstendamm U-Bahn station. This made the hotel an excellent place to explore the city as you can basically get anywhere. The hotel is nice but I think like a few of the other reviews it is a bit non-descript. All the staff were excellent, really helpful and spoke good English. On check in were were given a tourist map and pointed to the main sights. There were a few nice touches like the Nespresso machine in the room, the pillow menu, ability to get a soft mattress topper (as the beds are on the hard side) and one of our favourites - on New Years morning there was a member of staff dressed as a nurse giving out hangover cures just outside the breakfast restaurant! We were able to get a late check out for no extra charge. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each morning, this was a buffet but you could also order certain fresh items. Buffet was a good variety from continental cold meat/cheese, croissants/bread, cereals/fruit through to scrambled eggs/bacon etc. Again staff in the restaurant were excellent. One thing we were disappointed at was the lack of free wifi 10 Euro per days was charged which is a lot in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad pillows!”
Reviews.Author: NushNushandBooBoo
Reviews.Content: This is a good solid high four star hotel. Best points are the outstandingly warm and thoughtful service - all the staff we encountered were outstanding. Fitness suite is nice and immaculately maintained while the location is good for west Berlin's shops and for transport links to the east. Room was fine. Really nice bathroom, oddly-configured bedroom but fine once you got used to it. Bed was disappointing - hard bed and the worst pillows we'd ever slept on, which is ironic for a hotel where the rooms come with a pillow menu! We ended up sleeping on four each, but they still felt like they gave as much support as an old sock

Reviews.Title: “more than 50 stays at the swissotel berlin”
Reviews.Author: Exploration-2day
Reviews.Content: why is that? it is because, this is the best contemporary style 5 star hotel in the berlin "city west" at a great value. as a bonus you get one of the best restaurants (44), made famous thru it's former chef, tim raue, who now has his own restaurant. try the business lunch. enjoy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: hobara
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Swissotel for 4 nights recently and the experience was absolutely faultless. From the moment we arrived the staff went the extra mile in the level of service provided. The receptionist actually took us on a guided tour of the ground floor facilities. And each day the concierge took the time out to provide friendly and useful advice on what to do. The location is ideal, with all destinations a nearby train ride away. Rooms was a good size with a welcome Nespresso machine. Would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on Kurfurstendam”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4.5 star business or leisure hotel in West Berlin Likes -Location: On Kurfurstendam, Berlin's main shopping street. It's 1-minute walk to Kurfurstendam subway station and 4-minute walk to Zoological Gardens train station -Numerous restaurants around, including a Vapiano across the street -Coffee machine -Kurfurstendam view (worth paying extra) -Housekeeping was of very high standards. The room looked absolutely perfect everyday -Pillow menu (I wrote down what I wanted and they all magically appeared in my room when I got back. It's effortless) -Bed was a little hard but it became super comfortable once I requested a mattress topper Dislikes -None really Tips -Internet is 12.5€ per day -Kurfurstendam view is much nicer than the courtyard view

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Travels_with_Em
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during a 2 week trip to Germany. There's nothing that we could have wished for to improve this hotel - reception staff were very friendly and knowledgeable (Benjamin in particular was outstanding, offering us an orientation on a map as soon as we checked in, and great restaurant recommendations), our room was spacious and kept meticulously clean and tidy during our stay, there was free wifi in the lobby (and access to computers in the lobby if required)... The location was great (a 5 minute walk from the zoo s-bahn and just a few stops away from the hofbahnhof). We've never stayed at a Swissotel hotel enforce but our excellent experience in Berlin will mean we'll certainly consider staying at other Swisshotel establishments in the future!

Reviews.Title: “So happy, we are going back!”
Reviews.Author: Bex9142
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after a recommendation on Trip Advisor. We were a little apprehensive as neither of us had stayed here before but could not have had a more enjoyable stay. We arrived and the staff were amazing. My German is not fanatastic but the staff spoke perfect English and infomed us that due to a festival they wanted to offer us a room on a higher floor so we wouldn't be diturbed by possible noise. We accepted the room change and were moved to one of the top floors. The view was amazing and the although rooms are of a moderate size, they had utilised the space very well with clever storage spaces. The bathroom was beautiful with a bath right next to the window so you can look at the fantastic views of the Kurfurstendam. The food within the restaurant was very nice although we only had breakfast as there are many wonderful places to eat in Berlin. As you leave the hotel, you are straight onto the Kurfurstendam. We had walked straight into Berlins Gay Parade and it was fantastic. The whole street was crammed with floats, music, beer stalls, entertainment and colour. We spent the whole day watching the entertainment and sampling the food and beer from the stalls. You are very well situated from this hotel. The subway is directly accross the road and the you are on the main shopping street with the Charlottenburg Palaces just up the road. The tour buses also stop about 10 metres from the front entrance. We returned to the hotel and enquired if we could get tickets for a show, which they gladly organised together with a taxi. Overall the service was second to none, the food was fresh and the room was tasteful, well structured and with great views. I recommend this hotel so much that we are returning there in a couple of weeks for another weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “First class!”
Reviews.Author: blackeyes
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit after some 10 years and I have to say that standards have not slipped and that the service is as good as ever. We asked for tea making equipment for the room and it was delivered immediately as were extra pillows and a mattress topper. We also had a problem with the safe and we had the maintenance man in the room within minutes of asking - nothing was too much trouble and everything was delivered with a smile. The room was large (top floor as requested), very quiet, good standard of decor and furnishings. Bathroom was ideal with good towels and plenty of toiletries. excellent shower too and a good hairdryer in the closet. As for breakfast - wow!!!! Such an array of fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, compotes, baked goods, hot food, cold cuts, smoked salmon, cheeses - the list goes on. Constantly replenished and excellent quality. You could also order hot egg dishes . I cannot fault the hotel for anything and would highly recommend for a vist to Berlin - excellent location too. There is a good Italian restaurant called Avanti around the corner to the left of the entrance - good food, nice atmosphere and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: There is little that I can add to the many reviews already on here. The hotel lived up to its expectations and was very enjoyable. One evening we dined in the lobby bar area and it was good. Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and a decent size, though not huge as one review states. Perhaps the only disappointment is that the hotel has no swimming pool, which is unusual for a hotel of this calibre. There was a small gym and sauna - which we tried, but a pool would have been welcome. There is a C&A on the ground floor of the hotel which was good! Finally, breakfast was nothing short of excellent with anything and everything you could ever wish for. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, close to the action and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TorontoPoppy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just around the corner from fabulous shopping! We stayed at hotel for three nights and the service was helpful and friendly. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable and the coffee machine was super. Super close to U and S trains making it easy to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Coffee Machine, Honest Staff”
Reviews.Author: DimKat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and everything was very nice. Our room was looking in the internal of the building and is was one of the largest we have stayed. Everything was extremely well calculated - even the tiles in the bathroom was exactly matched - and well organized. A special touch was the coffee machine (free of charge) that we used in order to relax, when returning back to the hotel. Finally, when the staff accidentally spilled one of our friend's cosmetic, they left an apology note and then they went and replaced it (bought exactly the same brand) with a new one. Location is excellent if you want to see West Berlin, however East Berlin has all the major sites (so, for Berlin sightseeing, loses one point) but this is subjective.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: AllyMcP8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights. It is right beside the Hard Rock Cafe and a fun beer hall! There are lots of Christmas markets and shops in this vicinity too. The rooms are excellent - clean and new. Bathroom brilliant - lovely big bath tub and powerful shower and extras like cotton wool, nail files, shampoo, etc provided. Bathrobes and slippers also provided and different pillow choice options. We didn't avail of breakfast in hotel but had cocktails at the bar on our last night. Very pricey but well made and served along with delicious nibbles. Only one negative - no free WIFI in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for two nights from the 9th to the 11 December 2011. My friend and I found a great deal on Groupon to stay at the hotel and I cannot fault their staff, location or accommodation. All of the staff were polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was delicious. The location is perfect, just next to an Underground station and a short walk from great bars and restaurants. As soon as we arrived we felt welcome and I would definitely recommend this hotel. I am looking forward to returning there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: RichD1975
Reviews.Content: As chain hotels go, this is a tremendous place. Clean, quiet, wonderfully professional staff - the lady who checked me in gave me a 3-minute "initiation" walk-around of the sort you'd expect from the very 5-star type of places. Comfortable bed, spotless room, nice buffet breakfast. Would not hesitate to recommend. No wonder it rates so highly in Berlin on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Swissotel Berlin for few nights while visiting Berlin. Hotel is Well located next to Kudam, Zoo, KaDeWe, ... And it takse only 15 minutes from airport with Taxi (~15€). The strange thing is that you get in from the 1st floor and there is nothing else than a small desk and two elevators and hopefully a doorman :-) Actual check in, concierge, restaurants +++ are on the second floor and at least the attitude of my reception was exceptional. I was greeted very warmly and felt like coming home even it was my first time there. I stayed on the 9th floor (10 max) and at least there it was very quiet drink the night (except the zircon had some strange noises on the first night). I liked good size bathtub, good bathrobe, great coffee-machine, free shoe-shining and well working ironing. On the other hand TV could have been bigger, english-spekaing channels were only few there and breakfast is quite an expensive one (21 €) if it's not included. Internet connection is not free which was a disappointing (there are two MAC:s with printers for free to use behind Concierge). Breakfast was great - Ask waffles or omelets of your style...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and City!”
Reviews.Author: mspL4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 3 nights at Berlin's Swissotel with my wife for our Anniversary and I must say that I'm glad I spent some time on here first before choosing one of the many hotels in Berlin. The Swissotel in Berlin is the best hotel I've ever stayed in, the location was great, literally 5 minutes walk from the train station in the City Centre, the staff couldn't have been more accommodating, the room was second to none, (corner room with fantastic views of the City) the facilities were top notch and the on-site restaurant and cocktail bar were first class. Upon our arrival and check-in the guy on the desk offered us the possibility of keeping our room until 4pm on our departure date as we had a late evening flight, we gladly accepted and expected there to be some charge for this but when it came to checking out we were pleasantly surprised to find that they hadn't charged us any extra for this. That attention to detail set the benchmark for the whole break and I'm pleased to say that Swissotel staff didn't falter on this once. We sought the knowledge of Swissotel staff frequently whether it be for directions or a recommendation for a specific type of restaurant and they never let us down. Both myself and my wife would definitely return to Berlin and would definitely stay in the Swissotel. I'd recommend it to anyone. I noticed that there is a Swissotel in Amsterdam, as my Wife and I frequent Amsterdam once a year we will be looking to stay there instead of our usual Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sbuerger
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be better, polite and friendly service, elegant decor, nice room view,free refils expresso machine in room, fast wifi, major atractions nearby, perfect public transport around.

Reviews.Title: “best ever”
Reviews.Author: Asa522
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, great service, great room. wonderful breakfast, very good location

Reviews.Title: “Great City ,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: popeye9
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night break in Berlin for the first time - and my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed both. The City is fascinating and really attractive for a capital city ; the transport system is second to none.The atmosphere everywhere was relaxed and friendly - and the cleanliness was alarming. The hotel's location was very good - and its rooms and staff were both of a very high standard.They were always very helpful. As we had an evening flight we were even allowed to keep our room until 4.00.p.m.The breakfasts were excellent - and snacks at the bar were also of a good quality. We would definitely visit again - both city and hotel - and would like to spend more time in nearby Potsdam - a beautiful town.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended when staying in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox007
Reviews.Content: Location: Ideally located in the old city center very close to Kürfürstendamm. Underground parking at the hotel is possible. If you travel by public transport take the airport bus to Bahnhof Zoo, which is also easily accesible by bus. Front desk: Friendly and efficient. Room: Spacious room that fulfills all needs. Clean bath. Breakfast: Good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: cmdpc
Reviews.Content: A brand new, clean and modern hotel. Lovely bathroom. 2 free internet PCs, helpful desk. Close to zoo which is a hub of Berlin Transportation. In front of a nice inexpensive Italian restaurant and close to a supermarket. A great room service. Plus a Nespresso machine in the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Eilis7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a city break 20/11/2011, the hotel, location, staff, bedroom and breakfast fabulous, what more can i say......lives up to all the reviews

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - small room”
Reviews.Author: JMMcE
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swisshotel for three nights in mid-November 2011. Well located hotel on the Ku'damm, very friendly and efficient staff, lovely clean, well run and aesthically pleasing hotel and great breakfast - better than the Swisshotel Stamford which I stayed in in September. However, for a five star hotel I felt the room was small and it was further dis-appointing in that we paid extra for a Ku'damm view but the external architecture of the hotel which includes large pillars crossing the windowscape substantially obstructed any kind of panaoramic view from the wall to wall windows. The bed was extremely comfortable and while our pillows were not good we can only blame ourselves as there was a "pillow menu" beside the bed which we did not avail of. Nevertheless, it was good value altho' for travelling on a leisure trip I would recommend the Mercure which has larger rooms and is better located for the museums and art galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LizardAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Easy access to major U stations and impressive shopping. The room is a good size, clean and nice. The internet is very expensive and they don't have free service in the lobby (yet). The breakfast buffet is great and impressive. Great place to stay for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gusm007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for Shops, u bahn, and s bahn is a short walk. Staff were very friendly and helpful Its not as plush as the Ritz Carlton or the Schwiezerhoff but good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GeoDevon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on 4 occasions and it just gets better. I do not think there can be much better service in any hotel. Rooms are spacious, modern and sound-proofed. Breakfasts are a treat. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Book without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Lullip
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Berlin and were extremely impressed by the Swissotel. We had booked the hotel based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor but they simply do not do the hotel justice. The hotel staff are exceptional and although we had minimum interaction without staff on the whole, each member of staff was friendly and welcoming. What we liked: The hotel is in an excellent location and was easy to find. It is on one of the main streets in West Berlin for shopping and evening entertainment. We were very lucky that upon arrival, we were upgraded to a room with a stunning view of Kurfurstendamm which was in the middle of it's light festival, but similar views can be admired from the hotel's restaurant. The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from a major S and U barn station (Zoological Garten) which made it incredibly cheap and easy to travel to and from the airport and popular sights around the city. Unlimited travel of trains and buses were 6 euro but we got unlimited travel and discounted entries to sights using a "Welcome to Berlin" pass which was purchased at the airport on arrival for 72 hours for 25 euros instead. The rooms are well sized, with excellent amenities including espresso maker, quality hairdryer etc. I was impressed with small touches including a personalised welcome note and the provision of those little things that we may forget from charging adapters and cotton wool pads to miniature chocolates. The pillow menu was an excellent addition and I only wish I could have taken the pillow home with me! We only ordered from room service in terms of food and this was OK. It came swiftly and again was accompanied by excellent service. The overall standard was excellent and the rooms were clean, airy and easy to get up to your optimum temperature. Areas for improvement: My only gripe with this hotel, as with other reviewers, was the internet access. I am used to getting free Wi-Fi connection at hotels that I use but had to pay 12.50 per 24 hours for internet access. I would not mind as much if it was reliable but it cut out regularly and became rather frustrating, so I did not bother to purchase further usage after the first 24 hour period lapsed. If reliable, inclusive internet access had been provided then I think this hotel would be perfect! I would more than recommend others to stay at this hotel, in fact I would actively encourage others to stay here as you will not be disappointed and I strongly feel that this hotel deserves to be lavished with praise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: CharlieLola34
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights recently and found the hotel to be of very high standard. The staff were very extremely friendly & hospitable. The hotel is situated around a main shopping street but it was also very close to the U-bahn to explore Berlin. The rooms were fairly plain in comparison to the hotel lobby and exquisite artwork dotted throughout, the faultless service made up for it. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as the price seemed a little excessive and there are many cafes to go and eat in near proximity. The bar served the most divine cocktails and again wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel... but strange bed!”
Reviews.Author: CJMANUK
Reviews.Content: As you'd expect from a Swissotel, this place is of a very high standard. The staff exude professionalism and friendliness, and really make you feel very welcome. I definitely would recommend this hotel although I think it is clearly tailored more for the business traveller than the tourist. The breakfast is very expensive and a la carte - and this was not included in the room price we had. The restaurant is top-end - real fine dining - with prices to match. Our standard room was spacious, and had a bath and a shower, which is always a good thing, and the "Swiss" products (made in Canada using essential Swiss ingredients!!) in the bathroom were lovely too. Coffee-lovers are well catered for - brilliant in-room coffee maker (although the instructions were not easy to work out), although this was a slight disappointment as my other half really only likes tea in the mornings, and none was provided. My main negative about the room was the bed. I love a firm bed, but this was something else - unprecedentedly firm! it was unlike any other bed I have slept on. If you don't normally like a firm bed, then avoid the Swissotel - you will not be able to cope with it. Also strange was the fact that the duvet only just reached the edges of the bed, meaning that when 2 adults were under it, it was really too small. After our first night, I told reception who were very apologetic and immediately brought up an additional duvet cover (which was certainly a solution, albeit an odd one - a duvet the right size would have been fine!). There is a gym and relaxation area with a sauna (but no steam-room or swimming pool) - and the latter is a very German affair - mixed, naked and with no changing room! The location of the Swissotel is slap-bang in the middle of the (high-street type) shops on the Ku'damm, so if shopping is a key thing for you when visiting Berlin, then the location is excellent. If however you are on your first hoilday to Berlin and want to potter round the historic old centre of Berlin, seeing the main sites, museums etc. then I would recommend instead of staying here, getting a hotel in the Mitte part of the city - eg the Hilton on Gendarmenmakt - where we have also spent a splendid weekend previously.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: Martin L
Reviews.Content: + good price + very nice sauna and restroom + executive lounge, fantastic service + nice personal + 50m to main shopping street + breakfast

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mondi61
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in Berlin! I am a big fan of the Swissotel chain, but this property exceeded all my expectations!!! I'm truly in love with it. Service is amazing, quick and top professional. Everyone smiles and is happy to help. The hotel is an example of what five star hospitality should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay - from Canada”
Reviews.Author: RivieraTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have traveled fairly extensively, except for Asia and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Being from Canada and knowing our dollar is always battling against the Euro, I would have to say for in regards to value - this place is great! I checked out some of the other hotels in the area as well, while I was amidst my 4 day stay in Berlin, and nothing will compare... many claim 4 or 5 stars- but are not by our standards in North America, I think-again, this is my opinion as the rooms are nice and modern. All of the staff at this hotel are exceptional in my opinion, whatever you want, whatever your question is - they truly deliver exceptional service - especially Tolga! He went above and beyond for my stay. But, I quickly discovered that all the staff at this hotel will all make sure your stay is perfect. From the hotel operator to the concierge - If you value your experience in Berlin and especially if you are from North America, then I would stay here.. As per European prices and standards, this hotel is a real deal!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further ....”
Reviews.Author: Lutswinnen
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel that is centrally located. Friendly and helpfull staff. Since cycling is the best way for visiting Berlin, the hotel is close to almost every attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional Hotel Indeed”
Reviews.Author: incongru
Reviews.Content: Black marble, beech wood, chrome, black leather. No, not a Volkswagen/Audi showroom, but in fact one of the smartest hotels I have stayed in for a long time. The Swissotel is 5- star in every sense of the word. It’s not just clean, it’s surgically clean. The soundproofing in the rooms is 100% perfect. The buffet breakfasts are extremely good. And you need your room card to access the (glass) elevators- a very good security feature, in my view. The staff are first rate. The hotel is just round the corner from a large pavement restaurant called the “Berliner Biersalon” where you can have breakfast, a meal or a drink and do a bit of people watching. Very close nearby is the well known Berlin landmark- the “Hollow Tooth” (Kaiser- Wilhelm- Gedachtniskirche). I couldn’t find this damaged spire.…. Turns out it is being renovated, hidden inside a huge scaffolding which looks exactly like an office block. Top tip- as stated previously – buy a Berlin Welcome Card. You won't regret it. As for the location, the Swissotel is situated right in the middle of a glitzy shopping area. So if your idea of perfection is a 2600 euro handbag, you certainly won’t have to look far. If, on the other hand, if you are more interested in cultural or historic matters a location at the other end of the Tiergarten might be more appropriate. I do not think that this hotel is near all the attractions, I say this because there is construction work on the U-bahn line U1 at the present time, and travel between Ku’dam and say, Potsdamer Platz is quite a convoluted affair. Okay the hotel is near the zoo but nearly everything else is located at the other end of the Tiergarten. As for the hotel itself , we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I have no hesitation in recommending it. It’s perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: kyle f
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The price was very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was large with a great bathroom. Parking was extra but was quite resonable. Traveled by bike while I was berlin and the hotel was close enough for all the attractions. Walking distance to many. The staff also allowed me to park my bike on the ground level, not in the parking garage which was also quite nice and convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Berlin and I will use them when I come back as well as look forward to checking out some of their other hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: imoore45
Reviews.Content: I got a decent deal in this hotel by booking very early (€155/night double room). I was not disappointed. Simply put, I haven't often had the chance to stay somewhere as plush as this hotel! The location was excellent. It's on the X9 bus route from Tegel, if you want to travel cheaply, or it's about €17 from the airport direct. The check-in was warm and welcoming. I couldn't fault the service. I was there for the marathon and Susanne, Tge manager who checked me in explained what facilities they had laid on for the runners. This including an excellent pasta buffet on the night before, and early breakfast, flexible sauna hours and even directions for short prep runs in Tiergarten. The hotel itself is modern, quiet and very comfortable. There was some road noise on the Sat night but you'd expect that in any city. Earplugs were employed! One quibble: no free wifi for the laptop. An unbelievable thing in modern hotel! However, swissotel made up for this totally by agreat continental breakfast and even letting me take a shower after I'd checked out but had gotten rather hot and bothered on a cycle tour before a flight! Super hotel. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good staff”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: 1. Location: in the heart of West Berlin. This is either a positive or negative depending on what you are looking for. It is not going to be the hip part of Berlin, but it is clean, nice, and relaxed. Multiple public transit options are nearby, so it is easy to get wherever in Berlin (though it is a big city and you are definitely a little way from good areas in the former East Berlin). In all, this is a fine location for anybody, but especially good if you are traveling with kids or not as interested in the more energetic, but grittier parts of Berlin. As long as TXL is open this location is good for getting to or from TXL both by public transit and also by taxi (it is pretty cheap taxi ride as TXL is on the western side of the city) 2. Staff: didn't have to interact with them much, but they seemed very friendly. 3. Rooms/lobby: very nice and modern inside the hotel. Lobby is very sleek, and though slightly strange that you have to take an elevator up a level to get to the lobby, this does make it feel much calmer in the lobby, which is probably what they were going for. The rooms aren't huge, but are a decent size for a European hotel room, and more importantly are nice. The bed was comfortable, and though the pillows were bad, they have a whole pillow menu allowing you to get what you'd like. Nespresso machines in the room is a nice touch. Also, the shower was a nice, large size, great when compared to many small showers in other European cities. 4. Breakfast: excellent. The best breakfast buffet I've had in Europe. Excellent selection, plus attentive waitstaff to get you what you want that isn't on the buffet (e.g., coffee drinks) 5. Internet: this is the hotel's biggest negative. I understand that the Swissotel isn't the only fancy hotel that charges for wifi (Ritz Carlton charges for Internet, for example), but that doesn't make it ok. When you stay at a nice hotel you expect all the little things to be thought out and taken care of, and having to be a large fee just to use wifi comes across as cheap and unthoughtful. I'm sure it is a huge profit maker, but, again, this does not make it right. They wouldn't charge for using TV, so they shouldn't charge for wifi. I'd rather they charge a few Euros more a night and provide wifi for free than have to do little add ons to get the full product. To their credit there are two desktop computers available to use for free in the lobby, but really, in 2011 shouldn't people just be able to quickly and freely access the internet on their laptops/iphones/ipads in their rooms? On a similar note, the amount charged by the hotel for local phone calls was also unnecessarily high. Overall, I liked this hotel a lot, and would gladly stay here again if I were staying in that part of Berlin. For a good price, which I got since I was there in winter, it is a great place to stay. But I can't give 5 stars to a place charging so much just to use wifi. I notice several people complaining about this in 5 star reviews. Really unless people actually make the hotel realize that it isn't ok to charge for something that many cheaper, less fancy hotels are able to provide for free, they won't ever consider changing their policy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Riad104
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Berlin but first experience with Swissotel which I always noticed as greatly located right on K'Damm. So this time I decided to book a room here to be close to all the shopping and sightseeing in the Western Berlin center. I arrived early in the morning and was provided a room right away although was going to be ready for a check-in time waiting. This was a great plus, check-in was fast and I was very nicely welcomed by the staff. I had received a complimentary sweets and bottle of water in my room which was also very nice. The room is just the right size with a nice bathroom and Nespresso coffee machine. I stayed for 4 nights and was really impressed with the service, especially the concierge which arranged me a short-notice ticket to Blue Man Group show (highly recommended!) delivered right to the hotel in an hour or so. Overall - very nice hotel which I can recommend both for business and leisure visitors to beautiful Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great joy for our small children”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus S
Reviews.Content: We had three days in Berlin together with our twi children (10 months and 4 years). Everything was well-prepared when we arrived with some sweets for the children (the oldest one), special bed sheets, childrens shampoo, a gadget for placing the smallest child in the large bath tub. Everything was cleen and the staff very freindly. If a reasonable price can be obtained, then we would definately use the same hotel again:-) Rasmus and family Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ike_fedas
Reviews.Content: I liked my stat at the Swissotel. Very clean, efficient, good breakfast. They really try to give a good service. There is a nice view of the city from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miguel-Aleman
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is located centrally at the Ku'damm, which was the center of West Berlin and is still one of Berlin's hubs, especially for shopping. My expectations were high, and I was not let down. The hotel is excellent in all aspects; kind and attentative staff, very nice rooms and a very good restaurant and breakfast. It does not show off overboarding classic luxury, but is modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at perfect location; we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: MPNenMVH
Reviews.Content: For a 5-night city trip with two friends I booked three rooms in the Swissotel in Berlin. Each of us liked our stay in this hotel very much; clean and modern rooms, nice bathroom, a perfect breakfast buffet (where you can order your eggs any way you like without extra charge), and overall very friendly staff. Online booking was easy; the rooms were ready when we arrived at 11:30, and the late check-out at 15:00 was no problem. Great. Room prices are very reasonable, certainly when the quality of the room is taken into account. You'll easily pay two or three times as much in any other European Capital for something similar. The location is perfect, right at the Kurfurstendamm, with the bus to the airport stopping almost in front of the hotel. Which, by the way, is a great tip when you first arrive; the hotel has its entrance at the back. You could be right in front of the hotel without knowing it because the ground floor is taken by C&A. Just around the right corner you'll find the entrance to the hotel; elevators take you right up to the lobby. Zoologischer Garten is just a 5 minute walk away, from there you can take almost any kind of public transport into the very enjoyable city of Berlin. The bus is a great way of exploring it, you can buy a 'Tagesgruppekarte' at the driver which will let you and 4 others use any bus for the whole day; don't miss that one. When walking back to the hotel unwind at the fabulous 'Alt Berliner Biersalon' (across Joachimstaler Str at the 'Kudamm') which is open 24/7, serves real good typical german food at a very reasonable price, and has a perfect heated terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Junkster
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Swissotels a number of times and they have always been exceptional. Staff are very helpful and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble. They go that little bit extra compared to other 5* hotels. We were there for business and had to get some documents scanned so we could email them. The reception staff had them scanned, emailed to us and delivered the originals to our room within a matter for minutes! Beds are very comfortable and also have a pillow menu if you don't like the soft European style pillows. Plenty of TV channels to choose from in a multitude of languages. Swissotel Berlin is in a great location for shopping and public transport. Is located a few steps from Tauzienstrasse shops and Ku'damm. Only hiccup was that they couldn't find any records of our previous stays. No drama though. We were still treated like VIPS!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: youngyaya
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night here but the service was tremendous. They let me check in at 10:30 a.m. without extra charge and were incredibly helpful with recommendations and various business centre needs I had. I loved the massive bathtub and pillow menu. My only complaint is that charging for WiFi or modem connections is a bit out of date.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well positioned”
Reviews.Author: Stuart1956
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Swissotel for 4 nights from 10th - 14th Aug. The hotel is very well positioned about 400 metres from the station at the Zoo which is on the main line from Schonefeld Airport with regular trains. The hotel staff were all excellent very helpful and we were able to get into our room, which was a good size and comfortable, when we arrived at 1pm. The main shopping area is just outside the hotel on the Ku'damm. and there are pleny of places to eat. The food hall on the top floor of the main store KA DE WE (not on Ku'damm but still near the hotel) is a must see if you like food. There is an unusual Italian restaurant straight across the road from the hotel where you queue up to order your food and drink and it if made in front of you as you wait. You then just take it to a table. The bill is added to a card which you pay as you leave so you can get more food, a sweet or more drinks if you like. We only went there because it was raining very heavily on the Friday evening but were glad we did as the food was good and the atmosphere relaxing. The main area for the museums, the Reichstag and the Brandenberg gate are a short 10- 12 minute train journey from the hotel. You could opt to walk through the Teirgarten park area although this is about 2.5 - 3 kilometres from the hotel to The Brandenberg Gate and probably another kilometer to the Pergamon Museum. It is a nice walk though and a good way to see the city. There are plenty of tour buses that you can hop on and off and the very helpful concierge will pont you in the right direction. The general transport system is excellent and a day ticket which covers trains and buses is good value if you want to cram a lot into the one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Collette8
