Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Swissotel, Berlin for 3 nights in August 2011. It is the most fantastic hotel. We arrived early but were able to check into our room immediately. The staff were very welcoming and throughout our stay were extremely polite, friendly and efficient. The bedroom and bathroom were lovely, clean and comfortable. The bedroom was a good size. In the bathroom was a large bath and a good hot shower, There was even a complimentary pillow menu, to select exactly the pillow(s) to suit you. The location is good for the Kurfurstendamm. The 'Zoo' S-bahn (overground train) station is a short walking distance and the U-bahn (underground train) is just around the corner. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone visiting Berlin. We have renamed it the 'Swish Hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “Typical German style; clean, efficient and professional”
Reviews.Author: Omoti
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband between the 3-6th of April, 2011. I would have written this review much earlier but i couldn't remember the name of the fantastic young man at the reception that i wanted to give some credit for his professionalism and customer service throughout our short stay. Anyway you know yourself! Positives •Great location: Kurfurstendamm is at the centre of everything. Shops, restaurants and all. It’s also walking distance from the train station •Spotless room: With all you need which I’ve come to know with German hotels •Great Service: Everyone that we had contact with from the doorman to concierge were very helpful and professional •Beautiful Hotel: Very impressive building, free apples at the lobby Negatives •Can’t think of any. I strongly recommend

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Annelig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and close to airport buses, restaurants and shops. The hotel itself is clean and nice. We liked that there was a coffee machine in the room. It was nice to come home to a hot sauna after a full day in town. I'd like to stay here if I'll ever visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: umbertoNapoli_Italia
Reviews.Content: The service is very suitable the room very confortable the location is strategic

Reviews.Title: “Swiss perfection”
Reviews.Author: jojo-bebot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for one night during a stopover in Berlin. We should have stayed longer for the following reasons: - arrived around 10am and room was ready. Staff were very accommodating. - room was perfect; good size and very functional (plus a Nespresso machine in the room); - concierge (Timo) was extremely helpful with recommendations; - location is very good; near the Zoo S-bahn stop; near Kudamm action and KaDeWe. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOULY luxurious and relaxing weekend in Berlin! I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: ChereAmie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Berlin for my very first visit of this dynamic exciting city to celebrate my belated birthday in July 2011 and I wasn't dissappointed one bit. I got very delayed getting to Gatwick on a Friday night after a stressfull trip to the airport having to change flight but when I got to this hotel, I forgot it all. The glass lift to the first floor reception is funny, a bit Harry Potterish, and the welcome is one of the warmest I ever had. The staff whom I rang from the UK about my late arrival due to change of flight couldn't do any more to make me feel at ease and make it easy for me. Armed with my electronic key, you can let the elevator read it and take you to your exact floor of your booked room. The room is fantastically spacious, smart, modern and very comfortable with all the amenities you would need and even an expresso machine!! The bathroom has a big bath as well as a walking shower, take your pick. The side suede relaxing chair is great to put your aching feet up but the bed is one of the best bed I ever slept in apart from my expensive one at home. The TV has all the channels with all the languages you may speak and my atrium room was ever so quiet that I wished I could have stayed longer. The icing on the cake was having brunch at 11.30am in the breakfast restaurant where they serve it until midday...truly indulgent. The choice was mind-blowing and I had a real feast. Yes some may say it is a bit on the dear side pricewise but for a weekend break and as a treat, I'll say it is more than worth it because you can litterally eat like a Queen and the food is fresh, very well presented and mouthwatering, definitevely delicious, and you will have a real job to get up once you'll satisfied your appetite..:-) not for those on a diet... The hotel location is another great asset, very easy to catch the train back to the Schoenefeld airport where Easyjet flies to. Also within a few minutes walk from the underground and the bus routes. I will need to go back because their hotel spa was being refurbished that week and the one they offered in the meantime was a very sophisticated fitness/wellness centre around the corner and at the top of 300 steps (there is a lift available but I needed to work the calories of my brunch off) but not as convenient at the end of a long day visiting the sites. There isn't any better hotel I would recommend and I have stayed in quite a few. I can't wait to try most of the other Swissotel establishments spread around the world and check that their most excellent service is as great there than in Berlin. If you look for a special stay either alone or with your love-one, Swissotel is the word and I have not been paid to give such praise. Try it for yourself if you think you deserve it and you should have the same if not a similar experience..I almost forgot, for those who prefer leaving the laptop at home, there is a free state of the art PC with fast broadband at the guest's disposal behind the porter's lodge and it is on a first come first served basis to check your emails or check the web for location of good local restaurants/events or else..

Reviews.Title: “The best welcome we ever had in any hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweeties_forever
Reviews.Content: This is a very excellent hotel! The most prominent plus is without doubt the high standard of customer service - the staff is very friendly, attentive and professional and truly helpful with everything. We nowhere felt more welcome than here. Quality and cleanliness of the room and bathroom (bath and separate shower) are impeccable. The location is very convenient and really couldn't be better. Lots of practical amenities in the room such as an iron and iron board, modern coffee machine, safe, etc. Definitely our number one choice of hotel in Berlin. Only one minus: wifi internet access in the rooms should really be free in such a fine hotel (there is free access in a business room in the lobby on their computers).

Reviews.Title: “Wec loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Hugafen
Reviews.Content: The room was exllent. The staff was verey kind and helpfull. The breakfast was exellent. The bar was superb. The situation of the hotel in the middle of the city was extremme.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect match with Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: Great business hotel, quiet with good service, central location, spacious rooms and well-designed property. Close to shopping area, not far from major sights. Overall, a usual Swissotel experience with efficiency of the hotel management close to perfection. Wellness area on smallish side, breakfast was good. Good value even for Berlin hotel market. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: NikyR
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay with a nice and very spacious room. The beds were very comfortable with a great pillows "menu" as well. The hotel's staff was excelent and super friendly. We wish to commend and to thank to Miss Svenja Krone, which from the first moment (at check-in) and till our last day, was amazing and helpful in every way and made our stay memorable. One of the highlights and most enjoyable moments at Swissotel was the breakfest - abundant, consistently yummy and included many choices on the buffet. Actually one of the better hotel breakasts we've had in quite some time. Without question, we will stay here on future visits at Berlin. So if you want a super hotel in a super location, give Swissotel a try!.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: StephenDoherty
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights on a city break in this outstanding hotel. The location was very handy to shopping, restaurants, transport routes and right beside a brilliant zoo. The service was first class and everything was reasonably priced. I intend to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! You have to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NCgyrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was AMAZING! The staff were SO friendly, courteous, and helpful. The hotel itself is modern and pretty with every amenity you need. As soon as we walked up we felt comfortable and more than welcome (which is often hard to find). The location is great as it is close to shopping, restaurants, the zoo, and other things. The beds are super comfortable and the bar is open until 2 A.M. If you are looking for restaurants I would suggest Mizzio's which is on a little backstreet that is beautiful and we had the best waiter I believe we have ever had. Berlin was GREAT! My whole family loved it.

Reviews.Title: “the new capitol of europe”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomadsouthbucks
Reviews.Content: MY wife and i took the trip to Berlin for three days. the hotel was good but for the price of nearly $200 US dollars ,free wireless in the room is expected.Staff were all polite and conciege gave gave good choice of ideas for dinner. room really well appointed and quiet 6th floor

Reviews.Title: “Swiss, like a good watch”
Reviews.Author: planesmith
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel can be described as unusual. Once inside we were charmed by the wonderful staff who were friendly, helpful and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they were truly welcoming. The room itself was more than adequate with good TV, a welcome Nespresso machine and a very efficient and spotless bathroom. Looking out onto the interior well of the hotel is was pleasantly quiet. On the downside the bed was a little hard but had we taken the time to ask housekeeping were offering a matress-topper to relieve that situation. A brilliant choice for anyone looking for a hotel well situated for eating places, shopping, sightseeing and easy access to all public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping District, great if ur a shopper”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELFREAKONE
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms on the fifth floor facing the courtyard/cows. Loved the hotel. The rooms are not sound proof, and one can hear people walking and talking. The neighborhood is good if ur into shopping, which we're not. U need to take the train to the Old or Historic district. Staff upscale and professional. Gym being renovated during our stay..but, we didn't mind. Would not recommend if ur into the historic sites, etc. The train station may be dangerous at night...saw 2 fights, few skinheads...but it is 3 blocks away. Many good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ToolBergen
Reviews.Content: Swisshotel Berlin is a good hotel in a central location in Kudamn. Close to the zoo and main shoppingstreet. The rooms in the hotel is ok and nothing more. The decor and size of the room are maybe not 5 star worthy. The concierge service was not good at all. The first day they sent us to a closed place. The second day they forgot to arrange what we asked them to help us with. Also some of the men working in the reception could learn more about customerservice. The gym is so small you cant even call it a gym. Nice breakfast. Would recommend Hotel Concorde before this hotel, its just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Perfect”
Reviews.Author: barrytoronto65
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of The Westin but a fraction of the price. A great, great place!!

Reviews.Title: “It was not the first time and it will not be the last one”
Reviews.Author: GranZorro
Reviews.Content: For years the Swissotel in Berlin has been a consistently good hotzel in the five star category. Very well located in the heart of the center of the western part of the city, it is close to all modes of public transport (subway, city railway network, buses) that make Berlin - although quite large in size - such an easy place to move arouind. The hotel is extremely clean, its staff knowledgeable and polite, the buffet breakfast (generally not included in the room price) the equivalent of a large meal. For the traveller who doesn't want to dine in the formal hotel restaurant, there are many alternatives around, among these a Vapiano self service Italian eatery opposite the hotel, whose concept does not fail to impress first time patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkBarefoot
Reviews.Content: This was out first trip to Berlin and we chose this hotel based on the reviews here, its location and also cost. It delivered on all of these. Very clean hotel throughout, great sized rooms (bath and a seperate shower), friendly staff and a couple of minutes to a U-bahn terminal. We chose an "inner" room which was nicely tucked away from the front of the hotel. It wasn't totally noise free, but I don't think many hotels are. We had good sleeps throughout, especially after ordering different pillows from their Pillow Menu (the default ones were very thin, we both ordered the neck and shoulder support ones, much better). The hotel has a bar in the reception, and also a wine/snack area near the lobby too. These aren't opened until very late at night, but a nice place to have a drink before bedtime, and again very very friendly and polite staff. As we enjoyed Berlin so much, we will most likely do a return visit, and will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Couple078
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for the first time in April 2011. The hotel is right on the Kurfurstendamm. Great staff, very serviceminded. Everyone we met did what they could to make our stay a success.No problem in getting our rooms early due to early arrival. The rooms are clean, and spacious. Very welll decorated! Next time in Berlin, we will definately stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Berlin - a best hotel and home to come back to...”
Reviews.Author: adrori
Reviews.Content: I am used to stay at this wonderful hotel, 5 stars but not too expensive, gives 200% for what you pay for. the stuff is very professional,(Ronals, Lisa and all receptionists thank you), the hotel is magnificantly architectured, well kept, all clean and neat, badsheets are replaced daily, a customer is treated like in the "good old times" and get's the same room he desires for and is used towonderfull breakfasts and jestures, just the best place to stay in Berlin for a reasonable price level.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in probably the best city in the world.”
Reviews.Author: christophe13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip and I cannot think of a single negative aspect of my stay. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and really helpful. The location is fantastic, sitting in the middle of Ku'damm near to the brilliant KaDeWe department store and within walking distance of the major Berlin attractions. The outside sitting area of the bar that overlooks Ku'damm is great and goes with the overall stylish design of the hotel. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend you stay -Excellent for business or holiday”
Reviews.Author: DoobieSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after the longhaul flight from Sydney to Dubai then transfer through Dusseldorf to Berlin. After such an exhausting flight this hotel was fantastic in every way. The staff were friendly and professional, the room was clean, comfortable and modern. The nespresso coffee machine was a dream in each room. Breakfast was amongst the best I have had. Amazing kitchen which produced the best fresh waffles I have ever had. Great location which was close to everything. A fantastic stay for the tired business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kevsgrl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly staff. Rooms were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modern Hotel, Centrally Located, Top Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fenney007
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a Swissotel earlier in our trip, we were really looking forward to our stay at the Swissotel Berlin. On arrival, the valet immediately made us feel very welcome. Valet is a service that is provided by the hotel for the same price as self parking. No sooner had we checked in and entered our room had our bags been delivered to the room. The bedroom was spacious,clean and modern, and unlike most other european hotels did have coffee making facilities in the room. The complimentary Nespresso machine is a great touch and is restocked every day. It was no surprise to see that the bathroom, too was very clean and modern. Have a look in the wardrobe, complimentary shoe shine is offered and they do a pretty good job. If you are after internet there is a business centre available with a couple of Mac's with free internet. The hotel is located in a great area where there are plenty of eating options and some of the best high class shopping I have seen. Although we did not visit the zoo it is once again only a short stroll. Although the hotel is removed from the centre of Berlin and it's big attractions we found this not to be a problem as public transport - U and S Bahn stations and bus stop are all a short stroll away. Would definately stay here again next time we travel to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZB Mrs A
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Front desk staff was understanding and helpful. Special mention to be made of Susana who was extremely helpful and obliging. Lisa too was very helpful. Unfortunately, most of our trip was clouded by the Volcanic Ash closure of airports. Conceirge team not much up to the mark......nothing like the team at the Phoneicia in Malta. The hotel is a bit too expensive, even when compared to other 5 star hotels. Mrs. Ahsan

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: islington3164
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days on leisure trip to Berlin. The hotel is located right off the Kurfurstendam with the Kurfurstendam Ubahn stop across the street or around the corner and the Zooligershcer Sbahn stop about 3 blocks away. While some may argue that Potsdamer Platz is the new heart of Berlin, it's too sterile to match the elegance and "real" character of Kurfurstendam. Our room, on the fourth floor and with a view of the "cows" was wonderful. Large, exceptionally clean and comfortable. Television had a large array of channels, bathroom was spotless with both a tub and separate shower. We ordered room service twice and the food was delicious and delivered quickly. The staff at the hotel was also extremely professional and accommodating. I had an emergency at home and needed to send an urgent fax. Staff took care of it immediately and delivered the confirmation to my room so that I could enjoy time out in Berlin. They always greeted us when we entered the hotel and were not only nice, but knowledgeable and courteous. I will be returning to Berlin and the Swissotel will be my hotel of choice. An excellent hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: ro2010ro
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin for a wedding event and the majority of the guests were staying here and the hotel had an offer on which was great. Of course these hotels are for the rich and famous and they are beyond our means, but for once in our life we had to stay in such a top class hotel. I never thought where you stay can make such a diffrence!!!!!!!!!!! Absolutly out of this world with fabulous food and great drinks. The friends and family that tried to save money and that stayed at other cheaper hotels regreted not having paid the extra to enjoy this luxiourious hotel. Thanks to the staff there was nothing missing and this stay made a serious impact on us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel / very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: truffymontreal
Reviews.Content: The staff is very efficient and provided us with great customer service. I initially found that the bed looked very sparse but it was surprisingly comfortable and we experienced an exceptional nights sleep. The breakfast options were quite expensive and when we received the meal it was very impressive but way too copious. One breakfast could have served at least 3. Overall excellent experience and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “always nice to come back home”
Reviews.Author: deluxe_afficionado
Reviews.Content: I always go there twice a year on my scheduled Berlin Business trip. this hotel is really perfect for the business traveller, location, great service, nice executive lounge and great staff. The food is of very good quality and there is continuity there among the staff, you see the same staff members around and they recognize you only when you come there once or twice a year. Quality of the rooms and beds are perfect. when I go for a leisure trip to Berlin I would rather prefer the Adlon or the Regent but the Siwssotel is the ideal hotel for a business traveller. love the rooms overlooking Kurfuerstendamm and the Gedaechtniskirche.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: annadam70
Reviews.Content: I have visited Berlin in March for the firt time and stayed in Swissotel. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff proffesional and welcoming. I really enjoyed the good quality and variety of breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: heranaway
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located, all the shops are on your doorstep and the u-bahn is a stroll away. We booked a classic room originally which we thought was tiny so we upgraded to a junior suite at a negotiated 60euros per night. I would suggest an Insider famous walking tour, its for about 4 hours and very informative. You can pick up the leaflet from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tomersi
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at the hotel for five days (from the18/05 until the 23/05) Excellent hotel. Very very good located. The staff are really friendly, helpful and gives a good feeling from the moment you enter the hotel. We stayed at the most simple room which was large, clean, with clean bath, WC and a shower. Rooms are very clean and very maintained. A problem with the room type was treated within 5 minutes. Small water problem fixed within a minute and we received an apology along with a free drink at the bar. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but expensive wifi!”
Reviews.Author: LD73
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a couple of times before and the experience has always been good. I stayed in a classic room this time which was a bit on the small side (especially shower) but ok for the price. My room had a view of the Ku'dam and it was very quiet. Service throughout my stay was excellent but one major dissapointment: the price of wi-fi. The rate is about EUR 25 per 24 hours. It's one of the priciest wi-fis I've come accross. This is just not acceptable in this day and age when most top hotels offer free wi-fi. To add insult to the injury, when i tried to access the web from my smartphone, the person at reception insisted that I had to pay another EUR 25 connection fee. So EUR 50 for 24 hours of wi-fi. I complained to the manager who was very helpful and sorted the problem out. Swissotel need to resolve the wifi issue if it wants to compete with other hotels in 2011

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location but hotel definitely needs better pillows”
Reviews.Author: Taz7441
Reviews.Content: I think other reviews have covered everything there is to say about the location and the wonderful staff they employ. The rooms are basic, clean and comfortable for short stays. The only negative for me was the pillows which were really flimsy, I struggled to get comfortable in the end had to use the spare duvet as a pillow. Overall really nice hotel, lovely breakfast, great cocktail lounge and good room service. I was expecting a bit more from the room but in the end I was satisfied just wish they had better pillows. WiFi costs 12 euros per night which considering its a 5 star should really be free.

Reviews.Title: “very good but something is missing.......”
Reviews.Author: buiumb
Reviews.Content: We booked a basic room for 5 night from booking.com and we also a clubswisse members. First we got a twin room, so we asked to change it to double room but then we got a double room in the lowest floor and in the farest way to the elevator turns to back compund. also the "queen" bed was very small. all in all it's a 5 star hotel, situated in a very good center location with a high class front desk service but some of the room (the basic one) gives a sence that someting is missing for this 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: OxfGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay with partner & the in-laws, staying at the lovely Swissotel in Berlin. It was our 2nd stay at this hotel, so pretty much knew the high standard we would be exposed to. We had an inside room, which look out into a inner quod (which has a couple of painted cows munching some astroturf in the middle). The outer rooms look out onto the Kurfurstendamm (a busy hectic main shopping street), so I would not bother paying the extra for this view! The rooms are of a good size & quite contemporary in design/layout. The bathroom had a shower & a bath (rather than a shower over the bath!). Iron & ironing board in the room & also a fantastic Nespresso machine... a great addition for coffee addicts. The breakfasts were not included in our booking & were a pricey €20+ each, which is way too much... so every day we left the hotel crossed Kurfurstendamm and went to Cafe Kranzler, which is positioned almost opposite the hotel. Breakfast buffet at Cafe Kranzler is under €10 each and includes a good range of cold buffet items and a hot drink. The service from the reception staff was fantastic... extremely polite & attentive. The same was applicable to the staff working in the lobby bar area & the housekeepers. I would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Samaldo007
Reviews.Content: I have just came back after a wonderful 4 day break in Berlin. The hotel is located just off the Ku'Damm and about 500m from the Zoo which is also serves as the station for getting the train to Schoenefeld Airport. The hotel itself is very contemporary and requires you to take a lift up to reception. I was able to check in early and was allocated a courtyard view room on the 7th floor. There was no noise at night and the room was very clean. The staff were very pleasant and more than willing to help with any request. I can't comment on the food as I didn't have anything whilst I was there. I would highly recommend the hotel and it offers brilliant value for money for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: WendyTan
Reviews.Content: A perfect and convenient location just off the main street of Ku'damm. A super convenient location right in town with lots of shopping and food outlets all round. Not too far away is Kadewe, the second largest department store in Europe after Harrods of London. Great service at the hotel and room is nice and comfortable. The only negative feedback is the pillows which is flat but they make it up by providing a selection of pillows to choose from depending on your liking. The hotel provides a coffee-making machine but unfortunatedly, i am a tea-drinker.Will be perfect if hotel supplies complimentary bottled water too. Breakfast is terrific and you can also place the order of waffles or pancakes which is really delicious. Gym on the otherhand is small and pathetic (Quite a dissappointment actually). If you are sourcing around for a hotel to stay, especially for business trips, look no further. This is an excellent choice and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sue59Wednesbury
Reviews.Content: Top class service from arrival to departure. The staff in this hotel provide service which is second to none, friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are comfortable with both a walk in shower and bath. Make up mirror provided which illuminates and magnifies. Plently of soft fluffy towels and bathrobes provided as well the usual shower gel etc. The bedroom furniture is good quality which illuminate on opening. Bed a little too firm for us but that comes down to personal choice but the pillows were like soft fluffy clouds pure heaven. The breakfast which was included in our room rate was first class, varied and plentyful and some thing to suit everyones taste. The transport links in Berlin are absolutely great. I suggest you purchase a 3, 4 or 5 day passat the airport which covers the Train, U bhan , S bhan and busses all of which arrive on time and clean. My husand who is visually impaired found no problems on the stations altough the gap between platform and train was a little wide. We managed to travel all the major tourist sites using the public transport system. I must say I found the German people to be most helpful and happy to help and even encouraged me in my use of long ago learned school girl german but they really appreciate it if you make an effort. All in a a complete 5 Star Break and we will return again in the future and I would be sure to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: esstee238
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were very happy with the service received. The hotel is ideally situated 5 mins from the underground and overground rail links - 30 mins from Schonefeld airport by train. Its also on the main shopping street ideally located for everything. The room was clean and modern as was the bathroom with bath and separate shower. We received an upgrade so our room overlooked the main street. There's a Nespresso coffee machine though we asked for tea making facilities too. There's even a pillow menu to choose a different pillow if required. The concierge was extremely helpful and as were all the staff - and they all speak excellent English. It was my partner's birthday during our stay and the hotel very kindly brought him a very nice birthday cake and card. We didn't stay for breakfast (it seemed a bit expensive) but the bar on an evening was very nice with great cocktails. My only grumble would be the cost of using the wi-fi - at 12.50 euro a day it seemed a little expensive - in fact I would expect it to be free. Though there are two PC's behind the concierge desk which are free to use. This is our second stay in a Swissotel and we will certainly use them again - both highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If it's location you're after, you can't go wrong with this”
Reviews.Author: pauljer
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right on the Ku-damm with shops, restaurants and public transport literally around the corner…5 minutes walk to the Zoo station and KadeWe department store. The check in was efficient and I was shown to my room by the same staff member who explained the facilities including the Nespresso coffeemaker. The furnishings, lighting and fittings were stylish and contemporary and the bathroom was well designed with quality fittings.Very artistic enviroment with genuine paintings and sculptures at the public areas and the guest rooms! The fitness centre was a disappointment, though – just a couple of treadmills, bike and a stair master with 2 weights machine. Some of the reception and concierge staff at this hotel were extremely skilled at their jobs. Timo at concierge, for example is a an exceptional staff. His colleague at concierge however, has forgotten that he works in the service industry. He goes about his work as though I was an interruption to his work, rather than being the reason for it. Another bummer is the rooms look into one another in an uncomfortable way. If it’s location you are after, this hotel is right in the centre of western Berlin. I am definitely staying here on my next trip to Berlin (www.perfyi.wordpress.com)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OpieBrussels
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking around Berlin or for catching buses or subways Room very nnice if small for theprice. High quality hotel, nice staff and great breakfast buffett.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: gemflanagan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a 4 night city break. It was our first time to visit Berlin and we found the location was very central and convienient. We were right beside the underground station and the Hop on Hop off bus stop. The main shopping street the Ku'daam is on your doorstep here and the KaDeWe is only a short walk away. The hotel itself was lovely. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The service was very professional and friendly. Room service was very prompt. There was a very nice self service Italian restaurant right across the street called Vapiano and we had a fabulous meal here. I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Jlaura90
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel exceptional. I have not one complaint. The staff were wonderful, nothing was ever to hard for them to do. They remembered your room number in the bars and even some if what you ordered. You were treat no different then anyone else, and they always made you feel that extra special. Their service was exceptional and they have made me and my partner want to return to berlin very shortly. Which of course we will stay in the swissotel. Worth ever penny.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Berlin - hands down!”
Reviews.Author: ceelynn
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is top notch, from the bar and restaurant staff to the reception staff. Location is perfect; concierge was VERY helpful. Rooms are well appointed - you can even order your prefered type of pillow from the "pillow menu". Bathrooom included seperate bathtub and shower. Only possible improvement would be free wi-fi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swissotel for three nights for a business trip and it was a good stay. The room was very well furnished, if a little tight for space in places, with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was excellent - very large with a very good shower and a big bath. I upgraded slightly to a room with a Kurfustendamm view, which was nice. The service was excellent, and the room was cheap at €80 a night. Incidentals were expensive though - with internet access costing €11 a day and breakfast, which I didn't have, €21 for a cooked breakfast. Basically the Swissotel is a very well appointed, clean and comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Trendy Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaFord
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this hotel around April/May 2009 and found it a great hotel, it was in an excellent location and had a great bar and restaurant.. the rooms were nice, tidy with plenty of oom.. perfect for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personal services”
Reviews.Author: Bill1001
Reviews.Content: We are a family of a father & 2 teenage daughters and we stayed at the Swissotel for 4 days/3nights. I have travelled a lot around the world and saw many hotels and staffs. I must say that the staff of the Swissotel in Berlin is of exceptional service-class. No request was too much and we always were treated exceptionally well (compared to for instance the very bad services at the at Tripadvisor highly rated Cancun restaurant - a world of difference). I would almost recommand personnel of restaurants and other hotels to take a training from (or just visit) the Swissotel employees, many can learn from that! I wish to thank the people from the reception, lobby, restaurant, cleaners, all....for a very good job and the fact that they gave us a thru home-feeling at their hotel! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dundermifflin2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Swissotel Berlin a few times now and have enjoyed it every time. It is a very stylish and comfortable hotel in a nice area of Berlin. Close to a lot of shops and different transport options. The rooms are large, well setup and very clean. Beds are very comfortable and it is very quiet so no problems sleeping at all. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. My only negative would be that the breakfast buffet is a little pricey. It is well stocked, and the food is good, but just seems a touch over priced to me.

Reviews.Title: “Elegante Space, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: mytto
Reviews.Content: Swissotel was one of the most beautiful hotels I 've ever stayed. The stuff was warm and friendly, the room was elegant and there was a nespresso machine free to use and unlimited coffee to drink... It was almost perfect. It is centrally located at Kudamm with easy connections to all the important sights of Berlin. Sleeping there was a dream. All special requests for pillows and mattresses were accepted. Our bed was out of memory foam and was perfect! The only sad thing for me was that the wifi was overpriced, so we never used it...but I would be glad to visit Swissotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “5* luxury in centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays111
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, standard of service excellent. Memory mattress on beds, which take a bit of getting used to but are really comfortable. Situated in quiet position just off main shopping street, 5 minutes from Ka De We, and very close to rail and bus stations, in excellent position for visiting all main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel in the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: UKBornToTravel
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel and would recommend it for a central Berlin stay. Rooms are a good size and very comfortable. If you are on business there is a comfortable work space with plenty of room. Used the overnight shoe shine service on the recommendation of a colleague and my size 9s came back positively gleaming the next morning. The bar and restaurant are excellent, if not a bit on the expensive side. The breatfast choice is extensive while the bar snack we ordered was very good. What's more, being in the middle of town there are also plenty of excellent restaurants to choose from close by. The entrance is a little stange having to take an elevator to reach the lobby, while having to use your room card key to access the elevator for every journey is slightly irritating, but overall this is an excllent hotel with friendly attentive staff and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JohntheGreek37
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Berkshire Concepts for $125 a night for a stay in August. we thought at that rate the hotel would be just adequate. We were amazed how wrong we were. we got a 1 bedroom suite on the executive floor, with access to a complimentary bar and snack room. The room was a corner room with stunning views of the entire city. We checked the rate at the front desk and we were quoted $450 for a standard as the standard rate for this hotel, which probably was a fair rate for the superior accomodations. The location allowed us to walk the entire historic district including into the old East Berlin ( we are avid walkers though-it ws 2-3 miles to see everything on foot) Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the U metro station and the Zoo station interchanges. Incredibly helpful staff at check-in who really explained all the facilities etc. Nice room, great views of the city. Lots of space in the room. Good desk and reliable wireless. Nespresso machine in the room with a few pods, replaced each day. Very comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Very quiet corridors, slept very well. Bar was very good: great teas! Really fantastic tea! All served by very friendly staff with little pieces of chocolate... I got a great price too so would definitely stay here again. The gym was quite small and not terribly enticing but that was my only negative really.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: cjohann
Reviews.Content: Like many Berlin 5*, this hotel would rank a 4* anywhere else in the world. Satisfactory, nothing else. Negatives: - Weird little entrance level - need to take a lift up to reception, cross the lobby and then take another lift up to the room; - HORRIBLE twin bed setup! Not just your standard German setup of two single beds in a double bed frame, which is ok - these beds were not held together at all and spent all night slipping around the base! Ended up with a 1ft crevasse between the two beds and unable to sleep - made a call to reception at 5am to change room as body parts kept falling between the beds, and putting them together did no use as they were apparently on oiled bases! Thankfully they switched me to a room with a REAL double bed the next morning. - location. OK, could be good for many people, but I tend to prefer East Berlin. - Overpriced bar. Positives: - Service: receptionist escorted me to my room and explained everything. A bit absurd given the situation, but appreciated. - Nespresso machine in room. - Free apples at reception :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, super breakfast and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tortobi
Reviews.Content: This was one of my best hotel experiences, everything was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “lucked out at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: DCVazaha
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute trip to Berlin and I was having trouble finding availability at places, so I booked randomly through an online aggregating site. My room rate was about half of the US State Department per diem, so I wasn't expecting much but since it was close to the u-bahn line I wanted, I went with it. I was pleasantly surprised, my room was lovely and spacious. The mattress is firm, and the pillows are lovely. The bedding is quite nice-- definitely a step up from typical hotel linens. Every one of the staff members that I have interacted with have been friendly, attentive and helpful. The lobby is quite swanky and my coworkers have been shocked to learn that I am paying less than they are at shabbier places. My only complaint is that wifi and breakfast are at additional cost. Wifi was 65 E for a week, and breakfast is around 21 Euro. I'm not a big breakfast eater, so I stocked up on yogurt and snacks at the grocery store in the basement of the department store next door. These are minor complaints since most of the other participants at my conference have also told me they are charged for wifi and breakfast at their hotels as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: IzzySheffieldUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 5 nights. It's definitely worth paying a bit more for one of the rooms which look over the Kurfurstendamm. They have, as others have pointed out, floor to ceiling windows and an excellent view over the busy streets below. The staff were excellent: I found the bed rather hard and was immediately offered an alternative room; nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel has a fantastic restaurant so we treated ourselves to dinner one evening and had one of the best meals ever. It was expensive, yes, but not nearly as much as a comparable London restaurant. The breakfast, however, was not worth the cost, a better alternative was the "Quick Breakfast" at the small cafe/bar, although there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience - best Business Hotel at Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Deependra5
Reviews.Content: Our business took us to Berlin for couple of days and we chose Swissotel to stay - it was freezing cold in Feb, 2010. But the warmth and grandeur the hotel presented to us took all our shivers away. We splurged in a vast collection of wines and cheese at the hotel bar. And the bed was the softest that I've ever seen in all my trips so far. Kudos to Swissotel for making long-distance travellers feel at home, truly!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel with pour breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelMore78
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommended this hotel because of its service and placement. The hotel is near the shopping area, transport and places of interest. The Zoo is only in 5 minutes. But the breakfast was awful and not cheap at all. It is not too easy to find restaurants near the hotel, it is better to walk via Kurfstd to find some places for eating.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: weebonniegirl
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff who spoke perfect English. The Hotel was fantastic - rooms very comfortable. It is in a great location - ideal for shopping, resturants and transport. This was our third visit to Berlin and the best Hotel we stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Very classy, my first stay was a real surprise!”
Reviews.Author: gvdima
Reviews.Content: Nice and easy check in, despite I did not have my voucher at hand ( it reversed to me at chack out, when while being on a hurry I had to stop and solve that). The most I liked the big rooms and the so smooth pillows. also large bathroom featuring both bathtube and shower cabin. Nespresso available in the room made my morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: retired49_10
Reviews.Content: Our stay from arrival to departure five days later was very comfortable. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were very friendly and courteous. The bed linen and towels were changed several times during our stay even though we did not specifically request this. The breakfast choice was more than enough to set us up for a day of sightseeing!! Even though our room overlooked Kurfurstendamm we heard very little traffic noise. Also we did not hear any noise from other rooms or corridor even though the hotel appeared to be very busy. Another great thing about this hotel was the fact that we could leave our luggage there even though we had checked out as our flight did not leave until the evening allowing us to do more sightseeing. I would have no hesitation in staying there again and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed about the Swiss hospitality in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: pore319
Reviews.Content: I would like to leave a few lines for the Management about my stay with Swissotel. I had a few additional days to spend during my business trip in Germany and i chosed Swissotel Berlin.First i was not sure with my choice since i haven't heard much about your property but today i am glad that i did so.Your Bell staff was very friendly upon my arrival and i was funny entertained by your doormen in the elevator.Nice guy...... Front office did well and i had a nice room providing me a great view to the shopping street. I was excited to explore Berlin and i approached your Concierge desk.Great i got all information what i was looking for my first day in town and actually i planed to had my dinner outside somewhere but your helpful and friendly Concierge convinced me to try your restaurant in the hotel.I was honestly not impressed with the interior of your restaurant but the food was great,no complain at all.Mr. Blisse took the following days so good care for me that i will recommend his caring hospitality to my friends for their upcoming visits in the next months to Berlin.I like your service and the Hotel,I felt very comfortable and i am sure my friends will do.Both tumbs up for your SWISS hospitality even i guess the majority is german staff.I definitly return to Swissotel Berlin.Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location , Friendly Service and Comfortable, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: glennharrold
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Swissotel Berlin for 5 nights the hotel was excellent and well located close by the U-bahn and easy walking distance to many of the main tourist attractions. The hotel staff were without exception professional, friendly and helpful and the room was comfortable with great views on to the Kurfurstendamm. The bed was solid and very good for your back after a days sightseeing!! The Nespresso machine was great for fresh coffee and a handy espresso to set you up for the day. A fantastic, friendly, immaculate hotel ideally placed in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, but actually woth 4*”
Reviews.Author: David-Ela
Reviews.Content: Perfecr Location for West Berlin with shops and Kudamm, has 5* on the paper but there were several negative points: - although the room is functional, well furnished, expresso machine, this is quite small if you are 2 persons. - The hotel has a full glass fassade, so the room has a full wall of glass. that would have been perfect in summer but we were there in winter, especially cold this year with -20°C. Heating was at maximum capacity room was very dry but still the feeling to be cold. - No spa The breakfast was however really good, with plenty on original swiss products..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PH_Lar
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 friends stayed at the Swissotel in August 2009. To this date it is the best experience I have had from a hotel. I am just back from holidays in Stockholm, where I also stayed in a 5* hotel, but I must say it was nowhere near the same as Swissotel. Swissotel is situated in West Berlin along the famous shopping street of Kurfürstendamm. It is within walking distance of many attractions, shops, restaurants, etc. When I stayed at Swissotel, our group had 3 twin rooms. On arriving at the hotel, the receptionist placed us in rooms on the same floor and just doors apart from each other, which was very good. The receptionist was very friendly and brought us up to our rooms in the lift and showed us how things worked and where they were situated in the hotel. The rooms themselves (we were on the top floor) were very spacious, with good natural light, coffee/tea/ making machine, satellite TV, mini-bar, etc. The bathroom was lovely. Quite compact, but with everything one could need. It had a seperate shower and bath, which is excellent and as many previous posters have said, it has a bathroom phone! When we booked the hotel, we got a great deal for 3 nights which included breakfast. The breakfast was beautiful. There was a massive range of foods available and one could have as much to eat as wanted. There was 24hr room service also, as well as bar service. The bar was lovely also. It was quite compact. The staff were very friendly and we got to know them well over our few days stay. In the lobby, there are computers for use by guests for free. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to potential visitors, especially if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel in the heart of the shopping district.”
Reviews.Author: david1776
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It cost so much less than what I would have guessed. Very comfortable and spacious rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. The public areas of the hotel were very impressive too. I really don't have a bad word to say about the place. The location is great. Very close to all of the shops and to the Zoologischer Garten train station. This gives easy connections to the airports and to the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great location”
Reviews.Author: njaffer
Reviews.Content: Great clean room with wonderful service. Swiss hotel lived up to its reputation as efficient, clean, and clock work. Part of a large group of friends with kids, treated all of us very well, even gave the kids dvds to watch. The hotel is in West Berlin, but we spent most of our time in Mitte in East Berlin. But taxis are not that expensive as well as it is between two underground stops.

Reviews.Title: “Just As Advertised and Very Child Friendly”
Reviews.Author: msunitednations
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend to catch up with a girl friend in Berlin. The rooms were large, clean and modern; the beds were extremely comfortable and the Nespresso machine was fabulous in the morning. Swiss Hotel exceeded expectations in taking care of our 2 year old son: a cot, baby bath, infant toiletries, nappies, bottle warmer and nappy bin and toys were delivered to our room within minutes of our check-in. Although we did not require all these items they certainly exceeded expectations in meeting the needs of travelling parents. Swissotel hired an excellent English speaking babysitter for our son so we could have a proper dinner at the Reichstag. My only minor quibble is that all of the food was over-salted to the extent that it was inedible. But a request not to add salt to the food when cooked seemed to do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Understated hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hipposWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with may daughter last summer, and this year came back with the full family. We stayed two nights at the end of a holiday travelling around Germany. Although the hotel might not be close to all the sights, it has excellent public transport links, as well as shopping and eating on the doorstep. We used the no. 100 a bus a lot which goes from a stop nearby (this bus goes by a lot of the sights, through the Tiergarten, past the Reichstag and Brandenburg gate, then down Unter den Linden to the Alexanderplatz, and runs very frequently) and we also caught the bus to Tegel airport the morning we left - this takes 20-25 minutes. I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival as I could not find a way to "link up" the two reservations we had made for the two rooms. They replied very promptly and explained that due to our bed configuration (one room with queen and one with twin beds) that we could not have interconnecting rooms. Unfortunately on our first evening there was a problem with door on the children's room and they had to be reallocated another room (this was towards midnight). However, they were promptly reallocated another room (being kids, they hadn't unpacked!) and as previous reviewers have mentioned this was done without fuss. I thought the rooms were well appointed and comfortable - beds not quite up to the marriott standard, but good enough. My daughter requested the "good night" treatment which she enjoyed. The bathrooms have a separate shower and whilst not large, are well laid out. We had a rate including breakfast which whilst being fully concellable I thought very reasonable particularly for a capital city. The breakfast was a good spread and hot items are available to order. This hotel might not be flashy as some five stars, but it has everything you need and on both our visits I found all the staff we had dealings with friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JMX2016
Reviews.Content: this is my second stay at the swissotel Berlin the staff is the best I have met in a long time they all did the extra step to make my stay unforgettable and are very flexible the location is the best you could imagine 2min away from Zoo Bahnhof, on the Kudam they really deserve the 5 star rating even if I would appreciate a free wifi in the rooms (which most 5 stars hotels do offer now worldwide) I will be back there for sure and can only recommend the swissotel Berlin! good job!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great location, pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: kerrylaw
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel from Thursday to Monday, July 22nd to July 26th 2010. The hotel has a great location near the central Berlin area of K-Dahm. From the moment of my arrival, the staff members were courteous and helpful. The room was delightful and spacious with a great view of Kurfurstendamn. My double bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Room service was excellent with a good menu while the hotel restaurant had an great selection of food. I also enjoyed the nespresso machine with which one could enjoy a freshly brewed coffee in one's own rom. Overall, I would highlly recommend this hotel and I was most impressed with my stay. I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay in this hotel again if we return to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jad152
Reviews.Content: Can't really praise this hotel enough. We stayed for a long weekend and enjoyed every minute. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room and the breakfast were first class; everything we could have wished for.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay at a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenbembridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for five days as a solo traveller, and I highly recommend staying here. I wouldn’t stay at the Swissotel if you’re after ‘hip’ Berlin, as it’s in pretty much in the opposite side of the city for that. There is a bit of a business atmosphere about the place, too, though when I was there, there was a good mixture of business people and tourists. Swissotel sits pretty much on a busy shopping street (think Regent Street, London), but there are excellent transport links to all of Berlin within walking distance. If this were all the area had to offer, then I wouldn’t have been pleased, but if you investigate the local area behind the department stores and Cartier shops, you’ll be pleasantly surprised by its relaxed cafés and restaurants, which were, I was pleased to see, full of real Berliners. I chose not to eat at the hotel, as I thought the prices were a little on the high side, but the food could have been amazing, I just don’t know. I’m very fussy about quality of my food, and the following places relatively near the hotel didn’t disappoint: Café im Literaturhaus Wintergarten (Fasanenstrasse 23), Fagiano, (Fasanenstrasse 41), Ruhland & Ruhland (Knesebeckstrasse 5), Café Savigny (Grolmanstrasse 54/54) and the excellent pasta canteen opposite the hotel called Vapiano (Augsburger Strasse 43). The staff at the hotel were very professional and friendly. I want to make special reference to Timo, the concierge. I rented a bike for my whole trip from an excellent local company called RadKom http://www.radkom.de/fahrradvermietung-berlin.html, but I got a little confused about various terms and conditions. Timo called RadKom for me and explained to me about insurance, what happens if the bike gets stolen, etc. It was little touches that this that made my experience at Swissotel very positive indeed. The standard of room, bed, and housekeeping was excellent, though a business vibe was present in the room, which was impressively spacious. The A/C was also a huge welcome in during a very hot week in Berlin. All in all, I would stay at Swissotel, Berlin, again, as the whole experience was very positive, and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorgecapirone
Reviews.Content: My first impession of the hotel was slightly under what I had expected. Wrong. Services were very good, location quite convenient and the staff was politely friendly. A very good option when doing business in Berlin !

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: msrichmond
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin. It was a business trip but we went a few days early to explore the city. We arrived the night Germany lost in world cup games. The hotel was noisey all night long. The street noise awakened us, however, we were told that it would have been even noisier had Germany won their game. There were three pillows for each of us but they were thin and flimsy. It was rather like using tissue paper for a pillow. I asked the next morning if they had firmer pillows and was told that I could go down the street and buy one. The bed was not very comfortable. One night I found it more comfortable to sleep sitting in the chair with my feet stretched over the ottoman. We brought along a laptop computer but found that to use it in hotel would be prohibitively expensive. The concierge seemed to know very little about the city. We picked up brochures at his desk but, when we asked further questions concerning the subjects of the brochures, he was unable to give any answers. The one musuem that he was familiar with turned out to be a big waste of time and money. We did enjoy the breakfast each morning. However, for the money we paid to stay in this hotel, they should have had more to offer than just a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, excellent service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: pfmdallas
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 enjoyable nights here and was very pleased by the size of the room and its cleanliness. The staff was very professional and welcoming, clearly a cut above. Room service was excellent and the restaurant was superb, though a bit of a splurge price-wise. I would recommend getting a room with a view of Ku-damm so you can watch all the activity below.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, elegant and modern, some clumsiness in the service”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn
Reviews.Content: Good location (if you prefer West-Berlin), elegant and modern interior, but a bit bland room with quite a small bathroom. Very nice restaurant (and adequate breakfast). Friendly, but a bit clumsy service: an internet reservation was not found (!), making the check in complicated; then - because of this - the staff at the breakfast reataurant quite abruptly was claiming that the breakfast was not included (as if it would not be something, which could be sorted out very simply) and asked my partner to follow them to sign a bill (i.e not bringing the bill to the table), and finally we had to discuss with the front desk, whether or not the breakfast was included (and that they would need to sort it out with the reservation office), even if I had a printed (and explicit) confirmation from the hotels own website. I must admit that the lady at the front desk was extremely friendly, tough. Hence, the overall score is four, not five. Opposite to the hotel (with a bit higher prices) is the equally modern hotel Concorde with bigger rooms and more or less perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect -very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan199
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights with friends whilst visiting Berlin for leisure. Arrival/Check in: On arrival, the taxi door was opened by the bell staff and help with luggage offered (and refused -I'd carried my small bag all the way from the UK, I think I can manage for the last few steps). You walk into the foyer of the hotel and take the elevator up to the first floor for check in. The lobby of the hotel is extremely modern, with plenty of glass and white marble. There is also a small cafe (24/7) which serves a lighter breakfast option (i.e. croissants, a 'takeaway' breakfast, doughnuts and snacks round the clock). The front desk is located to the right immediately upon entering. By the time I had reached the smiling receptionist, I had already formed a great impression of the Swissotel: first impressions count. The lady checked us in to our room, and then escorted us up to our room, pausing to point out Restaurant 44, the bar and the aforementioned cafe. There is a different bank of elevators to take you to the guest room levels, and one has to walk past reception to get to it. This made me feel very secure, as did the fact that the lifts are keycard operated, meaning that the bedrooom levels of the hotel are only accessible to registered guests. The lady took us to our room, and then showed us how things like the a/c, TV and coffee machine worked. I also asked her about getting to the Tiergaten (a park), and she produced a map, circled the hotel and the park, and suggested the best way to get there (i.e. get on at the Zoo stop not the nearest U bahn station to avoid having to change trains) and how the ticket system works, as well as that we have to 'validate' our ticket before we get on the train (you get fined if you don't). She left us with a smile and the comment that the concierge or the front desk were there to help with anything we may need. Great arrival! Rooms We had booked the cheapest room at the hotel, and it was still fairly large. The bathroom has a separate bath and walk-in rainforest shower, as well as a telephone and a vanity mirror that doesn't steam up when the shower has been on (it is designed not to), which is useful for shaving etc. The bedroom has a large flatscreen TV, two direct dial telephones, a nespresso coffee machine (with six capsules, which are replaced daily), a minibar, a safe with an electrical outlet in it, meaning you can put your laptop/mobile phone on charge in the safe etc.) The room also has some interesting and stylish lamps. The bedside lamps were very good because they are totally adjustable up/down/left/right, so you can get a 'spot' of light on your book, without desturbing the person asleep next to you. Another little touch that made this hotel extra special was the fact that the desk had a proper, adjustable, work chair. There was also an armchair with footstall. There is also a minibar which, unlike so many hotels, doesn't automatically register items out -so for example, if you accidentally lift up a coke instead of a diet coke, you don't get charged (provided, of course, that you don't drink it.) Housekeeping check and re stock the minibar each day. There is a bit of extra space in there for you to put your own purchases in (we put a bottle of wine in there which we had been given as a present by a friend.) The room also has a 'pillow menu'. Now these are quite common in hotels these days, and I've never actually felt the need to change my pillows etc before, but the pillows on the bed were so soft you just sank through them. They offered 0 support. The mattress was also REALLY hard. So, like a complete ponce, I phoned housekeeping and got my pillows changed to memory foam ones, and also got a 'mattress softner' put on the bed. This was done with the minimum of fuss and made me feel slightly less like some really posh snob trying to be difficult. The adjustments made, I slept like a baby every night. Really very comfortable sleep. Food & Beverage offering On arrival, we were given a voucher for a free special cocktail in the bar, and the bar itself was fantastic -it is open every night until 2AM and has very good service. Breakfast was in Restaurant 44 -good selection of food from the buffet, along with a la carte items such as omelettes and waffles. The service was attentive throughout. We didn't use the hotel restaurant for any other meals, but did use room service quite a bit. The service takes the usual 30-40 minutes to arrive, but it is always presented very well on a table that they wheel into your room. The table is already set with place settings etc, and a fresh flower (they bring this even if you just order a pot of tea which they bring on a tray -again, a fresh flower is a small touch and shows attention to detail.) On the second day, we upgraded ourselves to the 'executive lounge'. The benefit of doing this (price was 30EUR each per day) was really that we could get breakfast in there, instead of paying 21EUR each for it downstairs, and you can get unlimited free drinks in the evening between 1730 and 2200, as well as hot food presentations and pralines. The lounge was quiet throughout our stay, and the service was always really superb -the person remembered us and our drink preferences (for instance, throughout Europe, if you order tea, they don't automatically bring milk, but this lady remembered that we take milk with tea, and brought milk each time -another little touch that differentiates this hotel from others.) Concierge This is the one negative I have for this hotel, and it really is what nearly stopped me from giving this hotel a 5 out of 5 rating. The concierge was rarely there. There is NO concierge service AT ALL on a Sunday, and during the week, he seems to take the afternoons off. Whilst this may seem like a small point, the Swissotel is a large five-star property, and I sort of expect to be able to go to the concierge desk after lunch at say 2pm and get information. Most hotels of this size have a team of concierges -this hotel only has the one. I guess this is also a plus, because, like the lounge, the concierge remembered me and queried how I had found the restaurant he had booked for me. Those who want to see Berlin needn't worry, I found that the front desk were very knowledgable about what to do, how to get to places, and dinner reservations etc when the concierge wasn't there. They didn't have the 'it's not my job' attitude that so many employees have these days, but they actually seemed to really want to exceed your expectations and to make you have the best time possible in Berlin. Technology The hotel does have wifi and wired internet...at a charge. I found the charge to be about average for a 5*, and did use it. There is also the 'business corner', which literally, and this is not one word of exaggeration, is two computers behind the concierge desk. If you didn't know it was there, you would think it was the concierge's office...The computers are free to use and you can also print for free, which is another nice little touch. Location The location of the hotel is good for the Ku'dam -a principal shopping street. You can easily walk (and it's a nice walk too) to KaDaWe, which is to Berlin what Harrods is to London, and to other shops too. Berlin has loads of Starbucks, which is unusual for a European city outside of the UK, and the nearest Starbucks is just 'round the corner from the hotel. Tube (S-bahn) stations are numerous -the closest, Ku'damm, is right outside the hotel: just go out of the main entrance/exit, turn right, and first right, and you're there. It is a bit further to get to, say, the Tiergaten/Reichstag/Brandenburg Gate, but I'd say you can walk it in 30 minutes, or get the S-Bahn, or get a taxi, which should cost you no more than 10 Euros. Verdict/Conclusion The Swissotel is my type of hotel. Luxurious? Yes. No it doesn't have massive opulent chandaliers like the Ritz, and the staff don't bow down to you. However, the hotel does exactly what it says on the tin (providing a 'Swiss' approach to hospitality). To define the service, I think it's best to say friendly but not 'in your face' -i.e. if you just want a cup of coffee and to read the 'paper in peace, you will be left alone. On the other hand, if you want a bit of advice on the menu, or what to see/do, any member of staff will cheerfully and enthusiastically tell you. The service is 'can do': that means that they don't like to say 'no'. Despite the hotel being completely sold out on our day of departure, the front desk gracefully granted a 3pm late checkout at no additional charge. It's little things like the things above, and like the late check out, and like being shown to my room, that I appreciate and that make me want to come back to the Swissotel over other 5* properties in Berlin. Berlin has loads of 5* properties -the InterContinental, the Ritz-Carlton, the Grand Hyatt, the Adlon, the JW Marriott, Hilton, Radisson Blu (with an acquarium in the lobby no less), but I think that the Swissotel, whilst not being a massive world-renowned brand, delivers everything that, say, an InterContinental can deliver (maybe excepting the concierge service), plus the little 'soft' touches that make you feel extra comfortable and welcome. Overall, an impressive hotel with friendly, genuine, staff and a very modern yet homely feel. I never felt out of place in jeans or shorts, for example.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence.”
Reviews.Author: thomaspc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in late June 2010. Couldn't fault anything about this hotel. The 44 restaurant is superb. Reasonablty priced as well. Would definitely recommend to other people.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: EvetheLondoner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend, and Swissotel offered a great base to explore the city. Near to S and U bahn it made day and evening excursions to the old city a doddle. In retrospect we may have chosen to stay in East Berlin nearer the tourist spots, but Swissotel was a lovely hotel and so would heartily recommend staying here. Do look for the room only deals as they can offer fab value for money, though even at full price you can expect to be treated well with cleanliness and room quality at a premium as you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. The only glitch was a very unhelpful concierge who was reluctant to advise a restaurant one evening, preferring to send us to a restaurant which he was blatantly getting kickbacks on. He also critcised what turned out to be one of our fave restaurants of our stay (and funnily enough the current #2 on this site!).

Reviews.Title: “Wowzers!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: I don't know how familiar you are with European hotels, but I booked this deal with a package deal(airfare, hotel, etc). I was expecting a tiny room with bad service, but I was floored by this memorable stay. Upon arriving, every staff member, from the bellhop to the front desk to the restaurant staff were pleasant and so kind. I can't say enough good things about this place. Upon arriving, we were offered an upgrade to the club level for $50 for the entire trip. TAKE IT! We were given a nicer, bigger, room, and access to the lounge which serves soda, drinks, and 3 meals a day!! I must say, I practically lived in this lounge. And it was soooo yummy. I nearly cried when I had to leave this place. It was really beautiful and modern, and the staff was so wonderful. Overall, this hotel significantly added to the experience of my entire trip. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but expected more”
Reviews.Author: smast
Reviews.Content: Maybe i expect a little more from a 5 star hotel, but i found the rooms basic and a little small, no view and were overlooking a dull grey courtyard facing other rooms, the airconditioning didnt work in my room and after a long flight on a hot june night and unpacking it was the last thing i needed, after an hour or 2 the electrician and confirmed there was nothing they could do to fix it and we were moved, but to another small uninspiring room, Went to eat in the Restraunt on a Sunday and was told it wasnt open! The staff were polite and helpful though but wont be returning, which is unfortunate after reading the good reviews on here ,,

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, sparkly clean hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for old school Berlin, this isn't the hotel for you! This hotel is only a few years old, and the design is very clean, cool, and open. Totally modern. I felt that the staff really made up for the rather cold architecture. Everyone I interacted with was very friendly and spoke English well (and appreciated my attempts at German.) Depending on your interests, the Swissotel is in an excellent location. I especially appreciated the Vapiano across the street. But, seriously, it is on one of the key shopping streets and 2 blocks from one of the primary transit hubs for the city, zoo garten. The city buses to Tegel airport takes about 15 - 20 minutes for 2.10 Euro and runs every few minutes -- talk about convenient! My room was very spacious and clean. I had a window looking out onto the street and really didn't hear any street noise except for the riot (and I do mean riot) of a whole lot of cars and people making a whole lot of noise for a few hours on Kufurstendamm following Germany's win over Australia in its first game of the World Cup. Such is the price you pay for being in the middle of one of the main squares of the city! I appreciated that it is close to the quaint and quiet old neighborhood of Charlottenburg (sp?) where there are lots of nice cafes, restaurants, bars, and shops. From the zoo garten station you can take a nice double-decker bus to the east/Potsdamer Platz or even rent a bike. One con of this joint is that in-room internet use is VERY expensive. I was told that they have free-of-charge internet computers in the business center, but I didn't use them. Another con is that the fitness center is, well, not really a fitness center. It's 2 bikes, a treadmill, and a stair machine with a single multi-function nautilus machine. I was uber disappointed. But, they did have fresh apples and a water cooler -- which made up for the lack of variety and size. They have a sauna area. I think I got a great deal on this hotel by using expedia and booking a non-refundable room, paid in advance, several months ahead of time. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in Berlin for the price”
Reviews.Author: truth40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and has a lot to offer. What surprised me the most is that the price was very reasonable even if it is a 5 star hotel. It is located right in the center of Berlin and one can walk to so many places I would use this hotel again when I go to Berlin as thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nights stay there. the concierge was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could move in!”
Reviews.Author: Writerincognito
Reviews.Content: Agree with the last review: "immaculate" is the right word. We got a fantastic price through the Swissotel website, and got a room on the 8th floor that was, yes, immaculate. I noticed we'd been upgraded to a city view room, rather than looking over the courtyard, and the floor to ceiling windows with stylish white blinds and the view beyond that, made the room really sing. Beautifully comfy bed, spic and span bathroom with separate bath and shower, and I love the free Nespresso in the room - very nice touch. All the other little touches like extra pull out shelves to use, and a lined umbrella holder, really made the room stand out too. Room service and minibar are crazy five star prices, give those a miss - but they have a small quick breakfast option of pastries and hot drink in the lobby for a cheaper morning if you don't want to go the full buffet. However, the full breakfast buffet is lovely, and likewise, in a sunfilled room with a gorgeous floor to ceiling view. It's very European, with not many hot options, but beautiful cheeses, breads, meats, yoghurts, fruit, etc. I've never had anything but excellent service at a Swissotel, and this was no exception - friendly, warm and personal. Valet parking is available under the hotel which is nice, although it is quite difficult to find out the price. At 18 euros a day, you can find parking for under half that round the neighbourhood if that's an issue for you - but I was glad the hire car was safe and sound in the hotel. Neighbourhood is fancy and conservative, on the main shopping strip, though also near the central station where things are, well, the way they are near any central station anywhere! Also close to a whole range of restaurants, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and well equipped”
