Reviews.Author: weeduck18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, check in was smooth and easy, staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was excellent, immaculate, well equipped and the bed was extremely comfortable. We didn't have breakfast here so I can't comment on the food but the bar was great to have a night cap in even if the drinks were a little pricy as you would expect. The location was ideal with easy access to local train and underground stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ACVIANA
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Berlin and want to stay at the heart of the Berlin choose this hotel. It exceeed my expectations, breakfast buffet is to die for. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Rave! Delightful stay - many nice touches, especially for kids”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: I chose the Swisshotel after spending several other sleepless nights at un-airconditioned un-ventillated "5*" Marriott and Westin hotels in Germany. I ditched my loyalties and went for the best Tripadvisor hotel where nobody complained about the A/C. The Swisshotel had great reviews and deserves them all. The HVAC worked perfectly, the room had many many ammenities, and we got a great night of sleep. Our room, at 95 Euros per night, included a full and delightful breakfast, including kitchen made to order egg items. The room had many nice touches. The crib I requested on my internet booking was in the room on arrival along with a personalized welcome card. In addition they provided, without request, a bottle warmer, diaper bucket, baby wipes, a baby tub, and a baby towel! I've never seen this kind of super helpful baby service at any hotel no matter the stars. Other free ammenities: full sized chocolate bar, large bottle of water, stocked netspresso machine, bowl of fruit (4-5 pears and apples), separate tub and shower, very good lighting. (probably the best hotel lighting I've ever seen) A bit on the character of the Swisshotel. To me it was luxurious because my family got a great night of sleep, the HVAC was working, and there were many many nice little touches. However the decor of the Swisshotel is very Swiss: extremely boring efficiency and effectiveness to the max. There are no gold plated fixtures or fancy furniture that might define luxury to some. To me the Swisshotel Berlin is my new favorite hotel in Europe. Thank you Swisshotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, modern, great location”
Reviews.Author: burnsj1956
Reviews.Content: I am a great fan of modern hotels and the Swissotel was one of the best. All mod-cons, sleek and fancy without being gaudy. Friendly staff, great location, big rooms with a decent restaurant and bar. Only minor fault might be that the lobby is on the first floor, I found that strange, but then again maybe I'm a little old fashioned. All in all an excellent hotel and I would definitely stay there again when next in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotek, hot spot!”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be neat though the rooms seemed to be pretty small. The location was perfect for shopping, sightseeing and dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: MinnyHelsinki
Reviews.Content: I went to Swissotel Berlin for 3 nights with my husband last week. The hotel was very good and the staff were as friendly and helpful as they always are in Swissotels. We even got a late check-out on our last day until 5 p.m. free of charge when our flight left at 7 p.m. This was really appreciated since our feet were aching from all the walking around Berlin! The location of the hotel is also excellent; you can walk to shops, zoo, etc. and the U-bahn station is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Top German hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fruin
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Germany, my wife and I booked to stay for one week. Not needing much more than a clean place to sleep at night, we received a pleasant surprise. I honestly can't rate this hotel highly enough. The customer service is great, restaurant fantastic and the location superb for sight seeing. Both of us travel frequently and if all hotels were half as good every trip would be a pleasure. So why the late review I hear you ask. I've only just created a profile on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for a city break”
Reviews.Author: EllaInTheSky
Reviews.Content: We loved the Swissotel. It is a big corporate hotel but seems to have a bit more soul than the Hilton's and Ramada's. It is right in the middle of anything cool and trendy that Berlin has to offer. The rooms were pure quality - we stayed in a junior suite and enjoyed comfortable beds, a smashing view over the city, a lovely coffee machine and a great breakfast. Really recommended

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: MarcoRodrigues
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Berlin is not only perfected placed on the heart of town . It is not only luxious . It has one of the best restaurants in Berlin ( the 44 ) , with an amazing view . And the employees of the hotel are the mostt kind , nice and interested you will ever met . Maybe me and my wife were lucky ... I don't know , but our stay of 4 days in Belin was even better at this place . Big , clean , new and practical room . Nice bathroom with the shower separated from the bath tube . Nespresso coffe free of charge inside the room . Nice bar , with a fair selection of wines . So , to simplify it in a single word : Perfect !

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be better”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: The location is the best Marvelous views from Avenue Service is the the best remark of the hotel, seems that everyone understand here, that their commitment is to give you a perfect stay. Front desk, restaurant, bell boy, everyone is very kind. Rooms are clean, wide, new and with all the services functioning well Food in restaurant is really delicious You will be surprised on this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - great service, great quality”
Reviews.Author: despod
Reviews.Content: From the minute we got to the reception desk we felt that the service was good, efficient and thorough. There was a large group leaving but the desk was totally organsied and ready for the next wave of visitors. Rooms were of excellent quality and the toiletries were nice. Each room also has a Nespresso machine which mean that you were never short of nice coffee. Breakfast was excellent and very extensive - the variety had to be seen and the breakfast service (waiting staff) was very good. Food service in the lobby area was also good and friendly and not all that expensive either. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME city - BRILLIANT hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: danioko
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel - is a pure diamond set in the wonderful city of Berlin. Swissotel is stylish luxury hotel centrally located just off the fashionable Kurfuerstendamm in the heart of Berlin. Here you will find the most amazing array of department stores offering everything from world class chocolate and truffles to regular and designer clothing. Nestled between each department store you will find all the regular European high street stores such as Zara, H&M and Espirit. The hotel in relation to transport networks sits on Zoologischer Garten line of the rail network. Travelling from Schoenefeld airport travellers will leave the airport and walk across the road to the train station. Once inside travellers should take the S9 service to OSTKREUZ - change here and take any of the departing trains towards Zoologischer Garten. You must buy your ticket first at the machines (2.10 Euro's) and then there is a small machine on each platform. IMPORTANT: You must validate your own ticket using these smaller machines on the platform. Their are no guards on board but you may be checked by station guards as you leave the train at your station. As you leave the station you will see a small square dominated by a semi-ruined church (Kaiser Wilhelm memorial church) in front of you. You should walk across the road with the church to your left and walk straight ahead. You will soon be greeted with a large glass structure, with C&A dominating the lowers floors (YES this store still exists in Germany as does Woolworths!) Walk around the corner as you cannot miss the hotel entrance with its welcoming red carpets and topiary dwarf tree's. At first it seems strange to enter a hotel and not be immediately greeted by the reception, however this some how adds to the nicety of the Swissotel Berlin. Once you have taken the lift to the reception you will now experience the high class service of this hotel. The lobby is a relatively spacious space with sleek smooth shaped and edges to fixtures, fittings and furniture, very modern and contemporary. Within the lobby you will find the obvious reception desk and concierge as well as a small snack bar serving a variety of world wines and simple snacks. Back to the checkin.... I have stayed in many, many high end hotels in my profession and I have to say that the sincere and warm service received by reception staff at this hotels indefinitely ranks amongst the highest and best ever. As soon as I was checked in the same staff member showed me around the lobby area and where the bars and restaurants were. He also showed me to my room, taking my bags for me - en route he explained about all the artwork that adorned the walls of the hotel. This type of service is usually for boutique hotels and guest houses only so a wonderful touch for a chain hotel. Once inside the room I was quite surprised by the space. The décor is like the rest of the hotel, modern and contemporary, however unlike many chain hotels it still managed to make the room feel homely and less like a typical hotel. Within the room was two twin beds, which is where my only gripe lies. I do not believe in 2009/2010 any hotel should offer single beds. If a twin is asked for then two doubles should be given, which there was more than enough space in this room. The room itself however was of exceptional quality and immaculately clean. The bathroom is of a quality, which EVERY high end hotel should adhere to. Like everyone has commented on here, the Nespresso machine is a very fine touch to the room and a god send after a looong day of walking and sightseeing. All twin rooms are placed overlooking the courtyard, which in itself is a shame as it is nice to be given a choice, however this doesn't really take away any values. Each floor of the hotel has a different piece of artwork whether it be a painting of sculpture and well worth a look on its own. A FANTASTIC feature of this hotel is the subtle yet effective security the hotel has in place. As well as having small dome cameras in the lobby and public areas nobody can access guest floors without a card from reception, which of course only hand out to guests. You room card doubles up as you access card to your floor. There are NO stairs to guest bedrooms. Each morning myself and friend went down to breakfast in the restaurant and found the service to be once again second to none. Each staff member was ultra attentive whether it be showing you to your table to asking if we would like anything else i.e pancakes etc. At night the restaurant turns in to Restaurant 44, a Michelin starred restaurant that must be tried! I have to be honest and say the only member of staff, which lets down the hotel is sadly the concierge. It is MORE important in a high end hotel that the concierge is attentive and listens well to what the guest is asking. Apart from being quite rude he is also just not very good having been unable to answer several questions either from myself or what other guests have said in conversation. HOWEVER this must not distract from the near perfection of the standard of service from everyone else. If I was to rate this hotel out of 10 then I would say it is a very, very comfortable 8. The reason it is not quite higher is simple because there is no pool or spa facility. I was told by the central reservations team in Canada that the hotel had a pool. In fact it has a fairly small room with 5 pieces of gym kit, a small sauna room and an extra large shower that is all. This is such a shame because I really do not feel that installing a small jacuzzi and possibly pool would take away too much from other areas of the hotel yet make a massive difference. After speaking to a lot of people during my staff almost every guest commented on the lack of pool so it clearly shows how many people expected it. The Swissotel is indefinitely a hotel, which ever visitor to Berlin should consider. In comparison to other high end hotels in Berlin the Swissotel has to be probably one of the nicest. Whilst it is quite generic in looks like most chain hotels it certainly is unique in its quality of staff, high end level of service, god quality food and drink and warmness usually displayed in smaller family run hotels. A WONDERFUL BIRTHDAY STAY THANK YOU SWISSOTEL BERLIN. P.S. It was amazing that on New Years Eve I returned back to my hotel from a morning of sightseeing to get changed for the massive celebrations at the Brandenburg Gate and was greeted by a birthday cake and birthday card from the hotel - AMAZING!! What other hotel does this off their own backs. I have yet to find another!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: plymview
Reviews.Content: We travelled as 2 couples and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff could not be faulted and were very friendly and helpful. The Nespresso machine is a great touch! The rooms are a decent size and well fitted-out. The only small criticism was that it was too warm at night even with the air-conditioning, so we had to open a window. The bed was firm but comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with a good selection of toiletries. Breakfast was excellent and nothing was too much trouble for the staff (although my husband, being a Scotsman, thought they should have had porridge!!). The situation of the hotel is good with the main shops within 5-10 minutes walk, the Gedachtniskirche only a couple of minutes away (really worth a visit when dark) and the great Christmas market. Zoo station is also only a few minutes walk, from where you can go almost anywhere in Berlin. We bought a daily group ticket which was great value for money at about 15 euros. We found Potsdam well worth a visit. We love Berlin generally and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tjug685
Reviews.Content: We got this room on Hotwire, at a wonderful price. We were extremely excited to stay at such a nice hotel. It lived up to its rating, very clean and modern. The staff was helpful. The bed and linen were a little stiff and hard, not as comfy as we like, but that's the kind of thing that varies from person to person. Overall, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: epic_fin
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is located conveniently at Ku'Damm in West Berlin, with loads of shopping opportunities and restaurants around as well as easy access to public transport. The rooms are clean & comfortable (loved the Nespresso machine!) and the service is friendly and efficient. In other words: this is a very, very good hotel that provides a great base for exploring the amazing city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TriptravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great service, very clean and comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NickyR4
Reviews.Content: Right at the end of the Ku'damm, near to the big department store and the bombed out church, very easy to access all the tourist stuff. Hotel excellent, and not too expensive with great service from the most efficient race on the planet! Highly recommended for a weekend break or for longer. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that is great value and modern and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Cancertourist
Reviews.Content: This is my third review as I keep getting disconnected. The Swissotel is great; quiet, clean, well run, safe, etc. and a good value if you take advantage of some of the special package rates available through the web site. Some require prepayment and are not refundable, but are excellent value. The Restaurant 44 is also ecellent, and very good value compared with Vau, Margaux, The First Floor and other top Berlin restaurants that are at least twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: 34isit
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. No complaints, the room was clean & comfortable. The Nespresso coffee maker was nice. Good security, scan your room key in the elevator to access your floor. Large windows, which opened. The restaurant across the street, Vapiano, was nice. The location was not far from a U-bahn station and a little farther to a S-bahn station. The Ku’damm shopping street is a few steps away. The hotel provides a lot of extras – doorman, three room phones, robes and slippers, 110 volt outlet, separate shower and tub. Not sure how much value these represent to the typical tourist. The hotel is designed for the business traveler, not so much for the tourist. Services, like the restaurant and wifi, are a bit expensive, meant for the expense account crowd. On my last visit, I stayed at the much more modest ‘Hotel-Pension Bregenz’ a few more blocks out the Ku’damm. I liked it much better. For a future visit, I’ll first look for a more interesting location, probably in the eastern sections.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: billiejoe
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisors listing of Swissotel as one of the top luxury hotels in Europe we chose to stay at this hotel for our trip to Berlin. We were not disappointed in any way. The location in West Berlin is ideal. It is located on the Ku'Damm which is a Champs Elysee style street complete with beautiful shops, cafes, restaurants and close to the underground, sightseeing tour buses and the Zoo. Upon arrival in the morning they accommodated us for an early check in which was so appreciated after a full day of travel. The person at reception gave us a tour of the lobby, restaurant , bar facilities and then escorted us to the elevator. The lobby is like a modern art gallery full of abstract paintings of Berlin. Our room faced the courtyard which was very quiet. The room itself was the typical size of an American hotel furnished in a modern, sleek manner. Built in cabinets housed the wardrobe, flat screen t.v. and desk area. My husband was delighted to see complimentary shoe shine service and a pant presser in the room as well as a coffee maker and fridge.. A hot buffet breakfast was included in the rate which was lovely and served in a beautiful room complete with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Ku'Damm. The concierge was fabulous....very helpful and full of suggestions. My favorite thing to do was to visit the Literaryhaus and Wintergarten cafe which is just a couple of blocks away. First of all it is on the prettiest street in Berlin complete with lovely homes, hidden courtyards and interesting galleries. The Wintergarten cafe is situated in a garden that is a peaceful little gem in busy Berlin. Strolling the garden and visiting the museum next door is delightful. I would highly recommend the Swissotel due to it's location, service and sense of style.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pkr2000
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff with good sized rooms. The price of the in-room internet was a little high (in fact more than free is a little high) and they did forget to clean the room on one day, which I'm sure they would have done if I wasn't too tired to tell them. For some reason it was always noisy above the room at about 6:30am, not sure why. Overall a nice place to stay but you'll need a travel card if you want to see the sites (5 min walk to S-bahn, 10 min train to nr Brandenburg gate).

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel In Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: carrigman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Swissotel for 4 nights. It is an excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The room was large and very well equipped and had a commanding view over the Kurfurstendamm. The lobby area was a pleasant place to relax with a drink after a busy day. The hotel itself is very conveniently located near the mainline and U-Bahn Zoo Station (just a few minutes walk away) and is thus ideal for travelling to and from the airport (Schonefeld in our case) and for getting around Berlin on the tube. I would highly recommend the hotel and it would be our hotel of choice should we re-visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “durable memory”
Reviews.Author: affenzahn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been one of the best business hotels I have ever visited. The beds are super confti, the ambience relaxing - tonnes of towles and the cleanliness absolutely perfect. Situated in one of the most knowen shopping streets, one finds loads of restaurants, bars (incl. happy end) and shops just steps away. The management cares about you and if you have a problem a solution will be found within minutes. Over all - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra033
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest hotels i have stayed in my life. Nice,friendly and helpfull staff,great and modern interior. Location is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Reese619
Reviews.Content: It locates centrally at the zoology garden, The shopping center is nearby as well as good neighborhoods with lots of restaurants. Had very comfortable stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: woodie49
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights 12-17 Sept in a standard room at Swissotel. The service was excellent as was the breakfast, we don't understand the poor reviews about breakfasts at all, for which we were spoiled for choice. We asked to sit by a window the first morning and thereafter we were shown to a window table. Reception and conciege answered any questions with a smile. We received a warm friendly welcome on arrival and were given a mini tour of the hotel facilites. Lifts and rooms are accessed by swipe card adding to the security. We arrived before check in time and left after checkout time with no problem, and always a smile. The spacious, well equipped room was spotless and the bathroom was very modern, with the addition of a frighteningly effective, well lit make up/shaving mirror! Of importance to us was the quiet. So many hotels we have stayed in have been noisy. Not once were we disturbed in the night. Bliss. We arrived at Shonefeld Airport and took the Shonefeld Express train to Zoo Station, the fare for the two of us was just over £5 and took 35 mins. The conductor even advised us as we approached our station. The hotel is but a 5 minute stroll from the station. When sight seeing, we returned to the vicinity of Zoo station to catch the number 100 or 200 buses which came every few minutes and covered all the main sights so we did not waste money on a "sightseeing bus". The purchase of a "Welcome card" at the tourist info, situation between the station and the hotel, saved us money on museum entries and enabled an easy hop on, hop off on the buses. It can also be used in a number of shops and restaraunts. An earlier trip advisor review mentioned the Italian restaurant opposite the hotel, Vapiano's, and we were not disappointed. Meals are cooked in front of you and are very reasonable starting at just over £5 pizza/pasta. We would also recomment the Alte Berliner bier salon, also just across the road for reasonably priced traditional German food, with the option of outside tables. For a light picnic, the Upper Crust Bakery at Zoo station do fresh filled baguettes and pastries to take away. We had an excellent holiday and would definitely return to Swissotel ourselves and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: andricScotland
Reviews.Content: Like all Swissotels I have visited, Berlin provides high quality accommodation and service. The major benefits for Swissotel Berlin are its location and staff. The location is perfect for shopping, public transport and the zoo. The staff are all equally adept at providing the highest quality service, although a special mention must go to the reception staff who were universally terrific. The room was very spacious and had terrific floor to ceiling windows. The room was non smoking, however for the 5 days we were resident there was always a smell of cigarettes. A major drawback that remains for Swissotel, and many large hotel chains, is the lack of free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “They made me so happy!”
Reviews.Author: Trekkern
Reviews.Content: Excellent service! Nice staff, great beautiful room on 10´th floor and a wonderful breakfast. No problem with lactosfree products. As good as it can be!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: watty77
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel with a heart. Check in was smooth & easy. Room was wonderful with a great view of the Ku Dam . I liked the low floor lighting for night time trips !! The staff were lovely & very helpful. Well placed on the Kudam ( above C&A !) Breakfast was very good & in a smart room with views along the main street. Would visit again . Thanks to all the staff for our lovely stay XXXXXXXXXXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: eilotas
Reviews.Content: our stay in the hotel was nice with no problems or worries. though the hotel has a huge disadvantage. the atmosphere in the lobby is so cold. you must take the elevator to go to the reception where you find just a small lounge in a cold modern hall. i always used to drink a coffee or a drink in every 5 star hotel i ve stayed but there i didnt stay for even two minutes. the room was nice.. a + for the lavazza coffee maker but it could be bigger. fantastic bathroom, very clean and nice. very good breakfast also very good location. generally a nice hotel but the first look (lobby) makes the difference sometime

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically helpful staff, nothing was too much.”
Reviews.Author: piccolo20
Reviews.Content: Only 15 mins by cab from Tegel Airport. Near the shops and with great views. Travelled with a friend to attend a family wedding. We arrived to find that we had been booked into a double room, which the staff immediately changed to a twin upon request. The hotel were very helpful in providing google maps for directions from the hotel to the two wedding venues (this included estimated times and cost of cabs). Although the breakfast at the hotel was very good, if you are on a budget the a la carte menu in the main restuarant may not be for you as it was very pricey, especially now that pound is so week against the euro!! We found that the better option was to eat in the snack area of the hotel which serves a good selection of meals at a more reasonable price - almost a third cheaper. All in all not an inexpensive hotel but we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Serene oasis in center of former West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Unter4Augen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2-night stay at the Swissotel, which is within a stone's throw of the Gedaechtniskirche (the bombed church in former W. Berlin), the Ku'damm and a metro station. The service was impeccable and the interior modern without being overly trendy. Probably most appropriate for adults, but we did see a few kids. Perfect for business, too (although, as is often the case in Europe, there is no free wireless service). A small business center offers free internet access, however. A lovely, light-filled lobby would be appropriate as a meeting place for business people. Swissotel's location, in the former center of the west, is no longer the center of Berlin, which has moved back to its historic location in the east. We did end up taking some 20-minute Metro rides to go sightseeing, but public transportation is excellent. For shopping, however, the Ku'damm is still outstanding and there are numerous "normal" stores (like C&A and drugstores) surrounding this hotel, in case you forget to pack something. A 15-minute walk will bring you to the KaDeWe and its wonderful "Kaffee und Kuchen" meeting spot on the 5th floor. All in all, a highly recommended hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel - great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week - booked through DERTour in UK - recommend them highly. Room quite small & IKEA-ish, but bathroom very good & breakfast excellent. Location great - right by shops & loads of restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Also very near Zoo station to get anywhere else, plus there is an Ulrich supermarket just next to the Erotic Museum on the way back from Zoo station to buy water, drinks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipposWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my teenage daughter for a 2 night weekend. I managed to book a twin room on the website which was available for us when we checked in around midday. We had a very good rate including breakfast. Although the room was fairly simply furnished, it was well appointed and spacious. I liked having the coffee machine and when there was a problem with it, we did not have to wait long for a member of staff to come and sort it out. The bathroom was beautiful with a bath and separate shower. The hotel was convenient for tpublic transport, shopping and the zoo. We used the no. 100 bus a lot (it left from outside the zoo, went through the Tiergarten, by the Reichstag and Brandenburg gate and then all the way down Untter den Linden to the museum island. The breakfast was good with hot items being cooked to order. We did not ask a lot of questions of the staff, but when we did they were friendly and helpful, and our request for a late checkout was dealt with very promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: BernieJohnson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the swissotel for two nights during a long weekend trip to Berlin. We chose this particular hotel based on the positive recommendations from other reviewers. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff were very helpful, friendly and efficient. Check-in went like clock-work despite our early arrival and our room, whilst not particularly large, was comfortable, modern and very clean. Having a separate shower in the bathroom was nice. Make sure you book a room looking out over the city rather than facing into the atrium. The breakfast was excellent, with a good choice of food combined with first rate service. Whilst I would not rate the hotel accommodation as 5-star, the overall value for money and staff were excellent. If you are staying in Berlin for site-seeing then you should note that the hotel is located in Kurfurstendamm which is great for shopping but about 2 to 3 miles from the main site seeing attractions. However , if you buy a Berlin Vistors Welcome Card, you can travel on any of the excellent transport systems in the city. We found the S-Bahn train (from the Zoologischer Garten Station) the best way of getting to and from East Berlin with for us had all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel for long weekend in April with family. Rooms had excellent view to Kudam (no noise although on low floor-think it was 4th) and were spacious and very clean. Service overall excellent and location is great for Kudam and transport links to former East Berlin (Zoo Station short walk away). There is a posh restaurant inside the hotel with very good food and great ambience (although not as much value for money as the hotel itself!)

Reviews.Title: “Truley excellent service.. with an act of compassion”
Reviews.Author: Son-of-Poochmas
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for a meeting at the convention center. Paid $220 night. This hotel is ranked very high (within top 3 in Berlin) on tripadvisor - and with a very good reason ! Service truely is excellent. PROS: 1. After transatlantic voyage - dead tired: they let us check in SIX hours early ! We were so moved. What hotel lets you do that? 2. Food is superb, expensive but excellent. recommend the breakfast buffet at the restaurant. 3. I can't say enough about how helpful the concierge and front desk was to us first-timers. Take a doubledecker hop on/off tour of Berlin. 4. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are not big, but all with very nice view of K'dam. Close to everything. The S-Ban is easy to use and goes everywhere. 5. When expresso machine was down -within minutes we were serviced. 6. The gym is small by US standards but has treadmills and a lat machine. CONS: A few minor ones 1. Bed is a bit hard 2. Air conditioning was not very strong.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: ShTraveler01
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly fine hotel in the heart of Berlin, with many plusses and a few minor minuses. Plusses: 1, The hotel is right at the busiest intersection in Ku'damm, the center of West Berlin. Everything is within reach. The U-bahn is right outside the front door. The location cannot be beat. 2. The rooms are spotless, and does not exude a cold ambience, as in many other Berlin hotels. 3. The service is very personable. 4. Decent coffee machine in the room. Minuses: 1. Guests have to take two elevators to get to rooms. 2. If you stay in a Ku'damm view room, it's a long hike to the elevators. 3 The rooms are on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ferbent
Reviews.Content: I can't fault this hotel and rate it as one the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The location is great, close to shops, restaurants, the zoo, and the metro. Parking is available in the building for a fee. The staff were amazing, really helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to take care of us which is unusual for a big hotel such as this. The room itself was to a very high standard and spotlessly clean. Bathrobes, slippers, iron etc was all included and wifi was available at a price. The fitness centre was also spotless and included a sauna as well at quality gym equipment. Try the Italian cafe/restaurant next door where they cook your meal in front of you while you wait - delicious and cheap! Or eat at the Michelin starred restaurant in the hotel. I loved this hotel and will definitely stay there next time I'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Can say enough good things about the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: LizaG
Reviews.Content: I was completely thrilled with the Swissotel in Berlin. First, all the employees are interested in the gueat. But most importantly, the hotel room itself was terrific. It had a spacious, comfortable bed with what appeared to be 400 thread count linens. The room was ABSOLUTELY quiet. It was also quiet large, had a good view, and the bathroom was modern and spotless. I loved this hotel and wish there were one in Paris and New York.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating. Friendly. Professional.”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyHikers
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this 5* hotel in the heart of Berlin we will certainly return without a doubt. The service standards are extremely high, the quality and presentation of the hotel, rooms and public areas are second to none. The breakfast was first class and although we didn't eat in the Michelin rated restaurant we are sure that if we had we would not be disappointed. We did however, partake in cocktails in the relaxing bar and couldn't find fault, again the service was impeccable. Well done and thanks for a great stay to all those at the Swissotel, Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for an amazing hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: DHHArizona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! The location is in a perfect place. It is within walking distance to pretty much everything and buses and subways are 2 seconds away. Even though it is close to everything, it is still completely quiet at night. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There was complimentary water and apples in the lobby and complimentary coffee was available in the room with an espresso maker. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and has a stylish, modern decor. The glass elevators are really cool. If you are going to Berlin, you must stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Wanted”
Reviews.Author: mark319
Reviews.Content: I took my 82 year old father to Berlin for 6 days and we choose the swissotel for our base. The hotel is charming, the breakfast buffet superb, the drinks in the lounge in the evening excellent (ask Harry for his specials). Important to be was the 1 block to the underground and 3 blocks to the S train. My father gets tired easily and we could cover the whole city quite well with these close connections. We got quite a reasonable rate of 135 euros including breakfast. the hotel staff were attentive and very friendly and made us feel very welcome. Sure having wireless in the fee would have been perfect but the 5 day rate of 46 euro was certainly in line or lower then many in the States. the room was large for European hotels, fresh, the expresso coffee maker was a fantastic addition. While many of the places to see are in other areas, there are numerous places to eat and or have a drink right around the hotel. Very nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi not included, you are kiddin' me!”
Reviews.Author: KimGN
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is right next door to the Gedächniskirche in old West-Berlin and within walking distance to the KaDeWe, which everyone should visit at least once in a lifetime. It is a real 5 star hotel that even has the obligatory telephone in the bathroom. (stupid rule, but they have it.) apart from that the room is good, but you have to pay extra for using the Wifi (that works very well, btw.) - Swissotel: welcome to the 21st century, this really detracts from the overall experience! I did love that the bathroom has both a shower and a bath too. If you can get a room with a view, it must be astounding. I had a nice view of the courtyard, but granted, did not pay much. The service is impeccable however and breakfast and meals - if you get them at the hotel - are very good. I had some problems getting the included Espresso-machine work, but it was good when I found out. I would have exchanged the machine for Wifi every second though...

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: bissett1
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site I was quietly confident that the hotel would deliver and it truly did. The staff were so polite and so helpful I doff my hat to them. The hotel has a 1st class feel at a low cost price. I could go on and on but i won't bore you. The hotel is in a brilliant spot for access to shops and the local nightlife. Close to the underground system and the main station at Zoogarden. Now, if like me you'd like to know how to get there, it couldn't be easier. if you arriving at Schoenefeld airport simply walk out from arrivals and walk straight to the airports entrance/exit. Once outside if you look to your left you'll see a covered walkway heading north and away from the airport. Walk along the walkway and when prompted take a left down into the basement of the station. Once there you'll notice there isn't a ticket office. Simply walk up to one of the ticket machines and press the language button on the screen so you can begin to understand whats going on. Your destination is Berlin - Zoogarden. The ticket will cost you around 5euros. You will find that the trains the 'airport express' as its called come every half hour. Once you're at Zoogarden walk outside and with the station behind you, go right. Head that way and you should see the hotel after 3-4mins of walking. I do hope that helps. If i do get the opportunity to go to Berlin again I'll definitely stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: UKPinkPanther
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year period. It is situated in an excellent city centre location – ideal for shopping! First class breakfasts and friendly, helpful staff throughout the establishment. Will stay here again on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff, Questionable Location”
Reviews.Author: StrandsDanville
Reviews.Content: We were first time tourists in Berlin. Even though this hotel is located relatively close to the S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations we found ourselves just returning from the sites on the East side each day. There are really no sites near this corporate style hotel. Our room was relatively small, on the 4th floor, with no view except the city street. All the staff was terrific. I would recommend locating closer to the Tiergarten or on the East side.

Reviews.Title: “Usual high standards”
Reviews.Author: BeanoSurrey
Reviews.Content: I've tended to choose Swissotel's of late due to their high standards and excellent service and the one here in Berlin is no different. Though the building may seem old on the outside the inside is modern and very clean. It has a small fitness suite and sauna but as I didn't use it this time the size wasn't a concern or major factor The staff, as always, are extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are well kept and furnished. The hotel has several conference rooms and on the 'ground' floor, there's a bar and nice seating area where you can order snacks or just sit and relax. The hotel is nicely situated with several U and S bahn stations very close by and the Kur'dam is right on your door step with KaDeWe, among may other shops, just a short stroll away. The only downside to staying with Swissotel is that drinks in the bar and breakfast can be very expensive but given there are plenty of places nearby this shouldn't cause too much of a problem. Swissotel's may not be the cheapest to stay in and may be too 'modern' for some, but for now, they're one of my prefered places due to their quality and as the old adage goes, 'you get what you pay for'

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: LeaAthens
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good location, great breakfast. the only drawback was that that use of the garage was charged extra.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but hardly 5-star”
Reviews.Author: yaneh
Reviews.Content: The good: -- beautiful lobby -- good location, near KaDeWe, the U-Bahn and S-Bahn, though the area is very much like a shopping mall -- very clean, very comfortable beds The bad: -- decor in room was very plain, as someone said earlier, "nice Ikea" -- the minibar was very limited -- no 24 hour room service -- concierge kept odd hours and in his absence, the reception desk was not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: GarethRhysMorgan
Reviews.Content: Location - not close to the major sights (apart from the 'bombed' church) but within walking distance of one of the main Berlin bus and train stations so it is easy to get around the city. Very near all the shops. Hotel - efficient check in, small gym, small business centre, rooms nice and had everything you'd need. We had a room overlooking the road which was far nicer than the rooms that only seem to view the strange plastic cows on top of the atrium! Doormen were pleasant and always willing to chat. Reception and housekeeping were cheerful and helpful. A little disappointed with concierge - even the 'head concierge' couldn't locate two of the main sights on a map for us and struggled with anything other than the standard list of restaurant recommendations. Restaurants - Orangestrasse had lots of very nice restaurants.....it is in the red light district but don't let that put you off, it is anything but seedy. Vapiano - Italian across from the hotel is worth a look as well - standard pasta and pizza dishes but cooked to order, good price and the 'credit card' swiping system for food is something that more places should do. Sightseeing - avoid the sightseeing buses and get on the number 100 bus which pretty much follows the offical bus route. Go to the Reichstag but be prepared for queues to get to the dome, Bernauer strasse for the Berlin Wall is a must, there's a 1km section of wall remaining down by Ostbahnof which is off the main tourist trail. Other than that, plenty of things to see down near Alexanderplatz. Was pretty impressed with Berlin as a city and the hotel was good in all areas, if not spectacular in any.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerscarlett
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 3 times and each time we have loved it. The staff are very helpful. We stay here with are two children and they put special children's bedding in the rooms and children's toiletries in the bathrooms. They have age appropiate accessories for them too. For example when my daughter was a baby they had a bottle and a bottle warmer in the room but when she got older the had a step for the toilet for her - all without being requested! The kids also loved the tobleone placed on the bed every evening for the turn down service and the little cards with the weather report for the next day. The hotel is in a great location - on the Ku'damm with lots of shops and restaurants near by and a short walk to Zoo station which is a great starting point for any journey around Berlin. Breakfast wasn't included in our stay but we were near by to lots of places to have breakfast so that didn't matter to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in a highly desirable area”
Reviews.Author: Blondii
Reviews.Content: Great hotel excellently located on the K'Damm. The hotel is very modern, well kept, and very clean. The lobby is spacious and opens into a nice lounge/bar area. The staff was helpful and friendly, especially while checking in. We booked a classic K'Damm view room, which I would recommend. We had a wall of windows affording us a fantastic view. Even though we were on the 7th floor, we could occasionally hear some loud groups of people on the street at night, not a big problem though. The room itself was average in size, very clean, but not lavishly appointed. Our carpet looked new. The bed linens were nice, but the bed was rock hard. The bathroom had a separate shower which we liked. Granite on the floors and countertop added a nice touch. We appreciated the free internet access on the 2 business computers behind the concierge desk. The valet whisked our car away into the underground car park, another nice feature. We never ate the breakfast buffet. The fitness room was small with only a handful of machines. We got a real bargain only paying 122 euro a night with one of the hotel's promotional packages and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-Martin
Reviews.Content: We just sent both sets of parents to Berlin for a short break, and after much pondering of the hotel options decided upon the Swissotel because of the reviews on here. We were delighted when the "outlaws" announced that the hotel was by far the best they had ever stayed in. Highlights: Quiet - no noise from other rooms or the corridor managed to penetrate the rooms - indeed my mother-in-law couldn't knock hard enough on my parents' room for them to know she was there. Beautifully clean and spotless and well-equipped - my father-in-law wanted to bring the bathroom home with him Great service - even though it is a large hotel, all of the staff ALWAYS knew their names instantly. Perfect location close to the tube and the Kurfurstendamm. Definitely the hotel we will use when we do the Berlin trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brill”
Reviews.Author: RheannaxxLadygaga
Reviews.Content: I went and it was AMAZING!!!!! O my gosh i could not believe it!!!Because my dad bokked it on this well i thought dodgey bokking site that it didnt even exist. but i was just walking and my dad sed there it is, and i looked round and there was this big thing that looked so contemporary and modern i couldnt believe it!! i definetly would reccomend it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: luca77London
Reviews.Content: we stayed after san valentine last year (with friends and family rate) and i have nice memories of the weekend and the swissotel as well. great service combines great hotel. ok room service, pantagruelic breakfast, nice plus the espresso machine in the room ;-) i would defetely stay again

Reviews.Title: “A big hotel with a "at home" feel”
Reviews.Author: 1Amo
Reviews.Content: We don't usually stay in big hotels, but we walked into the Swissotel. Right away the staff and Manager were friendly and showed us several rooms (all of which were great). We stayed and were so pleased, that we extended our stay 3 days. Again, I would say that not only are the rooms great, but for me, it is the friendly and helpful staff which made the "big" hotel feel warm and cozy -- can you believe it?!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: madbiker1966
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff from check in through to check out. Stayed 2 nights in a standard room on the 8th floor, room facilities were better than most hotels with a personnel coffee machine, Lavazza pod type, mini bar etc. Bathroom had a real full size bath and separate shower cubicle with good hotel toiletries and space. Unusual layout at arrival with a small lobby for the concierge and then a lift up to the main entrance and quite a small hotel bar in the main reception area. Overall good value, I paid €140 a night which for a capital city 4* hotel not to far from the airport (Tegel - €15) I fell is good value, local restaurants were plenty to choose and a short walk to a large selection of shops and open spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Well turned out hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mimsicle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculate and in a great location. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the cocktails are fab and the rooms very comfortable. The only minus was that although a good few floors up the road was very NOISY.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: steve075
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this wonderful hotel with my girlfriend and it has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It's located in a prime position in the heart of the Kurfurstendamm area of Berlin which has plenty of upmarket designer shopping. We flew to Tegel airport and found the easiest way to reach the city centre was to take the express X9 bus from the airport to Zoologischer Garten station. From there it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The Zoologischer station is ideal to have nearby, as from there you can jump on the underground (U-Bahn), trains (S-Bahn) or buses. There is also an underground station (Kurfurstendamm) just across the road from the hotel. As well as this, the usual "hop on hop off" bus tours depart nearby, so it really is in an excellent part of Berlin from which to do your sight seeing. Once you enter the hotel, you must take the glass lift to the first floor where you will find the reception area, concierge and bar etc. The welcome we had was second to none. The very pleasant and well mannered staff made us feel at home immediately. In fact, throughout our stay, all of the hotel staff were just brilliant and we can't thank them enough for making our holiday a very special one. A nice idea once you enter the glass lift to take you to your room, is that instead of having to insert your card and then press your floor number, you simply swipe your card and the lift automatically goes to the floor you're located on. We booked a classic room with a view over the Kurfurstendamm and ended up on the eighth floor which was perfect. The room was exceptionally clean and spacious with floor to ceiling windows and having a Lavazza coffee machine was a wonderful touch. The bathroom was also spacious with a lovely powerful walk in shower. The bed was extremely comfortable and it was a pleasure to come back and relax in such a room after a hard day's sight seeing! We had to phone down to reception twice during our stay, due to water being needed for the Lavazza coffee machine and for extra milk, and within 3 minutes there was a member of staff knocking the door ready to sort the problem......all with a smile! Berlin is a fabulous city with plenty to see and do and the Vapiano Pizza/Pasta restauraunt across the road comes highly recommended. If you want to stay in a cracker of a hotel which, in my opinion is also very reasonably priced, i would without doubt recommend the Swissotel Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLBNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, everything about it was super. Rooms clean spacious and modern. The level of service, from the receptionist, restaurant staff to concieriege was first class. The location on the Ku'dam was close to shops as well as restaurants and coffee shops. A birthday cake was left in our room for my husband along with a card - a nice touch. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Islayanna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end Jan/beginning Feb and enjoyed all aspects of what the hotel had to offer (though chose not to pay 21euros for breakfast). We booked a classic room with a view of the Ku'damm - looking right over to Cafe Kranzler (try the 7 euro or so buffet breakfast there). We found the bed very comfortable and had no problem sleeping - the duvet and pillows are down and feel warm and luxurious. Room and bathroom good with everyting you would need - coffee machine very welcome too. The location of the hotel is excellent - less than 5 mins from Zoo station, underground and bus stops - the 100 bus runs between here and Alexanderplatz and travels along a route which takes you near to pretty much all the places to visit. An all day ticket for buses/trains/underground costs only 6.10 euros. We travelled from Schonefeld airport directly to the Zoological Garten station on the S9 train - very straightforward for getting to the hotel - no fuss and not much over 2 euros each for the journey. The area round about Savingy Platz is great for eating - 12 Apostles was good for pizza and Mr Hai and Friends a great Thai/Vietnamese restaurant - lots of others too. Plenty to see and do in Berlin and films at the Sony Centre in English if you fancy a break from the cold! Would definitely recommend Swissotel as a great base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Lara33
Reviews.Content: We went to the Swissotel for three days during the Christmas holidays to enjoy the cultural life of Berlin. We loved everything about the Swissotel: the location is excellent (practically on the Kurfuerstendamm), the room was quiet, good sized, and perfectly clean, and the staff was friendly. The restaurant - which recently 'lost' their Michelin start because the chef left for a different hotel - will hopefully soon have their star back - both the food and the service were superb. We can recommend the Swissotel to anybody who would like to enjoy a hassle-free, quiet and relaxing time in the centre of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrague
Reviews.Content: We have been in swissotel berlin for one night. The location is very good, directly on Kudamm street, good shopping area. Hotel from outside is fantastic, very nice. To go to the reception you have take elevator to the first floor. Lobby area is modern art provided. Room is very large but not so much comfortable, bathroom is too small for 5* hotel, with swissotel amenities. Bed was very small ( queen ) with regard to size of the room. Breakfast was OK, but nothing special. The stuff in whole hotel is lovely, very helpful and pleasant. I recommend this hotel to the people which are looking for good location, good quality but I think you can find better 5* hotel in Berlin near Kudamm street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: noelmurray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Swissotel in early December. I found the room very clean and comfortable, however I probably expected the room to be a bit bigger. The bathroom was modern and very nice. The coffee machine in the room was a nice touch but I do prefer tea and there was no kettle or tea making facilities. I didn't eat in the restaurant but it looked very nice. The bar is small and is fine for a quiet drink. The hotel is situated beside lots of shops and department stores, many of these shops can be found in Ireland and the UK. The KeDeWe department store is Berlin's version of Macy's or Harrods and is definetly worth a visit especially the Food Hall on the 7th floor. There was a a very good Christmas market a few minutes walk from the hotel. It is good fun and you pick up some really unusual items. If you are looking for a bargain it is probably not the place to go as items can be pricey. Even though there is many shops in the area, there is not many restaurants and bars. There is a selection of fast food outlets but not so many restaurants. We found it better to eat in other parts of the city while sightseeing as the selection was better. There is a decent Irish Bar in the Europa Centre about 5 minutes walk from hotel. They have live music and the atmostphere is good but if you are looking for more traditional German bars you are better off to go to other parts of the city. For sightseeing I would recommend Charlottenberg Palace and I found the museum below the Holocaust memorial (near Brandenberg Gate) very moving.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: OK, this is very rare for me to speak so highly about any particular hotel but our recent stay on 26th December for 2 nights was one of the best hotel experiences I have had. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly, helpful, professional courtesy. Our check-in was smooth and the front desk manager even walked us to the lift and explained the use. The conceirge was very helpful and room large, spacious, modern and very clean. We had a good view, but do request an external view otherwise you will be looking down at the internal courtyard. The breakfast was the BEST we have had in Europe, the most immaculate of presentation and choice from the buffet was superb. It was also the most professional breakfast servants I have seen in the world. The service at this hotel far exceeded my expectations and if we should return to Berlin will have no problems in making this hotel our home away from home. PERFECT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “German Efficiency”
Reviews.Author: ManilaPeasant
Reviews.Content: Squeaky clean room with hi-tech coffeemaker, a cleverly hidden ironing board- all speak of German meticulousness and efficiency. I had a good view of the Ku'damm. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: We liked the Swissotel and felt it was good value for money. The rooms were comfortable and well equipped, the food was excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. Its obviously fairly new and is modern in styling. The glass lifts were quite cool although if you don't like heights they may not be so good! The location is excellent for shopping but it is quite a way from the main historical sights which are mostly the other side of Tiergarten. Having said that the hotel is near very good public transport links - we used both the buses and trains all weekend so this wasn't too much of a problem, just not what I expected. We'd definitely stay again if we went back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: suecumbria2
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in Dec 08 to celebrate a birthday. Rooms spacious and exceptionally clean. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Location very central,close to some excellent shopping as well as tourist attractions. Would definitely recommend to friends and family without hesitation. Will now look for other hotels in this hotel group when considering my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: iaru
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in early December. Trip was business and pleasure so took my wife & baby along. The hotel more than lived up to its recommendations, from check-in where the staff just couldn't be more helpful to the room, that was perfectly laid out with plenty of room for all of us including the baby pram and extremely comfortable. Baby package that the htel provided was really great (along with the crib came teddy bear, baby bath, nappies, baby towel, bath glove, bottle warmer, baby wipes, baby soap & shampoo, even down to the rubber ducky for the bath!!! Staff were always on hand with recommendations of places to see, shop, eat. We had an incredibly enjoyable first visit to Berlin, with this hotel being a great part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: oldalfer
Reviews.Content: Booked the Swissotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and it really stood up to the expectations. The hotel's Location is Great. its located just on top of the the Underground station Ku-dam U-Bahn station , and 3 min's walk from the Zoo-station central rail station. it sits on the Ku-damn avenue, which is the shopping street of berlin. tons of fashion shops and other malls, restauraunts, bars and much more , all in your neighbourhood. The hotel itself and the room , is all very elegant , and very clean. in our room we had a nice large bed , both bath and shower (extremely clean and convenient) we had a Lavazza coffee machine in the room which we enjoyed and used daily. theres a digital safe , hair dryer , iron and ironing board , minibar fridge. , 3 phones so you can answer even if you're in bed or in the bathroom. there's also a workign desk with a comfortable chair , and another armchair with a coffee table by the window. the staff are freindly and helpfull. all was really well. its definetely more a buisness hotel than a vacation one as you wont find a swimming pool , or spa , etc... but for a good place to sleep and relax in your room its great. I disliked the fact that although its a 5 start hotel which means prices are not cheap, (we paid $185 night without breakfast) Internet connection (wireless or wired) is an extra charge at around $16/day (they do provide free computer use with internet access at the lobby , but if you want to use your own laptop you have to pay) other than news channels, the TV only had german language channels, no BBC , SKY , STAR , or other english channels to enjoy, which could have been nice. breakfast , at $25 per person was ok... nothing special , and I cant say it worth the price, as breakfast outside would have cost a fraction of that and you could have actually have 2 full meals in a standard restauraunts for the same price. for safety reasons , the room hasnt got windows that you can fully open, and we could have used more air , and less hot environment. the room was cleaned well and linnen changed daily. complimentry fruit and cold water at the front desk. overall we enjoyed and recommen this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can understand why this is a high rated hotel on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Willem_ter_Haar
Reviews.Content: My wife never saw Berlin, so as soon as an appropriate weekend arrived where we both free to escape, we drove to Berlin. 2 nights were booked at the Swissotel and we thought our stay was very comfortable. We checked late in the evening but that was no problem. What is quite original is the reception which is located on the first floor, not in the lobby. Glass elevators take you up to reception and higher up to your room. It appeared to be a very safe hotel, that is always a comforting thought. Concerning the room, the bed was good, the view on Kurfurstendamm was excellent. And I really did like the bath in the bathroom. I looked around for signs whether this room needed renovation, but could not find anything wrong. This bathroom was spotless. I really had no complaints about the room, I can recommend this hotel. Staff were helpful and friendly, allthough in hotels like this they also seem a little cold at times. It is always a difficult mix of living up to the class of the hotel and being yourself as a receptionist. As a businessman I would have appreciated this businesslike behaviour, on a honeymoon I would have liked a receptionist a little more human. I feel wrong to give this place 5 star rating(Excellent) since it is only something I would recommend to people if they visit Berlin and needed a place to stay, it will not enter my list of tophotels I had the pleasure to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: fickleWestMids
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although nothing special. Good value for money and very central which is a bonus. Let down by the fact it doesn't have a pool. You could do worse if you want a base for sight-seeing but you could do a lot better... Oh yeah, and if you're looking for the ironing board, it's hidden behind the mirror. What's that all about?

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed here on a long-weekend. The location was great - right beside the main shopping district and a subway station close by. The hard rock cafe is about 5 mins walk as is the most famous Irish bar in Germany! The lobby is different - on the 3rd floor via a glass elevator. The staff were so friendly and helpful - this is not something that I regularly comment on but here they were great. The rooms were a nice size, clean, quiet, and the bathroom was very nice. The bed was slightly hard but my wife thought it was fine. Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel for a stay in Berlin, it certainly represents good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: spec08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Berlin for one night with my girlfriend. Overall I was really impressed with the hotel. Superb location - right at Ku'damm shopping street, very close to Zoologischer Garten railway station. Impressive interiors and lobby, very friendly and helpful staff. The room itself is also nicely presented, with a modern, trendy design. One of the highlights is the Lavazza coffee machine, which produces very good coffee! One disadvantage of this coffee machine however is that you are stuck with the selection of coffee and tea provided and there is no option to produce just hot water if you want to use your own tea or coffee. Another minor point is that in a hotel of this class I would have expected to see a flat screen TV, rather than a bulky CRT. The bathroom is also immaculately presented, with a bath tub and also a separate walk-in shower cabin. The bed is very comfortable, but as it seems to be common in Germany, it is made up of two mattresses on a wooden base. This gives quite an annoying gap in the middle, and this is probably the main reason why I don't give this hotel the top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Martyn_Megan
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Berlin, stay here!! Helpful friendly staff, great location, great breakfast with lots of choice, free coffee machine and even a complimentary chocolate cake for my birthday. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and with the exception of the Bellagio in Vegas and the Ritz Carlton in Dubai I don't think I have stayed in any better. Some hopefully helpful tips for Berlin - - The hotel is about 45 min train journey from Schoenfeld Airport on the S Bahn line 9 to Zoogarten. You will need the ticket that covers zones ABC. - Get to know the S Bahn and U Bahn lines as Berlin sprawls so its good to save the shoe leather. Fortunately the hotel is next to a U Bahn line and only 8 min walk from a major U and S Bahn station (Zoogarten). - The Reichstag always has long queues so go early or as we did go late (last entrance is 10pm, we went at 9pm) and in the evening the views and the Copula looks fantastic - For other things to do we found the Holocaust museum very moving, The Brandenburg Gate looks great lit up at night, the Checkpoint Charlie Museum is really interesting and there is lots of shopping to be had if that is your thing. Potsdamer Platz is great and we found loads to do there and the Sony Centre is great and energetic at night especially at the weekend. The Zoo is huge and really well laid out and quite relaxing. Generally there is lots to do in Berlin and as a city it surprised me at how enjoyable and laid back it is. - If food is your thing there is so much to be had including restaurant 44 at the hotel. We were spoilt for choice for food in Berlin, so much variety. - Finally the Berlin Welcome Card is worth a look as it gives you free travel and discounts (normally 25%) at most of the major sites, tours and at some restaurants. We used it and it was worth the 24 euros for the 3 days per person. But most importantly - Swissotel, definately one to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, well situated.”
Reviews.Author: oldpapi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and can't recommend it highly enough. It is situated within a short walk of Zoo Bahnhof, near shopping and dining areas. The room was very spacious, comfortable and quiet. I found the duvet too heavy (being used to colder climates) and when I asked for a lighter one it was produced immediately. The service was friendly as well as efficient and a huge plus for the hotel is its Michelin Star restaurant, 44, where I had both lunch and dinner and is a place that should not be missed. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarneyGrimsby_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel, right in the middle of things. It has excellent tranport links with the Zoo station only a 10 minute stroll away. Check in was quick and all the staff were polite, always ready to offer a smile. The decor is cool and understated. Our room was a reasonable size. It was very clean and modern, and decorated well, apart from a strange painting on the wall (just not to our tastes). The lavazza expresso machine was a nice touch. Breakfast service was very effiencient and there was lots of choice. Overall a very good hotel and next time we are in Berlin, this will be the hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: adventures4me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a trip to Berlin. We had the good fortune of staying for 3 nights at the Swissotel Berlin. The staff and services at the hotel were exceptional; the room was very comfortable, food was high quality, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. While on business I often stay at Fairmont hotels and thought they were good, but the Swissotel surpassed them (and that is not any criticism of Fairmont, it is just that Swissotel was that good). The staff did not make us feel at all awkward for only being able to speak English and went out of their way to welcome us. The business centre provided us with internet access to keep in touch with family at home, and look up other travel arrangements. The concierge and front desk were helpful with directions, bus and subway information and shopping tips (there is excellent shopping just around the corner from the hotel). Thank you Sandy at Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Swiss”
Reviews.Author: Owskie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as incredibly good as the majority of reviewers have already stated and is why I decided to stay at the swisshotel. It has funky youthfull decor, a super comfy bed,great view of the Ku'dam, great food and great service and is the fantastic treat that I was after. 5 star luxury and the price is so much more reasonable than that. I stayed for the first 2 nights of a 7 night stay and it was by far the best 2 nights. I couldn't afford to stay there for the entire week but if I could I wouldn't have moved from this brilliant hotel. Even the excellent Marriott which I got at a bargain price from priceline did not come close to this gem! Previous comments about quality of service are spot on and unfortunately something did go wrong in that the door came off its hinges as room service served me my food! But they put me in the executive lounge whilst they fixed it which they did in10 mins and were so apologetic and let me stay in the lounge as long as I liked. Admittedly the fact the door managed to come off its hinges is concerning and very out of character with the feel of the place but the way they dealt with it was exemplary. Who knows what they may have offered if I had made a fuss but they were too nice and I was happy to accept it as a freak accident. I highly recommend this fabulous hotel and can't wait to go back to brilliant Berlin and stay at the super Swisshotel for as long as I can afford!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: gypsy71
Reviews.Content: Well I felt compelled to write a review about the Swissotel in Berlin. I've stayed at many hotels through out Europe, and this is by far one of the best hotels I've ever been to. Their attention to detail was superb. We called from the train to ask them to place a crib in our room upon arrival. Not only did they place a crib in our room, but they also gave us a bath tub, towel for the baby, soaps, bottles, diapers, bottle warmer, blankets, toys, and potty chair. We were floored to see a hotel make so much effort to accommodate to our family. In addition to that the staff were exception in attending to all of our needs. The service of this hotel shines above any I've been to. Would definitely stay at this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Modern Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle1986
Reviews.Content: We booked direct with Expedia for our hotel and flights. We arrived late on Friday and stayed through until Monday morning on the 10th floor, room 1035. This had a large bed, Coffee machine, separate shower and bath, TV and large chair. The bed was quite hard and had fluffy pillows and a lovely fluffy duvet. There were only 2 English channels on the TV, which is annoying, but usual for European cities. There is a speaker set up in the bathroom, so you can heat the TV from in there. The coffee machine is really useful and perked us up in the morning. We didn't pay extra for breakfast, as we ate over the road for 1/3 of the price! Our room looked into the courtyard and down onto the 2 arty cows. There are lots of pieces of art work all over the hotel, continuing the trendy atmosphere. You enter the hotel though the side street and there are a pair of lists up to the next level where the reception is on your right and the concierge on the left. There is also a bar, which was quite expensive behind your left hand side. The cafe for breakfast was in the main foyer with a glass roof, which is the floor to the courtyard. From here you can enter the board room, fitness centre, toilets and restaurant 44. Overall an amazing hotel and a great mini break.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: christel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very welcoming and has everything the traveller could want including a mini bar with room for your own stuff and lovely Lavazza coffee machine. Comfy bed and turn down service brings fluffy robes and Swiss chocolate (of course) plus clean towels if you need them after pm sightseeing shower like we did. Well placed for shops on Ku-damm or getting a bus to anywhere in the city. Boat trips are well worth it to see all the reconstruction and that still to be done. Breakfast was lovely lots of fresh fruit and all the usual delights but I was glad it was part of the deal as I would have baulked at 21 € each. Their restaurant 44 is currently being refurbished but there is a great place across the street called Vapiano which does pasta, salad and pizza to order in elegant surroundings as a self service at great prices. I understands this is a franchise and hear it has recently opened in London to mixed responses. No room for the pannacotta sadly. Next time I will ask for a room which is not on the outside as despite good glazing and effective aircon; an idiot woke us at 4 am one morning shouting the odds in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! 5-star!”
Reviews.Author: travel-world-mom
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through a conference at $120 a night--amazing value. The hotel is great--nice location, great service, big nice room, spotlessly clean, nice bathroom, nice breakfast, very friendly service. In a word, anything you desire from a hotel, it has it. But there is one defect. No free wireless. There are two ancient computers behind Concierge's desk for free internet, but there were always people using it. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “luxury at the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: ziggyboston
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the luxurious Swissotel. The hotel is in a great location and very convienient for public transport. All of the staff at the hotel were always very friendly and keen to help wherever they could. The room was clean and nicely decked out and the coffee m/c was a quality touch. The breakfast (included in the rate) was excellent. The zoo which is one of the best stocked in the world is within walking distance of the hotel and there are many shops close by. The open-top sightseeing tour buses depart from the corner of Ku'damm where you can hop on and hop off at various sights around Berlin, this gives you a really good introduction to the city and very reasonably priced too. You can also if you choose visit most of the main sights using the guided boat tours, although the nearest pick up point is some 15 minutes walk from the hotel. There is a very good pasta and pizza restaurant opposite the hotel called Vapiano which is also very good value. Altogether, we felt this hotel was very good value for money and ideally located for most of the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Swisotel”
Reviews.Author: bailestil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days at the end of June for a second time a really wonderful hotel.The staff very friendly and ever so helpful.The Zoo Station about five minutes away and the transport system in Berlin is just fantastic. A great location on the Kudamn and the main sites like the Reichstag and the Berlin Wall are a short train or bus journey away. I hope to go back a third time and i just would not go anywhere else. A special thanks to all the front office staff especially Kai .Great soundproofing when I was there Germany won the semi final of the Euro Championship and there were crowds celebrating in the street outside but when I returned to the hotel I could not hear any noise from the partygoers outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Asterope
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in June. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced out on to Ausbergerstrasse. It was spacious and had a wall of windows, so it had plentiful natural light. As expected, Swissotel uses quality linens and toiletries. The mattress was comfortable, but a little firm. Breakfast (included with our room rate) was very good. You can order omelettes from your server, if you do not want the buffet-style scrambled eggs. As for location, it's a nice property right on one of the major intersections of the Ku'damm.
