It's a short walk to the Zoo station (for public transport). There are shops and restaurants adjacent to the hotel, but we tended to eat away from the Ku'damm. We especially enjoyed Mr. Hai and Friends at Savigny Platz (again a short walk from the hotel). Overall, we had a pleasant stay, the staff was great, and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delicious!”
Reviews.Author: Vraiebrune
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days (and 2 nights) in Berlin for our 10th wedding anniversary. Booked with Expedia a non refundable Grand Room for £109 (no breakfast - 21 euro, even if excellent, thought we would find a little local bakery soemwhere in town for cheaper). For this price, we had the best experience ever: Like all the previous reviews, fantastic design, extremely helpful staff (excellent english), very welcoming hotel. Room was superb. Kindly upgraded to a Grand Room with view (over the Ku Damm). And despite this very busy street, absolutely no noise when window closed. Huge room, all office commodity (even if no use for a 10th anniversary trip!), sofa, chair, fresh fruits, hi-fi and Vivaldi CD in it. We found the bed very comfortable (I have to mention this as some previous review said bed was not comfy). Toblerone chocolate on the top of dressing gown and fresh slippers every night. Bathroom had a bath and a shower. Sparkling clean. Every little gorgeous details: bath salts, body cream, massage sponge, fresh flowers. Walk in dressing room, umbrella, iron, shoe polisher etc. Lavazza espresso machine (but no other facility to have a simple cup of tea though...). Wake up call at 4.30 in the morning as requested. Hotel booked a taxi for the airport. Very professional staff at check out even at this time of the morning. This room made our trip to Berlin very relaxing after full days of visit (fantastic city) and shopping (great shop in Ku Damm, walking distance from hotel). Would come back and recommend...

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: mmurray17
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is right on the Ku'Dam as advertised. A great location in the centre of Berlin. It is within walking distance to one of the main railway stations (Bahnhof Zoologischer Garten) from here you can access many train lines and buses. We had a room on the 7th floor so it was quiet and had a great view of the Ku'Dam. Other rooms looking into the atrium of the hotel are cheaper. The room was fairly big and very clean, with a shower and separate bath. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel but it is quite expensive, especially as there are so may good places to eat on the door step (Italian - Vapiano, American - Hard Rock Cafe etc.) Free internet access is located behind the consierge desk in the lobby (2 PC's). There are 2 bar areas, both are really pleasant to sit in. Prices are reasonable for a hotel of this class. There is a nice pub across the road from the hotel where you can sit inside or out, this will undoubtedly become your local! Overall a great experience and I would recommend this hotel. The transport system in Berlin can be difficult at times but you do get better at it in time!! Places to visit: (a) Sachsenhausen concentration camp just outside Berlin, you will not be disappointed. (b) The Parliament Buiding, Reichstag. (c) The Brandenburger Tor & Pariser Platz. (d) The Sony Centre. (e) Kaiser-Wilhelm-Gedachtnis-Kirche. Be ready to walk alot, Berlin is pretty spread out!

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture and design, very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Rylo
Reviews.Content: Swissotel hotels may be quite different from one place to another. We once experienced the Amsterdam one and had a very bad opinion of the chain (waken up by "mystake" quite early in the morning to get us check out quickly). The Berlin experience was way much better and started with a tour of the premises with a reception clerk wich is quite unusual. We were there for new years' eve and had a very good room service diner on the 31st ! When we arrived, we also had lunch at the restaurant wich is affordable (more expensive for diner) and enjoyed a very fine cuisine. The room design conveys a feeling of modern luxury and peacefulness.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Class”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night for business because of a recomendation from an associate. It is very centrally located, besides - the public transportation is very easy in Berlin anyway (trains and u-bahns). Not at all pretentious on the outside, but well received by some smartly dressed bellhops who whisked my bag promptly up to my room while I checked in. Decor in the hotel is very modern and neatly in its place. The front desk people were super helpful and I guess were having a good day, because they acted quite enthusiasticly behind thier counter as they worked. My room was a single and cost 150 Euro. It would have been 130 if you dont want the breakfast. So the term 'breakfast included' is a little misleading - you pay extra for it. The room was also very modern, with lots of glass and low furnature, but had a warm vibe due to the earthy tones and very roomy feeling due to the low furnature. Bath room was great - adorned with granite and glass - maybe on the small side, but for a single guy it had more than enough room. My personal favourite addition was the personal Lavazza expresso machines in each room. What better of a way to start and end your day than with a frothy fresh Lavazza expresso! The breakfast was supirior to all I have had in Europe and the US. Second to non with the vast selections of the buffet, plus made to order omletts if you want. All of this topped off with thier signature service. No sooner had I sat down - I had a coffee in front of me and silverwear to start my meal. My stay was short, but one of the top experiences with a hotel while on the road. Thanks Swissotel!

Reviews.Title: “Modern German Chic, at a price”
Reviews.Author: doc_M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, for a conference. On the day I arrived, Germany was playing in the finals of the Euro2008 football competition - so the streets were full of noisy fans. The hotel arranged for me to have an inside-facing room, to avoid the noise: full marks for customer service! The whole place is very stylish and efficient; clean and well-maintained. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful (in English or German!). As a business hotel, it would be hard to beat: the location is also great for West Berlin, and there's a U-bahn station right outside if you want to travel around the city. The bedrooms was well-appointed, and comfortable, with a fairly firm bed. The espresso coffee machine was a nice touch. The gym facilities are a little basic - some cardio machines, but almost nothing for resistance. The sauna, however, was very fine (do remember to take a euro coin for the locker). Breakfast was pretty good, with a wide variety including big jugs of freshly-squeezed juice. The conference meals were in private dining places in the hotel, and were also superb. All this comes at a price:the conference rate was EUR 150, including breakfast. Some people said you can get a better price than that on the web: even so, it's certainly not cheap! The only other downside was that, with all the conference delegates wanting to be fed half an hour before the conference started, there was sometimes a queue for breakfast. That smacks of bad planning.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelxyz
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel in Berlin is not as luxurious as for example the one in Istanbul or Ankara which, having stayed at those, one might find slightly disappointing at arrival. It is modern and very much a business-Hotel. So, when wanting a plush place with a luxurious charme you should not stay here. However, the staff is so friendly and helpful that one feels really welcome and good about the place. Breakfast is extremely good and a plus is the underground parking. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms well equipped. If you prefer to stay in the old western part of town, this Hotel can be recommended for sure, especially when comparing the prices for Hotels in this category.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ixion
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times, it is an awesome hotel. I recommend getting a quiet courtyard facing room, the rooms facing the street can be noisy because it is on a major intersection in Berlin. The service is great. The rooms have a cappuccino machine! The hotel is central, but a bit far from the older east-Berlin tourist area, but it is very close to subway and train stations. I have also stayed at the Westin (old rooms) and the Grand Hyatt (great hotel) and Crown Plaza (average). Pro: - nice modern rooms - cappuccino machine in the room - fast internet access - quiet rooms (if facing courtyard) - near major train and subway stations - excellent breakfast Con: - you have to take two elevators to get to your room, one to get to the lobby and another to get to your room - noisy rooms (if facing the street) Tip: - visit the Tacheles, it is awesome, and don’t be afraid to enter this old building, it is very safe: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunsthaus_Tacheles

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: happyHongKong
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and have mixed feeling about this hotel. We have booked a "grand room" - which is one class higher than a superior room. We were given a big room but with only one window with half of the room really really really dark. Even with all the lights on, the room is not well lit. It is also a long walk from the elevator and imagine the frustration of having to walk down to the reception when our room keys did not work one evening. You could also notice signs that the hotel is aging - from the stained carpet in your room to the wear and tear of the carpets on the long and winding corridor. When we made the reservation, we specifically asked for a non-smoking room but was given a smoking one when we checked in so we have spend another 15 minutes just to have the room changed. The good thing about this hotel is its personnel. The receptionists and the concierge are all friendly, informative and professional and all speak fluent English. The hotel is also very close to the U-bahn which makes travelling within the city very easy. Personally, if we were to return to Berlin in the future, I would stay at other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheshirepen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights early May 2008 mid week. The hotel lives up to its rating as the number 2 in Berlin. We had a Ku'damm view room which was excellent except for the bed which we found quite uncomfortable. We ate in the hotel's 44 restaurant the first night and this was excellent if pricey - well it has a Michelin Star. The hotel staff could not do enough for you. Breakfast was excellent. The hotel location is good being just round the corner from the hop on hop off bus tours and within easy reach of most of the main Berlin sights. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay right in the heart of this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Berlin”
Reviews.Author: walkingredrose
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this modern hotel. The hotel is above C & A, so the three lifts are central to moving around the hotel, as there are no stairs at all. This is not a problem as the glass lifts are a feature of the hotel and are very fast and silent. The staff are excellent, helpful and pleasant and nothing appears to be too much trouble, . Breakfast, ours was included in the price, is very good, with a great selection to suit all nationalities. The staff are constantly 'topping up' the food ensuring nothing 'runs out'. (which is not always the case in some hotels.) The only real negative was the bar, which was very tiny and stark and also expensive, with two glasses of wine costing 20 euros! But there are lots of restaurants and bars close by, so it's more fun to get out and about and visit those. Berlin is great with loads to see and do, but 3 nights isn't really enough, 4 would have been ideal for us, to enable us to spend a little more time at the sights.

Reviews.Title: “A worthy TripAdvisor Winner”
Reviews.Author: Brude
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night package booked with Expedia. Flew to Tegel airport and took the X9 bus for just over 2 euro to the Zoologischer Station. 25 minute ride in and then only a few hundred metres walk to the hotel. Area is terrific, lots of restaurants and shops but with easy access to all parts of the city and beyond. Hotel was excellent, sparkling interior and really pleasant staff throughout. You do have to use 2 lifts to access your room from street level but this adds to the secure feeling. Room was spotless with the best bathroom I have ever had, gleaming tiles and porcelain with separate shower even though I had a normal room. Bed was really comfortable and the air conditioning kept the room at the temperature we like. The whole hotel seems brand new and that is how they appear keen to keep it. Did not eat in the hotel due to the usual Expedia 'Without Breakfast' arrangement (May discard them because of this) but there are many little pavement bar/restaurants who will provide you with a lovely breakfast and other meals for a very reasonable cost. Also appreciated the ease of access from this hotel due to its proximity to the Zoologischer Station. For around 16 euro I was able to travel all around the city and as far away as Potsdam for a 48 hours period on any train or bus, a brilliant deal. Intended to use my ticket for the return trip to Tegel but a bus strike put paid to that. Taxi from the Zoo to Airport was 15 euro, again, very reasonable. Berlin is a fantastic city and now one of my favourites. I shall return again soon and without doubt use the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: orangeIreland
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the East side of city, and moved to the Swissotel for four nights. We came to the western side,to do some shopping. and to see the sights. Overall I was disappointed with the hotel, nothing spectaular, The foyer I just did not like, you have to take the lift to checkin from the foyer, Nothing luxurious or grand about the hotel. Having said that, the location is Great for Shopping, the staff are very nice, and the rooms are Clean, Breakfast is Good. If its location your after, this hotel is right in the centre of western Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Also excellent for children”
Reviews.Author: xlguide_dk
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT HOTEL - EXCELLENT SERVICE - ALL 5 stars well deserved. Booked this hotel 3 nights for easter get-away through Expedia. Found a good rate, and decided what the hexx. Booked it 22.30 the day before our arrival. 5hr drive later next morning we (wife and 2 year old daughter) arrived at SWISSOTEL. Location can't be beat on the KU'DAM. We parked in the hotel parking lot. Fee approx. 15EUR pr. 24hrs.... Be aware that Swissotel is inside a new umweltzone, (more info: http://www.umwelt-plakette.de/englis_informations.php?SID=k6qc66c17h9ktt9vou4ejonru5) which means you should get a special sticker for your car in order to enter the center of Berlin. As we planned this trip the day before we weren't able to acquire it. But we didn't park in the street and was never checked...if you get caught without the sticker it is 40 EUR. But park in the garage and take the BUS no 100 or 200 which stops across the hotel on the other side of church ruin. It stops by most major sites (Reichstag, Brandenburger Tor, Friedrichstrasse) and only costs 1/10 of the tourist buses. When we got to the reception we were met by extremely friendly receptionists. No qeue and plenty of staff...we checked in and the staff apologized for not having a special KIDS suite available. But I never wrote it in the order so how could they know, but still they seemed genously sorry. I was sure the ordered room would be fine. They gave our daughter a coloring book with crayons and cassette with a story on it and said they would bring up a surprise for her. The surprise never came (think it was sweets for her) but she never missed it as she was busy coloring. Anyway the caring staff made us feel really welcome. Room was excellent. Modern furnishing, nice bedding... Bellhob brought up our luggage and showed us the lavazzomachine with complimentary espresso. DELICIOUS!!! Everything about this hotel was excellent. The only thing I can think of that could be better, is the access to the hotel from the garage. There is stairs and en elevator but finding was easy at arrival. Ended walking up the car ramp with the luggage. All in all, will come back and have recommended this hotel to everyone we talked to.

Reviews.Title: “Must Be One Of The Best In Berlin !”
Reviews.Author: Rosneath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night stay on a bed/ breakfast basis. We were given a very pleasant , quiet ( the rooms face in to an inner atrium ) room on the 10th floor , and the receptionist came to the room with us to show us all the features in the room ( eg lavazza coffee machine ) The hotel is very well positioned for the Ku'damm and central Berlin , and has good parking below. The staff are all well motivated and extremely obliging - we asked for an extra chair - it was there on our return ! The breakfast is excellent - a wide choice , and a super dining room . It was my wife's birthday when we were there. The hotel picked up on this fact by flowers that were delivered to her - the hotel then sent a beautiful cake with plates , napkins etc - a very nice gesture. We payed €519 for a good twin bed room with bath and shower for 4 nights b/b for 2 persons - a very fair price for a 5* hotel in a capital city. Altogether a great place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fi65
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Swissotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor & were not disappointed! The hotel is in a great location, on a small street just yards from the Ku'damm, only 5 minutes walk from the KaDeWe & its fantastic Wintergarten food court, close to the Tiergarten & the zoo. We walked in off the street & were offered a room with breakfast for 150euros, which beat any internet 'deal'. It was my husband's birthday, & so the reception staff then upgraded our room to a larger one with views over the Ku'damm, complete with a birthday card & chocolates! The room was fantastic - impeccably clean, quiet, complete with coffee machine. Staff were very polite, friendly & helpful without exception. We didn't eat in the restaurant at night, but had a late night drink in the bar, where there was a nice atmosphere. The choice at breakfast next morning was delicious & extensive. Overall, I was thoroughly impressed & wouldn't hesitate to return, and would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonFuzzyface
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights over Easter weekend and thought it was the most fantastic place. The customer service here is second to none and they couldn't have been more helpful in every way. Right by the metro and train station and in a good part of town. This hotel was really good value for money considering everything you got, free internet in the rooms and the two computers downstairs, an absolutely fantasic huge buffet breakfast and a great view from the room. We couldn't recommend this hotel enough and will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great modern and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in Berlin for 2 night in March 2008 and were really impressed by this hotel. Having never been to Berlin before it was really easy to find using public transport (near the Berlin Zoo train and underground station) and is in a great location for one of the main shopping areas. The hotel is very modern, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely and breakfast was amazing. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW = perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Francescini
Reviews.Content: This lives up to all the reviews and was a great stay, lovely hotel, excellent VFM. I suggest it gives a very good quiet night sleep, is modern, clean and all you could want for business class without busting the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar Service at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: sfdiva22
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is a clean, modern hotel located along the Ku'damm, the main street of the famous West Berlin shopping district and only two blocks from the old main train station (the Zoo Station-has both S-Bahn & U-Bahn connections). However, what sets this hotel apart from others is its phenomenal service. Prepare to be treated like a rock star, even if you are just an ordinary couple visiting for a long weekend. Even our dog got five star service! Upon entering our room, we found a deluxe doggy bed and stainless steel bowls awaiting our dogs arrival. On my birthday, I found a beautiful chocolate cake, fruit and birthday card signed by the staff in my room at lunchtime. Even though this is not a small hotel, the staff was always able to greet us by name. Rooms are immaculate and have everything you need including a Lavazza Espresso maker and A/C in the summertime. If you don't have a laptop with you, there is a computer with internet you can use in a room next to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here in September and can't say enough good things about my experience. The decor is clean and modern, the room was very nicely appointed appointed (the bedding was SO comfy and there was a Lavazza espresso maker in the room, which made café quality coffee) and the staff were attentive, polished and very helpful. And the location can't be beat. I got a really good deal via expedia, which made it all the better!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Matt-7
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the hotel as a tourist and couldn't fault really but it was not spectacular - just a nice clean hotel On the plus side they upgraded us to a junior suite so we had a good corner room view. The concierge and staff were also very friendly and helpful. The location is great. Easy access to most things although if you want the historical bits, you may want to stay as close to the Reichstag or Potsdamer Platz as possible. On the not so perfect side, the gym and sauna were very very small and I'm not quite sure of the point of having them, the cleaning staff did not put water in the coffee machine (that needs a key) so we had to call down in the morning and the curtains did not / can not close properly so it was very light in the morning. Only slight niggles but probably the reason I have only given it a 4 and not a 5. It also does not have the luxury feel of a 5* hotel. It's luxurious but has no wow factor for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewsboyBelfast
Reviews.Content: I visited Berlin for a long weekend in April and stayed at Swisshotel. I thought the hotel was good value and could not really fault it. The room was of a good size and had everything that i needed including an iron and board which you do not often get in hotel rooms, much to my annoyance. Breakfast was very good with a great selection and the bar in the hotel was good but quiet which suited me fine. The restaurant was very good and had an excellent wine list and was very busy. Although the hotel was almost full to capacity at the time I stayed it never seemed crowded and was very quiet and calm in the lobby areas. The staff were very good and professional. I found the location to be fine but if you are intending visiting East Berlin where alot of the tourist atttractions are a hotel in Mitte might be better but In saying that the underground system is great so getting around the city is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: GeoDevon
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel 3 times. It is in an excellent location and provides great value for money. Staff are excellent, the rooms are quiet and modern. The breakfast is fantastic. I thoroughly recommend this hotel for style, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: NoTentsHere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after Christmas. The location of the hotel was superb, being right around the corner from Ku'damm and close to plenty of shops and restaurants. The room was more than comfortable and a lot bigger than plenty of hotel rooms in Europe. A U-Bahn station is right nearby allowing easy access to the rest of the city, although we found it quite easy to walk to a lot of places. The only downside was there was quite a bit of noise at night with sirens from the Ku'damm, even though our room did not face onto it. As others have mentioned, there was smoking in the lobby but that should not be a problem anymore with the smoking ban taking effect 1 Jan. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stafbulp
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with friendly staff and very nice rooms, most with a view of the Kurfürstendamm. The location is great, especially if you are in Berlin to shop, since it is right inside the main shopping district. But it is also a good starting place for any excursions around the city, since it is just a few minutes walk from the Zoo S & U-bahn station. Beware of Swissotel's own online booking, though! My booking seemed to work at first, but I never got a confirmation number so I gave the hotel a call and it turned out that my booking never went through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo-7
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, perfect room, extraordinary breakfast. The location is not perfect, but has many U-Bahn and Metrobus stations nearby, and is located in the commercial area of former West Berlin, 500m away from KaDeWe. I recommend it sincerely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for KaDeWe!”
Reviews.Author: Ally1374
Reviews.Content: Did all the research on tripadvisor and as always was pointed in the right direction. Great location, about an hour from the airport on the train to the Zoogarten. Fare is only E2 per person. Did the Unsicht-bar in East Berlin, highly recommedned, very humbling, very strange. KaDeWe department store was fab as was the foodhall on the top floor. Much better than Harrods and onlu 5 minutes walk from hotel. Service was exceptional and the rooms and bathroom comfortable, but drinks were very pricey. We ate at the Vipiano pasta chain across the road. Excellent concept and good value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: partyqueen
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 2 night stay after visiting for the Christmas Markets. The check in was excellent, the rooms were excellent. close to U Bahn and train station and very easy to get around. Lots of shops and bars in immediate vicinty and very safe to walk around at night. could not fault hotel rate was excellent with breakfast direct from hotel website. Berlin was fantastic and loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: katokat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay. We had arrived early so our room wasn't ready, but they took our luggage and it allowed us to have a wander around the immediate area and get some fresh air after our flight. When we returned to the hotel, we were seen to straight away, taken to the lift by one of the staff and shown how to use it. It may seem a bit pointless, but we encountered more than a few people that didn't know how to use it. The staff were wonderful and for a hotel that is 'upmarket' the staff in no way made you feel intimidated. We had booked a Business Junior Suite through the hotel website and got a good deal including breakfast. The room although nicely furnished and spotless was just a tad on the dull side and could have done with an extra lamp especially next to the reading chair which at night was impossible to use as you couldn't see what you were reading! My real niggle though was that we had a non-smoking room, and throughout the stay we could still smell smoke which seemed to either come through the air conditioning ducts or just wafted along the corridor from the rooms where smoking was permitted. Breakfast on the other hand was amazing. If you couldn't find something to eat at this spread then you have a problem. We decided to treat ourselves to breakfast in bed one morning and on checkout we were pleasantly surprised to find that the only extra cost incurred was 10 Euros. The hotel itself is in a nice area, although some people have mentioned that the station area down the road is seedy. I suppose that the seediness comes from the few sex shops and erotic museum (lol) in that area, but if you're offended by this sort of thing then don't go down there at night. During the day is fine though as its full of Berlin folk and tourists coming and going from the station. Not many of the sights most tourists will want to see are at hand, but the transport system in Berlin is fantastic. Take a few steps outside the hotel and there is a U-Bahn station that will take you to one that has crossover lines taking you all over the city. Or walk for a few minutes and find yourself at a train station with both S-Bahn and U-bahn lines that will take you to all the major sights around the city. One of the best things about Berlin is that most of the major attractions are within reasonable walking distance from one another.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TheGuandos
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great three night stay in Berlin and loved the Swissotel. There is not much more I can add, given the other great reviews, but I can say that as vegetarians our food options are sometimes limited, but we were amazed by the hotel's breakfast buffet and that they even had soya milk. Location was perfect, but we did opt for a Ku'damm view room and it got a little noisy late on Friday night, but this was not really a surprise and the view of the Christmas lights was worth it. Staff were always friendly and we would have no hesitation returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ll76
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends to the Swissotel Berlin and it was just great. We booked through relaxabroad.com and paid just £39 each per night which we thought was a bargain. Anyway hotel is in a great location not far from Tegel Airport. Hotel staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Beds are very comfy and rooms spacious and clean. We will def being going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Health Club”
Reviews.Author: michaelmelton1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the World Cup, and the hotel is beautiful. The room was very nice, the staff wasn't that friendly, but the health club facilities were great. The steam room was amazing. Its right in the city centre, but about a block away from the madness that was World Cup.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ali83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August for a week-long city break with one of my friends. I booked directly with the hotel & got an excellent deal. I had to e-mail them, because my web browser fought with their website & got very quick, clear and courteous responses. We flew in to Tegel Airport and took the express bus to the Zoologischer Garten - the hotel is a straightforward & quick walk from there. Our room was a good size with plenty of storage space & it was a proper twin room as requested. The air conditioning was probably the quietest I have ever come across. Breakfast was excellent, especially the freshly cooked pancakes and waffles & the staff were cheerful & helpful. The bar staff were also very good. We did not try the restaurant, but did have food in the bar which was very good quality. Most of the restaurants close to the hotel are Italian or Asian fusion, so towards the end of the week we asked the concierge to suggest somewhere more traditionally German and he recommended the Literaturhaus - excellent food and good ambiance, but make sure you take cash with you, since they do not accept credit cards. All in all the Swissotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing in Berlin with easy access to many of the U-Bahn & S-Bahn lines.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss hospitality”
Reviews.Author: clannscotia
Reviews.Content: Location good - close to attractions, bus and train routes. Hotel staff friendly, helpful and polite. Room (junior suite) spacious, clean, well-maintained. Shower good and bed comfy. Breafast room service good (chose the bread/coffee option) - however, make sure you order your eggs more than 3 minutes - our 3 min egg arrived practically uncooked and inedible. Hotel restaurant disapointing - menu was unappealing - duck tongue, pork breast and jello, etc. No steak - in a five star hotel! Come on! Wouldn't recommend Berlin in November - cold, wet, windy, hail, snow, sleet, slush. Glad to be home to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet (But . . .)!”
Reviews.Author: Duberto
Reviews.Content: First things first: let there be no doubt about it, this is a fantastic hotel - great staff (very friendly and helpful), wonderful trappings (super beds!), and super location . . . in other words, everything that you'd expect from a Swissotel! There are, though, a small number of things that could do with an improvement: (1) the fitness room is not up to snuff for a hotel of this size and class - it only has one treadmill, one "stepper", two recumbent bikes, and a very small resistance station; (2) they could do with nicer televisions - with every other touch that they've incorporated stylewise in this hotel, this bulky sets don't fit . . . and more than two English-language stations (we simply had BBC World and CNN International), please!; (3) it's nice (although, really, to be expected) to have free internet, but more than two stations would be nice. All of those things aside, this really is a super place - the neighbourhood (off Ku'damm) is full of shops and restaurants, close to all sorts of public transportation (U-bahn, S-bahn, buses, etc.), and lively - and both the staff and facilities, undeniably, are world class!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice.”
Reviews.Author: Bangkokexpat
Reviews.Content: I selected Swissotel from among its many competitors, based on the favorable reviews it received on Trip Advisor. It was a good choice. I was especially impressed with (1) the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, especially the conceriege, who spend a lot of time answering my questions about Berlin and providing me with detailed directions; (2) the great location, which is within easy walking distance of all the major transportation links; (3) the free Internet access in the business center; and (4) the quality breakfast, with free IHT newspapers, and the great staff that cleared away dirty plates quickly and served me with abundant hot tea. The rooms, while not lavish and somewhat sparsely furnished, were extremely functional, and I ended up liking my room, which had all the amenities one would expect, during the week I stayed at the Swissotel. Given the high prices of hotels in Berlin, the Swissotel is reasonably priced. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: UCSD
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Berlin (after returning from Vienna) at the Swissotel . We selected this hotel for its location adjacent to Ku'dam and proximity to Tegel airport, as we had an early morning flight home. The level of service was excellent and the room had all the amenities one would expect. One nice feature was a coffee/tea machine in the room, which uses cartridges to brew the desired beverage. My wife loved it and the hotel was kind enough to provide additional coffee cartridges to us (each one makes a small cup only). We arrvied at the hotel before noon and were pleased to learn that the room was ready for us. This allowed us to leave our luggage in the room as we explored Ku'dam, Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church, KaDeWe, etc. The only nit was with the rowdy crowds on Ku'dam late into the night. We were there on a Staurday and Ku'dam attracts people who are partying, shouting, etc. until 2-3 am. My wife likes to sleep with a window open, so the noise filtered into our room. Shutting the window helps, but this is an issue if you like freah air and are there on a weekend. We managed to enjoy some of the breakfast buffett before our departure and would recommend it -the ample choices of food was excellent. We would suggest this hotel if you want to stay in the western portion of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glamourpuss-Tourer
Reviews.Content: We booked our two night stay at the Swissotel following reccomendations from Tripadvisor - and we were not dissapointed!. This has to be one of the best hotels i've ever frequented, with wall to wall glamour and superbly efficient staff, who all spoke perfect English. Brilliant Stay, Great Location, Fabulous City - book now!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful introduction to Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Wandzia22
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is as sophisticated as the city itself. In every way, it surpassed our expectations. The location is just around the corner from the chic Ku'damm shopping area and within walking distance or a short bus ride to all the most interesting museums, galleries, etc. The rooms are understated, well appointed and very comfortable. During our stay, the staff were unfailingly helpful and gracious - particularly the concierge. We would recommend it highly and look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss delight”
Reviews.Author: Promar
Reviews.Content: 6 of us (3 couples) spent 5 nights here at the beginning of October. Hotel reception staff were very helpful indeed this applied to all the staff we came into contact with . Our rooms on the 4th floor were very comfortable, with good bathrooms (separate bath and shower.) We were impressed that irons and ironing boards were included in the rooms. The rooms faced the centre so were exceptionally quiet. Our tariff did not include breakfast but we did try it once (21 Euros) It was excellent (as one would expect from the price!). We discovered that one could get "a coffee and croissant" served in the the reception lobby for 7.50 Euros. This was more than adequate for our needs and included fresh orange juice and a selection of yoghurts. The location of the hotel, just off the Kurfurstendamn St, was just about perfect, with a U bahn station almost directly opposite and the Zoologisher Garten S bahn/U bahn station within 5 minutes walk .away The free internet access point (just behind the conciege's desk) proved very useful for booking our return flight seats and printing out our boarding passes. We did not try the the hotel's restaurant because there were so many local restaurants in the area. All in all a very good hotel and one we would not hesitate to recommend. JP Banchory Scotland

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: Sim2406
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 day break in Berlin, staying at the 5* Swissotel. I really was impressed. Very easy to reach (5 minute walk from the train station - train direct from airport, and as expected in Germany train on time). Staff were extremely friendly and helpful during booking process and throughout our stay. The price was truly impressive - 513 euros for 4 nights, an absolute bargain. The room was large, with a 6 foot bed (luxury), italian coffee maker and lovely fluffy robes. Only complaint would have to be the lack of english language tv channels available. Both mini bar and room service prices were extremely reasonable. Located on the K'dam, beside the zoo, just around the corner from Ka-de-we and a stone throw from Tiergarten, an excellent location to explore all Berlin has to offer. Would thoroughly reccomend this hotel, particularly if you manage to get a bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: imabari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Swissotel berlin for 4 nights in September. The location of the hotel was great. Only about a 3 minute walk to Zoo station and the U-Bahn station was on Kurfürstendamm right below the hotel. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and gave us maps of Berlin and a tour of the hotel. Our room was on a high floor and had a nice view and was spacious enough and very modern. We both loved the coffee machine and the Toblerone which was left in our room in each evening. Everything was immaculate and the hotel itself had a good buzz with plenty of people in the bar and cafe on Friday and Saturday nights. There was free internet near the Conceirge and the gym/sauna area looked very nice with decent equipment and free drinks. We found a great Vietnamese restaurant called Mr Hai on SavignyPlatz about a 10 minute walk away. It was so good we went there twice and would highly recommend it. We also went to Vapiano across the street which had a great atmosphere. Overall it was a good stay and I would definitely return to the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lilJoJo
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews all spot on; a v.high standard hotel, spacious rooms with attention to detail (toiletries, mini bar, espresso machine etc), great location, v. easy to find, pleasant staff. Every hotel does have its faults though; our espresso machine didn't work, and we had an adjoining room to another couple (the door of which was initially unlocked), and breakfast isn't included. Being used to typical european hotels, this was a great surprise, which, although not the best value for money, is worth it if you want to splash out, but if you are a traveller on a budjet, there are other equally nice hotels for much less. Would recommend for businessmen/women, couples, honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Hotel is immaculately clean and the lobby is impressive. Room service food was great and standard price for such a hotel. Wifi is Euro 12.50 for 24 hours. Rooms are a good size. Espresso machine in room is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpat17
Reviews.Content: Booked based on this site's reviews - excellent service from the concierge and the front desk. Very good location near shopping and metro. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. A little dated and worn - but not bad by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: arlu
Reviews.Content: Having read all of the reviews, I assumed this to be one of the best hotels in Berlin. I was staying at the Hyatt and had to move due to a mixed up reservation by my corporate travel agent. I have to say it was a downgrade. Decent location, but the rooms are tiny and actually felt a bit seedy. The lobby is interesting but thats about it as far as I could tell. The bar is small but has a decent vibe, the breakfast wasn't great and was in a conference room so didn't feel luxurious in any way. At least I had a quick check-out as I almost missed my flight. Even the porter at the front wasn't particularily attentive or helpful. Perhaps an anomolous experience, but having stayed in numerous 5* hotels both old and new, this doesn't rate highly at all.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: pokemon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from the 5th to 8th September 2007 for a mini break and we had a lovely time. It was our first visit to Berlin and we found the location of the hotel to be idealy located and very convenient to everything. We took a city bus tour and a boat tour which was recommended by the hotel which was very good and inexpensive lasting approx. 4 hours. Public transport is very good either by train or bus. We did not have our children with us but there is lots of activities for children. Berlin Zoo is just of the main street and also the aquarium. The hotel itself is very clean and very well managed with lots of helpful staff. Reading all the comments on the hotel I would not consider it luxurious and I don't think I would consider it 5 star. I had booked the room over the internet and we just got a basic room - when checking in we were asked if we would like to upgrade at a charge of €50 per night. (we didn't). Having said all this if I were to go back to Berlin I would probably stay there again. Restaurant 44 is a lovely restaurant but my husband was surprised that an award winning restaurant would have weeds growing on the balcony and the out door furniture was very unkept looking. Staff in the restaurant were very good and helpful. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grat Location, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: goldmbr
Reviews.Content: I love Germany around Christmas. Helpful hotel staff, contemporary looks, wonderful location. Room was very clean, bathroom just fine. All in all, reasonable place to stay while in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel in fab location in great city”
Reviews.Author: northerntravela
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel apart from slightly pricey bar(but excellent service and v cool!) got good rate through expedia 3w in advance. easy to get around-walking .u/s bahns etc v nearby. we found good restaurants easily-well priced too-makes London look very second rate! toilets always immaculate! great service nearly everywhere and lovely atmosphere-they have rebuilt the city so well and are open about their past. would go back and stay in same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the farewell could have been fonder.”
Reviews.Author: smoofy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to splurge on a really swanky hotel for a couple nights as we were on a combination romantic getaway / Berlin extravaganza for about a week. When we finally found the entrance to the Swissotel (which is located above the C & A department store on a side street) we were pretty damn pleased with the service. We arrived 4 hours early but were given our room anyway, our baggage was taken up to our room for us, and we were even escorted to the elevators by the gentleman at the desk. Not to mention we received free drink vouchers for a drink they make at the bar out of a variety of juices and special grouse. When we got into the room we were still impressed- HUGE bathtub (you can easily slip two people in there) and really comfortable bed. I was in love after having stayed at the Lindner for a few nights (which is no comparison, seriously). We enjoyed our stay there very much, our only problem came when it was time to check out. We were hastily offered our bags back to us even though check out at our next hotel wasn't for several hours. After some discussion, they agreed to hold on to our bags for us. We spent 1 hour trying to check out because they had to send someone up to our room to validate the minibar charges (which I believe were all of 4 Euro) and there was a HUGE problem with the laundry bill. My boyfriend who had decided to stay an extra four days needed to do laundry and so we were told by the front desk that it could be left out in front of the door and taken care of. We assumed there would be a charge for this, however we were never at any point told that it would be 49 Euro to wash 4 cotton t-shirts and a couple pairs of jeans. We argued with the front desk that we were never informed of the costs associated and that their policy was lunacy. Eventually we realized there was no reasoning with them and paid the bill. We later collected our bags, had them call us a taxi, and the doorman explained to the taxi where we were going after we showed him on paper the address of our next hotel. Turns out the doorman told the taxi driver the wrong thing and we ended up going to a different hotel. After trying to explain this to the driver he insisted that the hotel he had taken us to was what he was told by the doorman. After an arguement, we were finally taken to the correct hotel. So to sum up, here's my advice: Stay at the swissotel if you want a luxury experience- use their free drink vouchers- don't use the minibar- don't do laundry- and don't expect a welcome goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrotsarered
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all previous reviewers on tripadvisor - this hotel lived up to all those reviews. Clean, comfortable, great with unobtrusive efficient service. My friend and I really enjoyed our stay- Berlin is a great city. I recommend the Fat Tires bike tour - great guide with good knowledge of the history of the place. Also the Vapiano opposite hotel - good place to eat if you like Italian food. No worries about the area - it felt very safe. Always loads of people around and well lit. I would definitely recommend Berlin and this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modest luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bruno007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Swissotel based on the reviews at Tripadvisor but also based on the opinions of friends. This is simply a wonderful hotel. Location is very central and most of the attractions are either within walking distance or short metro ride. We stayed in the room 8004 and simply could not fault it. The room was spacious, well equipped and very quiet. Beware, however, the hotel may get busy as it is often used for various functions. When we stayed at the hotel it was hosting some sort of sport event and the hotel lobby was always packed. We booked directly through the website that guarantees the best rate! If you have 3 weeks make sure to use their advance booking rate. Our rate was EUR145 a night and included the most wonderful breakfast where you will be spoilt for choice. Next time we are in Berlin, our hotel is sorted!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nina_auth
Reviews.Content: Date: August 20, 2007 Reviewer: Couple from Greece We got a nice room for 4 days during July for a 100 Euros per night w/o breakfast. Excellent location at Kurfürstendamm and very proffesional staff at the reception desk. Very artistic enviroment with genuin paintings and sculptures at the reception, the lobby and the guest rooms !!! Tea-Coffe making facilities in room and bathrobes made the staying more comfortable. The room was bright and had everything a traveler might need. A welcome drink was offered in the hotel bar, while bottled water and fresh apples were available in the reception. Safe neighborhood with a lot of restaurants and cafes. Very close to public transportation (metro, bus 100/200)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cornishlaydee
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights in a standard room booked directly with hotel. Fantastic room with coffee machine and granite bathroom, great location near to the railway station and plenty of restaurants and shops, excellent breakfast with a huge selection and nice trendy bar to relax in. smart reception with doormen and security at the entrance too. An excellent choice. Make sure you see the Berlin Wall and Jewish musuem - very moving.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this one”
Reviews.Author: daoboston
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The hotel is modern and sleek with great service and a great location. We loved the Ku'damm area. Our rate included daily breakfast which was fabulous. The staff is friendly, pleasant, and eager to please. Our room was clean, comfortable with a great bathroom. The room was also fairly spacious for a European hotel room, which tend to be smaller than hotel rooms in the US. In sum, you can't beat this place for combining, luxury, location, service and value! We had an outstanding experience for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: BerlinDrew
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights there, after vacating my apartment in Berlin before beginning an extended tour of Europe. As with a previously reviewed hotel, I had passed it many times, but never really considered it. I got a rate of 95 EUR per night, very nice breakfast included. Parking in the garage beneath the hotel, with direct elevator, was, 18 EUR per day. Overall, at 95 EUR, a great stay. Very friendly staff, very clean rooms, and a great location if you want to explore the Western half of Berlin. I recall some reviews mentioning that the area might be a bit sketchy. No worries. The area immediately around the Zoo U/S-bahn station is perhaps a bit..well...big train station level, but the hotel is a block or two from there, and located on Ku'damm, one of the main shopping streets, so no worries. Espresso machine in the room is a plus, as is a comfortable reading chair. The street on one side of the hotel was being completely repaved as of Aug 2007, but didn't present any real noise issues. However, if you are driving, you may want to call for directions around the closed off streets. There is a food market in the basement of the department store around the corner, if you want to stock up on water, snacks, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Biebi
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is worth every cent. Suberb location, excellent service and extremely well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great but uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: dainabrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in July t2007 for four nights and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms but disappointed in the smallish queen bed. Aircon was intermittent between no air at all and then full blast. Asked for, and received, a blanket because the one doonah was far too heavy for that time of the year and lack of decent aircon. Staff were very pleasant and polite except for the bar where we had to, at one stage, wait 25 minutes for a glass of beer even though we were the only ones in the lounge at the time. Expensive, too. B'fast is fabulous. Starched white tablecloths and napkins, huge variety of quality food - and, yes, FRESHLY squeezed orange juice - not the tinned variety. Restaurant staff very very helpful and quick to remove dirty dishes. All in all would stay there again but would ask for either a room upgrade to a larger bed or twin, and would be more forthcoming re the aircon problem.

Reviews.Title: “Come see for youself...fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sgeddie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in a Jr. Suite, with a view of the city. The deal we got on Expedia was to good to pass up. Everyone in the hotel was wonderful and couldn't do enough for you. Room service was very good and fast. Great location with wonderful restaraunts close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Jampa40
Reviews.Content: Hopefully great surprises don't come alone, but always in pairs, so it was truth for Berlin and Swissotel. We stayed one week for business and leisure purposes and there couldn't be a better place to stay, just a few steps from major atractions and subway just around tne corner. The lobby area is gorgeous and hip, the staff was very atentive and the hotel is just 5 yrs. old. The rooms are spotless and the breakfast outstanding! The overall value is is very good indeed! I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ICRC1977
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, easy to get to from the airports! Room was spotless, restaurants great although bar a bit pricey! Well worth a visit if your going to Berlin, quite central to most attractions, just around the corner from the zoo which is handy if you've got kids!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamelClass
Reviews.Content: I usually like to try out new hotels when travelling but on my roughly 20 trips to Berlin, half of the time I've stayed at the Swissotel because I like it so much! There may be hotels with grander public areas, larger rooms and more restaurants, shops and bars but the Swissotel is just the place I feel the most comfortable. The hotel has already been described in detail so I'll just list the things that make this hotel so extraordinary: Perfect staff. From the receptionists to the maids to the staff in the dining room, everyone working there is extremely pleasant, professional and friendly without being sub-servant or chummy. I can't recall ever staying in a hotel where the staff was consistently on such an excellent level, congratulations to the management! Perfect location. While it's true that many of Berlin's attractions are located in Mitte, around Friedrichstrasse and Potsdamer Platz, I vastly prefer the much more real atmosphere of Charlottenburg and the Ku'Damm. Potsdamer Platz is a fun place to visit but it's quite contrived and wasn't formed naturally but by city planners. Explore the lovely side streets, e.g. Uhland- or Knesebeckstrasse of the Ku' damm where you'll find great little restaurants offering Thai, Japanese, Spanish, Italian, Indian and lots of other cuisines, small boutique-style shops like tailors and shoemakers, bars and cafes which cater to the locals and are much more interesting than the chain restaurants and international-brand stores found in Mitte. Perfect room. The standards rooms aren't particularly large but still very pleasant and clean and furnished with everything you could want. A firm matress on the bed, lots of pillows, a Lavazza espresso machine (!), effective and quiet air-conditioning, lots of drawer and closet space, robes and slippers, a small bathroom with great glass-enclosed shower and tub, fast WLAN (for a reasonable fee) etc. The only downside is that I feel so comfortable in the room that I have to force myself to get out and explore Berlin! Perfect breakfast. If you book wisely, you'll be able to get a room that includes breakfast for only 10 Euro more than without. I'm usually not much of a breakfast person and European 5-star hotels tend to charge a fortune for the pleasure. But if yours is included, you won't be disappointed, the breakfast at the Swissotel is fantastic and includes made-to order eggs or pancakes which you can order from your waitress. Much better than those bin full of eggs and bacon so often offered. Perfect restaurant: Many of Berlin's best gourmet restaurants are located in hotels, the Swissotel's Restaurant 44 was awarded a Michelin star and 8 points by Gault Millau and offers very creative and original fare. If you like that kind of food, have lunch during the week where an excellent fixed-menu meal is offered at an extremely reasonable price. My only small criticism stems from the breakfast room sharing it's space with the restaurant. A half an hour before the breakfast service ends, most of the staff gets busy preparing the room for lunch and then things like coffee-refills tend to get a bit difficult. The same thing happens in the evenings if you stay until closing, the staff start preparing the room for breakfast, a rather noisy task which isn't quite fitting for a Michelin-starred restaurant but probably can't be avoided and isn't a major upset.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lbj2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first leg of an Eastern European vacation with my husband and two teens. With two connecting rooms, we were more than comfortable and happy. Hotel is well kept and very modern in style. Buffet breakfast was the best of any location we stayed at. Service top notch. Location near Zoo train station was a plus for getting around to different spots in Berlin. We had an excellent overall visit and would return to this location or other Swissotel properties. I also felt safe and secure and liked the feature that did not allow anyone to enter the elevator without having a key and the elevator would automatically stop only on that floor. For an urban hotel, safety is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ma377
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days on business and I cannot overstate how impressed I was. The location is great, the price was amazing, the breakfast is one I still daydream about, the staff was absolutely one of the most impressive I've encountered at any hotel, anywhere. Finally, the rooms are so small you can't believe it - and it doesn't matter a bit. It was one of the most comfortable and well-appointed rooms I've stayed in despite the size-- and extremely well maintained. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Veronica W
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff were very helpful and friendly receptionist even took us to our room when we checked in and made sure we were happy with our room, which was great on eigth floor and very quiet no traffic noise considering we were overlooking main street. Breakfast excellent which we booked with room, good value for money a bit expensive at 22 euros if paid for on daily basis. Location was brilliant went on hop on hop off bus which stops across the road from hotel, then went back to visit places that interested us, remains of Berlin Wall very moving experience. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance of hotels, we did not have a poor meal whilst in Berlin, The concierge in the hotel was very helpful and pointed us in the right direction each day and booked a theatre for us and tickets were delivered to hotel , better than tourist office!!!! Flew Easyjet from Liverpool no delays excellent value, would recommend Berlin which is full of history and this hotel for 4/5 day break, woud definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: gonknoggin
Reviews.Content: Swissôtel Berlin – 28. June 2007 – one night I have stayed in several five star hotels in Berlin and the swissôtel definitely lives up to the expectations of a high class hotel. From the outside the venue looks rather unspectacular, the entire interior goes with the swissôtel standards: understatement, simplistic yet comfortable design. The entrance is very interesting; as you walk in the front door you enter a pretty small lobby with only one small front desk and two glass elevators right across the hall. I approached the staff only to find out that this is the concierge’s desk while the main lobby is upstairs. The elevator takes you right up providing a great few down the wood covered entrance lobby. I received a warm welcome from the front desk employee who checked me inn very promptly. I booked directly with the hotel just a few hours before I arrived, so he first couldn’t find my check inn sheet since it was not printed out yet. That issue was resolved within a few seconds time. He gave me a quick tour of the lobby, showing me the two bars as well as the restaurant. I booked an executive room in the ninth floor, granting access to the executive lounge (but more about that later). One elevator ride later I arrived at the ninth floor making my way to the assigned room 9030. The room itself was spotless, comfortable and nicely appointed (see photos) and featured a spacious working area, sofa chair, queen size bed, TV, mini bar, TV, individual climate controls, two phones and a ironing board (hidden behind a large mirror). I very much liked the individual espresso machine with free espresso pods from Lavazza, surely more hotels should offer that service. The bathroom was also very clean and featured all the necessary goods as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, bar soap, plenty of towels. Equipped with a bath tub, shower cabin, make up mirror, plenty of towels and toilet. As I arrived early in the afternoon I planned to use the time for some reading in the executive lounge while enjoying a cappuccino or such. As I tried to get in I found the door to be locked, walked back to my room and called the front desk to find out that the lounge wouldn’t open until 6pm. I was disappointed that the lounge is closed for the afternoon, especially since it was mentioned nowhere in the hotel information. I came back shortly after 6pm and was promptly greeted by a very friendly staff. The evening snacks very limited to a choice of soup, some dim sum, bread and smoked cold salmon. All kinds of cold and hot drinks are available. The lounge itself is about the size of a large hotel room, has about eight tables and room for approximately 15 guests. As I found out that night the lounge is only open from 6.30 – 11 am and again from 6 – 10pm, meaning that is closed all the reminder of the time. I had breakfast at the restaurant “44” as it features a wider selection of food than the executive lounge. The food was very good, I didn’t miss anything really, from miso soup, to eggs served your style, assorted breads, freshly squeezed juices, cheese, cereals, waffles, pancakes, tee and coffee. Only the pre-cut fruits, especially the watermelon and cantaloupe were not sweet, ripe and therefore not as tasty as the rest of the food. Also here staff was very friendly and supportive. The hotel also features a small gym and sauna, equipped with some treadmills, bikes and such as well as complimentary mineral water and apple juice. Nothing special, no pool, I’d expect a little more on this end in a five star hotel. The check out was quick and painless, again very friendly personnel helped me to find the best way to my next meeting point. Final thoughts: Overall I enjoyed my stay at the swissôtel and would definitely consider staying there again, but probably only if my first two choices are booked out or over priced. Also I would probably not pay the extra for executive lounge access due to its very limited opening hours (not in the afternoon) – this was really the biggest disappointment. Pros: + central location, main shopping street and restaurants just a short walk away + simple, clean and minimalistic yet still comfortable and pleasant interior design + friendly staff + spacious room with individual espresso machine + great value breakfast (if not included in the rate it’s 21 Euro) Cons: - Executive Lounge only open for four hours in the morning and four hours at night - not worth the extra money - very small fitness center - no swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: screenname060309
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first visit to Berlin. The hotel had many good qualities: the location was very good close to many attractions and means of communication. We did not eat breakfast here and did not enjoy sauna gym and other amneties (no time) so I cannot talk about those. Our rooms were OK, the best parts were the shower in addition to the bath, the ironing facilities and the coffee making machines. My girlfriend loves tea so when we asked for help they immediately sent us water bolier. We did not have slippers in our room which my girlfriend had counted on. I see from another review that they had slippers. The beds were very good. There were only two problems: One was the TV. It did not have any English channels except BBC and CNN, and by day three we were tired of listening to the news all the time. But they did have speakers in the bathroom so you did not have to miss the news even there. The airconditioning was perfect. Another problem were the lamps near beds. They have a special confugartion so that if you come into contact with the frame around the light you may burn your hands. One of the lights in the room did not work and our room was not very well lit. I am sure if we have said something about it they would have reacted. I might have given 4.5 points if it would have been possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: rymat
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Swiss Hotel in early June . Hotel was in excellent location, just steps from U subway line and 10 minutes from Main train station. Many shops and restaurants within walking distance of hotel. Streets were safe even at night. Hotel Room, moderate in size were very clean , and decorated in a modern with great beds. Breakfast buffet was great with many choices, and hot food Buffet was included in my price of 180 euros Staff was accomidating and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any one who is visiting Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel - a fantastic hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Travandclair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 4 nights at the Swissotel in Berlin. It is a remarkably good hotel for the money (we booked through Expedia and paid less than £85 a night per room, excluding breakfast) and is definitely worth each of its 5 stars. The service was excellent throughout. In particular Henry, who served us drinks in the bar near reception - upon hearing of our lengthy overnight train trip home, he went off and then came back with a specially wrapped bag of delicious Swissotel chocolate for us to eat on our journey. I would agree that the location is not the best in Berlin - the area near Zoologischer Garten station is a little seedy, but the Ku'damm -close by - is a fine, upmarket shopping street. I would be very tempted to stay nearer Mitte on a future stay, the area around Potsdamer Platz is particularly well-placed for the sights. Wherever you stay in Berlin though, you will at some point need to make use of the excellent public transport system - 6.20 Euros will get you a day ticket with unlimited use. Tips on food - the self-service Vapiano across the road serves excellent pizzas, pastas and salads for a very reasonable price. Zur Letzten Instanz, close the the TV tower, is reputedly the oldest restaurant in Berlin and serves hearty German food - eat in the garden if the weather's good. Berlin is a wonderful city - we could easily have filled 10 days there - the Swissotel will be near the top of our list to stay when we go back again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - couldn't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in excellent location. Room, though not overly large, was very clean, modern with very comfy beds. Breakfast excellent - huge choice, hot food hot etc. Staff really pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, only one disapointment....”
Reviews.Author: AB1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 31st May - 4th June. Good location and comfortable hotel. Only disapointment was with the Restaurant, 1 month before we stayed i booked a table for two for 1st June in Restaurant 44, a birthday treat, i received e-mail confirmation from the Restaurant Manager. On arrival at the hotel i again asked for confirmation of the reservation to be told i couldn't have a booking as there was a private function place that night and the restaurant was closed. The receptionist tried to get me a table for the Saturday night but the restaurant was full. Greatly disappointed about this as i had heard only good reviews. On the whole a comfortable, clean hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoothtalk
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, well-equipped hotel with superb staff and a nice, civilised atmosphere. Our room was the most modest the hotel offers, but was quiet and pleasantly appointed with a good bath/shower room and quality furnishings. The hotel bar was a good place to have a few drinks at the end of a long day, and Restaurant 44 (run by chef Tim Raue) was expensive yet worth the money, offering a superb menu of modern European cuisine. The sole drawback of the hotel is that it is in a fairly charmless corner of Charlottenburg - conveniently near Zoo Station, but also near some rather tawdry shops and bars including a tacky museum of erotica. The atmosphere locally certainly wasn't threatening, but this is a much less appealing part of Berlin than, say, Mitte, and those going as tourists should be aware that they will need to use the U-Bahn and S-Bahn to access the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and well run”
Reviews.Author: marcdocklands
Reviews.Content: OK it will not win prizes for personality but the rooms are a good size in a great location with comfortable beds - what more do you need? A few tips breakfast is very expensive but if your happy to pay 22 euro each its a good spread but I would advise you to try some of the nearby cafes "more Berlin" I upgraded to one of the suites it was only a small addition to the price but well worth it and dont be put off by courtyard view rooms they are fine .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IslandMaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Mar. 29-31, 2007. Perfect location for a visit. It is situated on the main shopping street . It is also near the trams & subways. The X9 bus(express) from the airport comes two blocks away. The rooms are very modern and extremely comfortable. It is wonderful having a coffee maker in your room. The service from check in to room cleaning was above even my expectations. I will be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It almost starts to get boring”
Reviews.Author: ynguy
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Interconti but after reading all these reviews, I could not help myself to try this hotel. When I entered the downstairs area I was not met by a porter to assist me with my luggage ( Hey not everything is perfect in this hotel. ) Once I had ascended to the reception lobby area I was greeted by a charming and friendly male receptionist who efficiently checked me in and escorted me to my room which was a nice touch. The room was smallish ( Interconti's rooms are more spacious ) but very well maintained , with a sort of view of the Gedachnis kirche and everything was there. An esppresso machine, ironing board, slippers and bathrobe for example. The bathroom was somewhat claustrophobic but they managed to squeeze in a walk in shower which I so much prefer than a standing in the bath one. I was impressed by turndown service as they did everything right. From restocking the coffee supplies to refreshing towels. Well done HK. The breakfast was also not too bad but once again Interconti's is more sumptuous and the quality of the food ihigher. The service of the team though was efficient and quick. Ok it was not busy but still. The one concierge I dealt with was friendly but he did not know that there were guided tours at Tempelhof airport. As always stays at hotels can be so personal and although I was quite happy with my 2 nights at this property ( I had for the rest of my stay a res at the new Meliá ) I would use this hotel in the future only as a backup.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharsco
Reviews.Content: Was impressed with the Swissotel. Level of service was great with all staff very friendly and obliging. Our room was a standard room and was well equipped and spotlessly clean as expected in a 5 star hotel. Great selection for breakfast. Our rate included breakfast and was booked direct through the hotel website (they have a price promise and matched the rate of 125 euros and gave 50% off the first night as another website had a cheaper rate). Hotel is located just off the K'dam which is handy for shopping. It's not the closest to the various tourist sites but bus 100 or 200 takes you to the Alexanderplatz area for a reasonable fare of 2.10 euros each direction (buses are very regular and very punctual). Plenty of bars and restaurants within a short distance, try the Trattoria Peretti for an excellent great value Italian (it's just tucked in behind the big sports shop on the LHS towards Zoo Station). Overall, wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Swisotel or Berlin for a great city break!

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel the best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: EssexGriff
Reviews.Content: If you want a fantasic hotel at a really reasonable price in Berlin go to Swissotel this place is the dogs bits. It is part of the Raffles group and boy does it live up to expectations. Right in the heart of town within walking distance of most of the major attractions including the berlin wall and brandenburg gate and with fantasic places to eat all around if you can make it out of the hotel that is. Room service for breakfast is good vaule but make sure you tell them everything you want as they sometimes leave stuff off if you don't ask for it. The american breakfast is to die for and includes a full english, muffins, fruit, cheeses, ham, yogurt, cakes, teas, coffee, OJ basically everything you could think of and all for 22 Euros each. This was more than enough to fill us up until dinner. Also another must do is the strawberry dakri's and the baileys hot chocolates at the bar again very reasonable in price and well worth a visit. A big must for us was to go to the zoo or zoological garten as they call it. I know this sounds childish but this was the best and cleanest zoo I have ever been to not to meantion the fact that they are the closes place to the UK to have 2 gaint pandas there!!! (wife is a bit of a fan) entrance to both the aquarium and zoo is only around 12 euros and is a good day out. Another nice thing to do is to get a tuc tuc type taxi through the park as they all speak english and are full of intresting facts and places to go in Berlin. Don't hesitate any longer book now !!! CG

Reviews.Title: “the Swissotel is superb”
Reviews.Author: C3B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel for business - my budget would not normally stretch to a hotel like this. In a word: amazing. The staff are incredible and go out of their way to help with requests and advice. The rooms are spacious and very clean with great views, lovely bedding and nice bathrooms. As I was on my own for some of my trip I took advantage of the room service a couple of nights and it was brilliant. Not the biggest ever selection of dishes but very reasonably priced and very well executed (I guess this is down the Michelin-starred restaurant?). The breakfast is also a treat - high quality food items, beautifully served, and a very large range. It is also served until 10.30am which was a nice touch at the weekend (although for an extra 5€ you can have breakfast served in your room, 24 hours a day). I also visited the Palermo bar one night, a cosy little space just off the lobby. Nice atmosphere and very good cocktails. I highly recommend this place if your budget will stretch, or you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: trenchchic
Reviews.Content: The greatest thing about this hotel is the location. If you are in Berlin to sightsee, then the Big Red Tour Bus (22 Euro per day) stops right outside the hotel. From there you can hit all the touristy attractions. As for the room, it was clean, comfortable and was pretty spacious (for Europe). If we were go to back to Berlin, we'd stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: blissfultranquility
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel from the 5th-7th March and we can't fault anything at all. From the minute we walked into the hotel they took excellent care of us and even gave my wife a birthday card, cake and free upgrade because it was her birthday! Would reccommend this hotel to anyone for good value five star service. Thanks particularly to Jeanette on the front desk for helping to make our short stay so memorable xxx We took the s-bahn from the airport for only 2 euros 10 cents each one way which is very reasonable and would recommend this also to anyone because it is very easy to use and drops you off about 4 mins walking distance from the swissotel.
