Ask at the airport when you land because staff there also wiling to help you. Cannot fault the hotel at all, and will definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: teachers_on_tour
Reviews.Content: We're really just adding to the other reviews, probably. This is a nice hotel. It's not particularly unusual, but it is a nice place to stay in a big city. There's a very fancy coffee maker, and a Starbucks nearby for people too lazy to use it - like us. The rooms are very nice - reasonable size, good bathroom, everything you would want. The bed was great, nice sheets, all the five star trimmings. We had an internet deal of 135 euros per night including breakfast, and the breakfast is nice, and served in a room with a good view of the Kurfurstendamm. There are some nice restaurants around & the Hard Rock Cafe is nearby on Meinkenstrasse if that's your thing. The hotel is right near Zoo station & probably quite a good location, but for what we wanted, probably Mitte is a better location. Consider what you want to see and choose accordingly, because Berlin is a sprawling city. One good thing nearby is the meeting point for Insider Tours - Zoo station - and if you do a tour with Nigel so much the better: he is funny & knowledgeable. This is a very nice hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Service experts”
Reviews.Author: John-Elaine
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) have just returned from a two day weekend break at the Swisshotel Berlin. The hotel reached all expectations of a 5 star hotel. We booked through Expedia and got a great rate. I couldn't have asked for a better located hotel on the centre of Kurfurstendamm opposite an underground. And 5 min walk to a main train/bus station. We arrived at Tegal airport and got a taxi which cost 15euro each way. There is a great sportsbar around the corner - try a Berlinger Beer and a Currywurst dinner. The room was a courtyard room and had sound proofing, had a coffee machine, air-con and minibar. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the menu looked v.nice but a bit pricey. The only thing that the hotel lacks is a swimming pool. It has though a sauna and small gym. Tip: we got a map from the hotel but the underground routes have changed since it was issued, better to get a new one from the underground BVG kiosk in any terminal. For 1 full days unlimited pass costs 6 euro for all trains and local buses. Which is great for jumping on and off at stations. When I go back I will be looking to stay in the same hotel as I couldn't complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saroesque
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 day stay in the Swissotel and loved it. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating, gave great advice and info on local tourist sites, and could not be more helpful. We booked our room through Expedia, and had emailed the hotel to ask for a high floor and a view of the Ku'Damm if possible. When we arrived we were told the view of the Ku'Damm was an extra 20 euros a night if we wanted it. We said no, we'd just take the internal view and I'm glad we did. We overlooked the sort of courtyard thing above the bar (sorry, not a great description!) and it was lovely and quiet. The location is great, near to the Ku'Damm so lots of restaurants, shops etc etc. Also close to the Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church and lots of hop on/off bus tours. We didn't eat in the restaurant (44), its a bit too fancy for us, but we did have meals in the bar, which were all tasty, fairly priced and the service was great. All in all, I had a great time @ the Swissotel and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, efficient, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: a7ftt
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the swissotel. Great location. Very central. Modern in design. Very courteous staff. Room was large. Bathroom was immaculate. I was there on business. Had everything I needed, including access to the internet. No trouser press, but they did have iron and ironing board. Free shoe cleaning service. Breakfasts were fine. I cannot comment on price of food/drink as we did not have to pay for either. Overall, I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, loved the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cyclist62
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Swissotel. We went with some friends to attend the 'Berliner Sechtage' (6 day indoor track cycling event). The staff are extremely polite and courteous (without being stuffy) from the minute you walk in and this was reflected in the service throughtout the three days whether it was the concierge, reception, restaurant or housekeeping. As Restaurant 44 was closed on the Sunday when we arrived, Reception gave us some recommendations and booked a nice Italian for us, 'Via Condotti' about 5 minutes walk away. Breakfast was excellent but alittle expensive if not booked in your package. We had managed to get an excellent deal of three nights for two including breakfast which made the hotel amazing value for money. The Concierge helped us out with directions to the track racing which was a little out of town. We had previously got there through a complicated route of trains and trams, however he gave us some far simpler options. The rooms were tastefully decorated with an excellent bathroom. A great touch was the Lavazza coffee machine for a good pick me up after a hard days sightseeing and shopping! The only minor irritation was the bed set up, two single mattresses pushed together to make up a double so you have the horrible crack in the middle. The bedding was also a bit weird, two smallish quilts instead of one big one and if you utilised the turndown service (worth it for the next days weather forecast left on the bed together with a mini toblerone!) one of the quilts was placed on the mattress with the pillows on top therefore implying you laid on one and covered with the other small one. All in all the bedding issues were minor. We would not hesitate to stay at this excellent hotel again which has to be one of the best city hotels we have ever stayed in. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Vickyj21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 3 nights right at the beginning of the Christmas Markets. It was in a in great location and had great modern facilities, rooms were lovely. The staff were super friendly, efficient and helpful. A really great hotel that I would recomend to anyone, Berlin is also a great city for a short break with so much to see. If you ever stay there and need an ironing board its behind the mirror! it took the whole weekend for my friends in another room to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozon
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly and professional staff, convenient location, clean and contemporary. Dinner at Restaurant 44 is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Awfull !!”
Reviews.Author: LeoDublin
Reviews.Content: I always check trip advisor prior to booking a hotel and have found the advice given by reviewers faultless ...... perhaps with the exception of Swissotel Berlin. I picked the hotel over many others (Concorde, Radisson SAS) of the same price and was very disappointed. The hotel facilities are minimal; the 'Amrita Spa' is merely a room with four treadmills, two sunloungers and a sauna. The hotel bar is tiny and on our trip was full of business people holding post-meeting conferences. The room, although spotless, was not luxurious and felt a little cold and soulless. The hotel corridors are devoid of windows and curve sharply leading to the feeling you are on a Dover to Calais ferry. The breakfast was standard and the staff are stretched to capacity at mealtimes leading to many a forgotten order. On the plus side the staff are friendly and the in room coffee maker is certainly a bonus at the end of a long day however I wanted a little luxury on my Christmas trip to Berlin and was sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Warming experience”
Reviews.Author: oldmastumpy
Reviews.Content: MP Brighton The hotel was excellent with very friendly, helpful staff. The food very good and rooms beautiful. It is very well placed for the excellent shops in Berlin, just around the corner from the main shopping street in Berlin. The Christmas market was very pretty and the whole city was decorated in white lights for the Christmas season. It has a gym and sauna, but could have done with a pool. The tour bus around the city is very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality business hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AllanKnaik
Reviews.Content: Competent hotel in west central Berlin. Adequate size rooms with good standard of finish. Pleasant public areas. Quiet. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful – getting staff like this isn’t just good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelling
Reviews.Content: WOW! We arrived at the hotel and it was luxury all the way. Friendly staff who went out of their way to make your stay perfect. The hotel looks very new and is located in the main shopping district of Berlin. The best location really. The taxi ride from the airport was less than half an hour as well. We asked for a non-smoking room and were then informed we had been upgraded to a suite. In the suite there was so much space: a separate toilet and bathroom, a sitting area plus the bed area. The view of the city was amazing. The textiles were luxurious. The complimentary toiletries were lovely. There was even an umbrella in the room for the use of guests during their stay. While it was lovely being upgraded, we think the facilities would be the same in the standard rooms. I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anubis1
Reviews.Content: well run pleasant commercial hotel. worthwhile with executive room and use of executive dining room. Convenient but not as exciting as the Unter den Linden part of town. Still a value even with a dollar fast becoming worthless.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Juan45
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the other reviews. It's a little odd, going in off the street and then ascending through a cavernous atrium to the reception area, but once you are in the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help. We didn't go for the breakfast (plenty of coffee and croissant options around) so can't comment on that. There's a fun Italian place called Vapiano right opposite, where they cook your chosen pasta and sauce in front of you. The rooms are spacious and spotless. The "double" bed is two singles joined together, with two single duvets. Maybe a German custom? We paid €120 a night, which seemed very reasonable. The location is excellent, walking distance from the train station and the metro/buses close by. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarphil
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. It is very impressive from the outside, the lobby area is really comfortable and the staff could not have been more friendly and professional. We were taken to our room by the receptionist and given orientation of the hotel. The bedroom was a decent size, overlooking a courtyard. The room was very clean and the bed was a good size. The hotel feels very secure as only people with room keys can access the different floors. The bar was modern and intimate. We ate lunch in the lobby one day and it was very good. The location was great too. The hotel is close to the Zoo Station (from where you can get trains to Schonfeld airport) and the shopping street, the Kudaam. We would definitely go back to this hotel if in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “not the ritz, but absolutely excellent”
Reviews.Author: carryall
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 4 nights from november10,06. fantastic location-excellent service-excellent english from all the "young friendly staff"- the room was spotless with full bath and full glass shower- internet in the room- safe in the room- satellite t.v. in the room- full american breakfast daily including eggs, omlettes, juices, pastries, etc. the conceirge was very good. tours from the hotel to potsdam city tour were excellent. local recommendations for meals were very good- remember this hotel is one half block off the main street within 4 blocks of the ka we de department store which you must not miss. as you can see i loved thid hotel and berlin, too.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvljunky
Reviews.Content: ... well I'm not sure if it is actually 5 stars, but inside it was amazing. Great location near the Zoo Station and the standard of service was top notch. Best of all, it was a bargain. Vapianos opposite is a great place for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “previous reviewers were spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_54
Reviews.Content: Well, well Trip advisor comes up trumps again! Chose this hotel because the reviews were excellent and that is exactly as we found the experience. It was our wedding anniversary too - 23 years - and we received an up-grade +wine and water, as did the previous reviewers. However, we booked on the hotel's own website and paid 135 euros including breakfast. Our waitress 'Diana' was charming, as was every member of staff we encountered during our four days. This hotel is well managed and represents outstanding value. The weather was awful - but Berlin was fab ! We loved the history, shopping, superb quality food and the very relaxed feel of the German capital and its people. We used the overground train from the airport (Shoenefeld) and walked from Zoo Gardens. Buying a ticket was problematic though - big, big queues at the machines and no one at hand to help, except fellow travellers. Next time buy tickets at airport from a machine or the newsagent (2 euros 10 cents) and don't forget to validate it, or risk a 40 euro fine. We also used the 100 and 200 buses during our stay - buy ticket from driver - no problem. See everywhere from the top and get on and off where you wish (one direction only) for 2.10 euros - a bargain ! Vapiano restaurant (opposite hotel) was good value and serves excellent salads, pizzas and pastas all made freshly for you before your eyes ! Foodhall at KadeWe amazing and much cheaper than Harrods. C & A still in business in Berlin and a landmark for our hotel. I could write more, but the previous reviewers say it all - give Berlin a go - you'll be impressed. Thank you to previous reviewers for taking the time to write your comments and experiences, they have proved very helpful to me. I always check this website before I go anywhere !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Swissotel at the beginning of November to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we were delighted with the service and quality of the hotel. We had booked through hotels.com and received a really good rate of £69 per night. After checking trip advisor it appeared this was going to be a good choice as it was rated 2nd hotel to stay in when in Berlin. Before we arrived I had e-mailed the hotel to say that it was our first anniversary and was there anything they could suggest for our weekend. On arrival they upgraded our room and on the Saturday after returning from a day sightseeing and shopping there was a half bottle of red wine sitting in our room along with a letter from the hotel congratulating us on our anniversary. The hotel had also changed the duvet cover to white with red roses to add a touch of romance to the room. Very nice touch indeed. The hotel and room itself were very clean, modern and also had a few luxuries you would expect in a hotel of this grade. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived outside in a taxi until the moment we left. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone when going to Berlin and we will be back to enjoy the Swissotel again in the near future. It is also great to be able to write a positive review after my last review when the hotel did not come up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Morgan&Sian
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel is comfortable & clean, and service is first class. The location is excellent for shopping, and there are plenty of restaurants & bars in easy walking distance, although if you're into the hardcore bar & club scene, you will need to travel a bit further (easy on Berlin's excellent U-bahn system). Head to Savignyplatz (about 10 minutes walk) for a good selection of bars & restaurants, although the best meal we had was at a little Italian restaurant a few doors up from the Hard Rock Cafe (about 5 minutes walk from the hotel). Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: airedale1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we received outstanding service at the swissotel, Berlin. Staff were extremely welcoming and attentive. Room was everything one would expect of a 5 star and a great place to relax after sightseeing. One of the best hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NatsDad
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. The location is superb. The rooms were lovely and clean and the hotel staff were excellent. Would prefer the internet to be included in the room price but 23 Euro for 2 days was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Susan66
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a German website and got an excellent deal (EUR 120 not including breakfast). The location cannot be improved upon - close to Zoo station, Kudamm, subway and other public transportation. I found the atmosphere in the hotel relaxing, calm yet stylish and sophisticated. The hotel is decorated with contemporary art by German artists. Yet I never got the impression that my presence was upsetting the decor. The standard room I was staying in was very quiet, with a very comfortable bed and a Lavazza espresso machine. One of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. Breakfast is delicious but not cheap at EUR 21. Wireless Internet is EUR 10 per two hours. All in all I would recommend this hotel to everybody except budget tourists. Great value for money - especially when having breakfast outside the hotel. This is now my Holy Grail hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: MrktMgr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews and weren't disappointed. We booked the executive room option - but contrary to other reports, I think it is over-rated at this hotel. I am familiar with this at the Swissotel in Beijing and the differences are substantial. We only used the tiny executive lounge for breakfast -which was quite good. The room is a lesson in details. This company knows what their customers want because they listen! The only thing we didn't like is the lack of pillow selection. It would be nice to have the option of ordering a pillow like at other Hotels. Otherwise everything you need (and don't need) is there: Safe, iron, ironing board, coffee machine, mini-bar, toiletries, plenty of towels, paper clips, pencil, pencil sharpener and eraser! Even found a ruler in one of the drawers. I used the fitness room and found everything I needed. Well stocked and again, a real attention to details. I really appreciated the menthol soaked towels in the fridge, the apfelschorle, the personal video units (bring your own headphones) available on the treadmill, stepper and bikes. Everything was there for the shower afterwards (and I mean EVERYTHING). The only disappointment was the coin operated lockers....what's up with that? I didn't have a coin on me, but found that kind of silly anyway. The location of the hotel is excellent. Shopping non-plus-ultra right around the corner. It's only a 10 minute walk to Ka-De-We. The U-bahn (subway) is about 50 meters from the entrance of the hotel - same goes for the buses, be it a tourist or normal bus. Why didn't I give it "Excellent"? The executive floors aren't quite up to the comparison with the Beijing Swissotel: No separate check-in, lounge too small and the room not as impressive. The staff is really good - although the friendliness of the counter staff borders on ridiculous as the authenticity seems to be a stretch for some. Others bring it across with ease like the gentleman - didn't get his name - from Hamburg manning the executive lounge on Saturday 30.09 in the afternoon. He was outstanding: authentically friendly, professional and helpful. A great hotel, but more importantly, excellent service. Just one more example of service excellence - all you other hotels pay attention: My wife and I walked outside the hotel and asked the doorman about the city tour buses. He told us we could get more information as well as the tickets from the concierge. We went back into the hotel and took the glass elevator up to the lobby. While riding up I saw the doorman pull out his cell phone and make a call. When we arrived at the concierge desk, the concierge was just hanging up the phone and had the brochure for the bus tours in his hand - waiting for us. That is an example of the Swissotel attention to details. Well done l!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel in a Spectacular City”
Reviews.Author: VA_Odysseus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love to travel to Europe, and we picked the Swissotel Berlin based upon Tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel was clean and elegant without being overbearingly stuffy. All of the staff was courteous, pleasant, and spoke english better than the majority of people I see locally in the US! The hotel location is excellent, within comfortable walking distance of several train stations (S-Bahn and U-Bahn). I enjoyed being close to the Kaiser Wilhelm Church, an 1870's monument that was largely destroyed during WWII. The ruined church looks beautiful in the lights of the city! There is a lot of rich history to the city, as well as many contemporary urban and artistic experiences. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip, and would definitely stay in the Swissotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Spotless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_J_Anderson
Reviews.Content: having stayed in the Swissotel in london and having a very comfortable stay the Swissotel in Berlin had a lot to live up to. I had read some comments from other readers about the not very friendly or helpfull staff and had this at the back of my mind. What a myth blown out into orbit. the staff were impecable from the very polite and happy checking in people to Charles the bar man. The room was not the biggest room in the world but sufficiend for a city hotel, it was immaculately clean and I think the decoration was very nice. The expresso coffee machine was also a welcome treat fantastic coffee. The bathroom was fantastic lots of mnarble and good tiles, a walk in wet floor shower and a very good lit mirror. The bathroom was absolutely spotless too. What more can I say 2 nights spent in a very spotless hotel, in the centre of the city with nice staff. It may have cost a little over what we were expecting for a lads weekend away but when you look at what you get for an extra few pounds its well worth it. I would definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 5!”
Reviews.Author: mister.c.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so in writing a small review I am taking the easy way out a little bit, but it makes a pleasant change as I tend to go on a bit when I pen my reviews! Believe all the positives; this place is the best hotel I've stayed in, and its all at a decent price! If you think you'll use the executive lounge then do so, and please dont hesitate about booking here. It is a fantastic hotel, with fantastic staff and in a fine location, close to the underground. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Himelda
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel: 120 euros including breakfast. i was scared we would not have a nice room but the room was fantastic, the breakfast excellent, the location hard to beat and the staff most impressive. This is the place to stay in Berlin. Its a modern hotel with modern furniture and a stilish decor. The breakfast room has a great view of the city and a great atmosphere. Rooms are large and the decor and furnishings are very nice. There is easy and convenient transportation and lots of restaurants and shopes in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Chav69
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I add that already hasn't been said on the other reviews. Me and my partner originally checked in for 3 nights in August under a great rate from Expedia. However our flight back was cancelled due to the security situation last week and we only learned this after we had checked out. The desk staff made a great effort to help us find an alternative method back to the UK as we ideally need to be back the next day. After a number of calls to rental companies and train companies and finding out that Eurostar was charging a small fortune we came to rather obvious conclusion that we should spend another night at the hotel, upon which the staff kept our great rate and immediately upgraded us to an executive room. Did I tell you they also left a cake in my room on my birthday? The attention to detail in this hotel is superb and being a seasoned world traveller I am not easily impressed. However the Swissotel really exceeded all my expectations and I would go out of my way to stay there again. The staff are certainly the prize asset. I'll be checking their website out to see where the other Swissotels are located immediately.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hairdo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend from 4th august.This was a suprise birthday presant for my husband so I was very keen that we stayed in a really nice hotel.I chose it because of the reviews on tripadviser and feel that it was a very good choice.The hotel was very comfortable and the staff very friendly.Just one tip though allthough it states breakfast is untill 10.30 be warned at dead on 10.30 they completly clear the buffet away.We arrived in the early hours of the morning so we didnt get down for breakfast untill 10.15 . As our tariff did not include breakfast we payed a lot of money for very little. Having said that we would stay there again but there are lots of little cafes that serve very good breakfast for a fraction of the cost

Reviews.Title: “Faultless hotel”
Reviews.Author: NKDEVLIN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this fabulous hotel for 4 nights from 3rd August. I entirely agree with every review written. We could not fault this hotel, from the minute we walked in until we left we were impressed with the attention to detail. The quality of the staff throughout our stay was a credit to this hotel. The small details such as a welcome orientation, fruit and soft drinks on reception, free shooters at the bar, beautiful bath robes, coffee machine in the beautiful bedroom, huge walk in shower, piped audio from tv in bathroom, two large duvets on double bed so no fighting over one!!! made this stay special. Can't think of anything to moan about and cant praise Swissotel highly enough. By the way the italian restaurant 'Japiano' directly opposite is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: ch9nem
Reviews.Content: I've rarely felt compelled to write an hotel review but the stay we've just experienced was really top class. The atmosphere here is wonderful and the service is attentive without being over the top as it can be in so many other top hotels. All the staff we met were a real credit to the hotel - they couldn't do enough for us. The upgrade to the exec floor is definitely recommended, even if you don't plan on drinking and eating your money's worth! Next time I need to stay in Berlin i'll look no further - it's a faultless place.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are accurate!”
Reviews.Author: mlip
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 nights at this hotel. After reading all the glowing reviews and finding a special Expedia rate for $150/night US, including taxes and fees, I didn't bother to look further. What a good choice. The hotel is beautifully modern, rooms are spacious and comfortable, and during a hot summer week, the air conditioning worked flawlessly. We did not go for the upgrade since we were gone all day every day. The staff could not have been more friendly or courteous or helpful. The hotel is around the corner from the main shopping St. in Berlin, and a 5 minute walk to one of the main subway stations in Berlin which is also the drop off point for the X9 express bus from Tegel International Airport - a 20 minute ride for 2.1 euros. When asked for some restaurants within walking distance, the staff sent us @15 minutes walking to a beautiful, tree lined, traffic free, extremely quiet neighborhood with choices for excellent German, Italian, and French - all witin a few short blocks of eachother - and all reasonably priced. I could go on and on. There is simply nothing not to like here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: OzBoy74
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a normal room on the 8th floor btw Jul1-Jul4 and was very impressed by this hotel - the rooms and the facilities are great but the staff were the most impressive - just outstanding! The breakfast was sensational. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooooooooo Gooooooooooo”
Reviews.Author: SJGK_9
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for her Birthday in January. We upgraded to an executive room, which is highly recommended. This gives you access to the top floor bar where drinks and snacks are free and you have an outstanding view over the city. The room was also quality, baths big enough for 2 again with views over the city, bang and olufsen sound system and all the extras you would expect from a quality hotel. The staff were so friendly, they showed us to our room on check and explained everything about the room and the city. The hotel is ideally situated in the shopping district and is only 3 stops to the former east berlin, where a lot of the better bars and restaurants are situated. If you go to Berlin, this is the place to stay, then go out around the Mitte district and you will have a wicked time in this very cool city. PS the breakfast shown is what was left after we attempted to finish it, just order for 1 is my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss : clean and neat”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Staff were outgoing. the room was perfect, more than u can expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location with 1st Class Service. Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: summers_slayer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last December for a 3 night break and I am not easily impressed, but I have to say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff including reception, concierge and bar staff were friendly, couldn't be more helpful and were incredibly attentive. I had upgraded our room the day before leaving to an executive room and it really was worth the extra money! The room was fantastic with a view out over the city. The bathroom was huge with the biggest bath I've ever seen and a seperate shower. The room also had everything you would ever want: hair-dryer, stereo, iron, safe, mini-bar and ice bucket, body lotions, ear buds, slippers and dressings gowns to name but a few! I particularly loved the turn-down service provided in the evenings, however be careful with housekeeping. They do not wait on you to answer when they knock on your door and just walk on in, so I kept the do not disturb sign on when I was in the room. The executive lounge was also great with drinks (alcohol and non) and snacks available all day. If you had an upgrade, you could have breakfast there too. The drinks in the bar were priced just the same as most bars in Berlin, but they have an extensive cocktail list if you fancied a treat and they provided a bar menu until quite late. I especially recommend the club sandwich! The location was perfect with the hotel being on one of Berlin's main shopping streets, with a Christmas market across the road and the doormen were more than happy to call you a taxi if you needed one or the concierge was there to provide you with maps and directions. If I'm ever in Berlin again, I'll definately be staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: member from
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel. Good location, very helpful staff and excellent facilities. Our price didn't include breakfast which was pricey but the total price was still acceptable. The restaurant straight across the road- self service Italian - was fun to eat in. The Earl Grey tea in the hotel lounge is first rate! They even bring a tea-timer so that it is brewed for just the right amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: miramol
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin and we booked the Swissotel through Expedia. It is well worth upgrading to the executive floors as you have access to the lounge until 10pm and can help yourselves to drinks (alcoholic and non) during the day and snacks are also provided.( If you are vegetarian ask and they will get a veggie snack for you.)The rooms are pleasant and staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to the Zoo Bahnhof which makes travel around the city and to and from Schonefeld airport very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: BuffDundee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4nights in early May and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. On arrival one of the Receptionists asked if we had stayed before, we replied no, so she gave us a pleasant induction to the facilities, how to work the lift, times of meals etc. The breakfast room was well 'stocked' with a large choice of foods which set us up for the day. The room was comfortable with a superb bathroom. We will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stag Do”
Reviews.Author: Clerkenwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three nights to celebrate a friend's stag weekend. The service was excellent and unobtrusive; the price was ridiculously good, considering the location and facilities and the price was fantastic (I still don't understand how we got a twin room for $120 per night). I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “seriously classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandQwerty
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in, it compares with all the five star hotels. It is modern with a friendly and unobtrusive staff. The rooms are state of the art with modern solid furniture and all business requirements. You could literally live in the room with the room service! The room service is the best i have ever experienced. The restaurant is good but a little overpriced. Everything works in this hotel and it is a surprisingly calm place to stay in busy west berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Englanderin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for visting the sights (or sites) with easy access to Zoo Station and the underground. Staff are pleasant and the rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Easter Break”
Reviews.Author: 7DegreesOfWonderment
Reviews.Content: MY third time to stay at this very centrally located hotel. Destined to a business traveller the rooms are well appointed, not huge, but comfortable. The bathroom is small but so well designed that all works in a way that makes up for its lack of space. The common areas are well designed and comfortable. I have found all staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. The main restaurant have quite experimental cuisine that can be as self concious as it is expensive - though good. If you are staying as a group with a few rooms make sure to request you all stay on the same floor as your key card must be swiped in the elevator only giving you access to one floor. It is a real pity that they have removed the steam room from the health centre on the ground floor this had been a real plus in the past. A hotel of this level really misses a pool. There is a very good gym accross the street. I found the best rate on their own site. Will definately continue to stay here on my trips to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandhappygolucky
Reviews.Content: We actually went with a little trepidation to this hotel despite some good reviews in Tripadvisor as we had had bad experiences in Germany before with food and accomodation. From the moment we arrived however we were made very welcome. I speak only a smattering of German, but the staff were all very fluent and willing to use English. We were personally escorted by the reception staff to our room. We were paying for the executive floor which came with an manned open bar, breakfast and inclusive snacks. The food was delicious and the host of the executive room very generous with drinks. We certainly had our money's worth The room was averaged sized for a European city hotel, very well decorated and spotless. We ate one main meal in the hotel. It was excellent and again the service was very friendly. Woudl definitely return. I felt we had a bargain

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the executive floor. The package was excellent value. Room was small but had everything we wanted. The executive lounge was well stocked with every drink you could want and snacks, some quite substantial. We had our evening meal there once after a tiring day sightseeing. The restaurant 44 was a pleasant surprise- as good as any hotel restaurant we have ever used. Best of all all the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was spotlessly clean. Taxi from Tegel is about 12 Euros. The airport bus stops 100metres from the hotel and takes about half an hour. Ku'damm fantastic for shopping and some sights, and all sightseeing easy with the metro, right beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay.....”
Reviews.Author: theboybg
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in the staff were very helpful, check-in was smooth and efficient and guided us to the lift giving a little tour of the hotel also. Comfortable and clean room - style is very modern but still cosy. Location is great - right in the heart of the action, main station within 4 mins walk and Zoo also no more than 5 mins. Recommended to tourists and business visitors alike.

Reviews.Title: “Most unwelcoming hoteI I have been in for years”
Reviews.Author: Eti
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Internet, but was very dissapointed when I got there. You do not enter the looby directly but have to get there by elevator. The whole interior and the rooms are very modern, which I usually like, but here it creates an impersonal atmosphere. I booked an expensive executive room, for a business trip, and to my surprise the room was tiny and there was a probelm with the heating which took hours to get fixed. Most unpleasant was the feeling I had there of total lack of warmth, from the staff (mostly inexperienced) and the decoration. Very unwelcoming overall. I left immediately the next morning and 1 month later I discovered they had booked my room rate twice on my credit card. I had to go through several calls and faxes before the problem was finally solved and I was re-imbursed. I will surely never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Mil4d
Reviews.Content: We were given a very warm welcome when we arrived at the lobby of the Swissotel. It is a rather unusual set up whereby you have to get into a lift to go up to the reception area for check in. The lady at the reception greeted us as soon as we got out of the lift and the check in was quick, without any hassle. The room is large and comfortable. We love the bathroom, very modern and clean. If you are a espresso lover, well this is for you. There is an espresso machine in the room. It is easy to use and the quality of the espresso produce by the machine is good. A very thoughtful gesture on the part of the hotel, by providing a good range of stationery for the guest in the room and you can use the keyboard to send email in the room. The location is great, within walking distant to the Christmas market and all the nice shops. In fact, we walked to the Tiergarten and beyond, to the Berlin wall, Check point Charlie etc. As for restaurants, there are a few very nice restaurants nearby, especially the ones referred to by the hotel. We really enjoyed our breakfast there. The yoghurt is great. A great selection of pastries, breads, fruits, salads, cold meat (great smoked salmons), and lots more. We will gladly stay here again and if in doubtful, we will choose to stay in Swissotel in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but not really as good as most here make it out to be!”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hotel over the weekend and I picked the hotel basically because of the ratings on here. I wanted to have a nice two days of shopping and relaxing in Berlin with my girlfriend. I won't bother writing about all the positive things already mentioned by other reviewers. I'll focus on what disappointed. When we arrived, we were offered a free drink voucher to use at the bar. Unfortunately, this is not for a drink of choice but a pre-mixed, horribly sweet concoction out of the depths of the fridge. It's nothing worth remembering and we were kind of disappointed by this. Further, when we did get up to the room, we were disappointed about how small it was. We had a basic double, but the same type of room at the Inter-Conti or SchweizerHof in Berlin is much bigger. Everyone was so excited about the espresso machine. Folks, it's really not a big deal and the coffee provided really isn't that good! Further, the bathroom is boring and nothing out of the ordinary. The location is good if you are up for shopping on the Kudamm right outside, but where it's at right now is Mitte, and that's too far from this hotel! Finally, the average age of the clientel is significantly higher than expected. On a weekend, I would guess the average age to be somewhere around 40. Maybe we simply caught a bad weekend but we felt like there were only senior citizens in the house. Long story short, a very nice hotel and nothing negative to really say. There just really wasn't anything that impressed me that much and I am very surprised to see this hotel at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tschye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very pleasant stay from 5th Feb to 8th Feb The location was ideal with easy access to the subway and not too far from the Zoologischer Garten Station Hence it was easy to move around the city The staff were all very helpful and friendly Breakfast was great! Good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as we remembered”
Reviews.Author: flinny
Reviews.Content: We went back to Berlin in January after an excellent few days in August and chose the Swissotel because we had enjoyed our stay there so much in the summer. We were so delighted that everything at the Swissotel was as good as we remembered. The executive lounge was worth every euro and can't wait to return to Berlin and the SWISSOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “It's a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSergey
Reviews.Content: I just came back home from Berlin and stayed there at Swissotel am Kurfurstendamm for six days in the very beginning of January 2006. I decided to choose this hotel mainly due to very positive reviews had been posted by visitors on the Tripadvisor. With appreciation I fully agree with them and can repeat only that this hotel is wonderful. It’s rather modern; its premises are designed in a techno tune but filled with a classical mood of comfort and pleasure; its extremely friendly staff speak fluent English and do all their best to make you feel home. At checking-in, a young lady at reception tried – and very successfully – to talk to me in Russian language, and that was too pleasant. At my request, they provided me with late check-out, and the first hour of delay was absolutely free of charge. The concierge is very skilled and helpful in assisting to arrange sightseeing routes. I stayed in executive room on the 9th floor and could use the executive lounge’s service (snacks, drinks, etc.) during the day. The room was spacious enough and convenient, especially its queen bed with heaven-like pillows, blankets and daily changed linen. Lavazza coffee machine with heated cups is the next hit helping you to feel good along with 24-hours room service, same day laundry-dry clean-pressing service, bathrobes, slippers, daily Toblerone’s turndown service, first-class mini-bar, TV-set with almost 50 channels in German, English, French, Spanish, Italian, Russian, Polish, Arabic languages, internet access, umbrella, iron, hair dryer and many, many more. After numerous previous reviews, I won’t describe in detail the hotel’s famous breakfast: the only remark is that I was astonished by its diversity and quality in spite of my travel experience embracing almost a half of the world. The dinner’s menu at the hotel’s 44 Restaurant is also excellent, especially desserts. The lobby bar and Palermo bar are nice places too to spend some time at night. Excellent service, relaxing atmosphere, friendly attitude – nothing else left to be desired except a wish of coming back to the Swissotel Berlin in the nearest future.

Reviews.Title: “The Swissotel Berlin was perfect...”
Reviews.Author: TraceyMcM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late Dec 05 for the German Christmas Markets with my parents for two nights. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with professional, happy and lovely staff and surroundings. The reception and its staff were so great and assigned us rooms near to each other. It was our 4th wedding anniversay and that gave us an upgrade and on the actual day of our anniversay, gave us chocolate and bottle of champagne in our room. So thoughtful! The rooms were absolutely stunning. Really beautiful and modern, plenty of room and the separate bath and shower was an unexpected surprise. The location is great too. You are 1 minute from a train stop (and the trains are very easy to use). However, you can easily walk around the area for loads of shopping, food and sights. Berlin was a great city to visit, they had a Christmas Market that is rated in Top 3 in Berlin just around the corner. And we said at the end of our trip that we thought it was the best. So, the stay in Swissotel ticked all of our boxes. I would definately recommend this hotel for a great stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Swissotel Berlin the welcome was smiley and warm. They try their utmost to make you feel at home. The decor in the reception and rooms is contemporary, modern and clean, no clutter as everything seems to have been very well thought out. The room was a good size for two people and we were very comfortable there. There were interesting pieces of modern art decorating the walls as well. Staying for two nights we took full advantage of the room service which was tasty, generous and not too overpriced either. Perfect to start the day or if you get peckish late at night (try the club sandwich). I'd recommend this hotel for anything from business to romantic trips away. I cannot fault this place. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: bkfhol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel over new year and had a great time. We flew to Tegel airport from which the 109 bus takes you opposite the hotel. A travel pass can be bought at the airport which will give you unlimited use of the buses and trains. There is a Ubahn station outside the hotel but we found it easier to walk to the Zoo station which is only about 5 minutes away and much better connected to the rest of the city. The hotel staff are very friendly and the cocktails in the bar are to be recommended! It is definately worth requesting the turndown service at night. The hotel is situated in the main shopping area and I would recommend a visit to the KaDeWe department store if only to check out the food department and champagne bars!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Lou78
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night trip to the Berlin Swissotel for a suprise Christmas trip for my Fiance and was really glad I did. Good location on the Ku'damm right near the U Bahn and Zoo Station. Very friendly and helpful staff nothing was to much trouble. Lovely room on the executive floor with comfy beds, marble bathroom and turndown service. The executive lounge is great for champagne and nibbles before heading out for dinner (included in the price of the room!!) The breakfast was to die for and if staying on the executive floor it's included in the rate, you have the choice of dinning in the main restaurant, executive lounge or room service which I highly recommend (they even bring you your own toaster!!). All in all one of the best hotels I have stayed in and I am usually quite hard to please. Check out there own website for the best deals - could not belive the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidMooney
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break in this splendid hotel. Great value for money, good location,great breakfast and very accomdating staff. The rooms are very modern and the bathroon was really excellent.If you are traveling to Berlin you should check out the deals in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: hxdirect
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 teenage daughters are just back from a wonderful long weekend in Berlin. What helped make it really special was the luxury of the Swissotel. From the moment we stepped in through the main door the service was perfect. Checking in was easy and the receptionist took great pains to ensure we were well orientated with all the facilities on offer. We were more fortunate than one of the previous reviewers in that our girls had a twin room adjoining ours so we have no complaints there and indeed the rooms were spotless and well serviced during our stay. As far as breakfast was concerned we just could not believe the enormous choice on offer. I think the one person who was the most helpful in ensuring we had as good a break as possible was Georg the Concierge. He was a mine of information and helped book us tickets for one of the lesser known shows in the city and he recommended a particular authentic German restaurant called Leibniz-Klause which was not at all touristy and whose waiting staff took great delight explaining the origins of the various dishes on offer. All in all a wonderful break.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: erniec
Reviews.Content: We've just come back and simply loved the hotel. We upgraded late to Executive and it was worth every penny -just 45 euros per ROOM. Fantastic food and drink all through the day, all within the upgrade cost, and exceptional service. Downstairs bar staff a bit laid back but overall level of helpfulness was outstanding. Our room was really just a little small for two people, but we loved the wonderful white cotton bedding (changed each day) and the incredible attention to detail. Apart from the sleping area there was a computer work station and an excellent double bathroom together with more than ample wardrobe space. We had dinner in the restaurant one evening and the food was outstanding. Additionally the airport bus(109) stops yards from the hotel entrance and the U-Bahn stop is also moments away. It was extremely quiet yet its position could not be bettered for shops and public transport. It proved to be excellent value for money and certainly added to the pleasure of our few days in this extraordinary city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Loulibelle
Reviews.Content: There were definate positive and negatives to this hotel. Overall I would not stay here again due to the cost and the lack of a comfortable atmosphere. I booked two rooms and emailed the hotel in advance asking for rooms as close together as possible. They replied swiftly assuring me that they had noted our request and had arrange for two rooms very close together. On arriving they denied all knowledge of this and had allocated two rooms two floors apart! This caused no end of problems and one evening when my younger son wanted to pop up to see my older son, resulted in him being stuck on a floor. They give you cards that only allow you to go to the floor where your room is located which is good for personal safety but they gave us additional cards so that we could all go to both floors. However these cards don't work properly and my poor 12 yr old son was stuck on the top floor and got so worried that it didn't cross his mind that he could go down the lobby. He made 3 calls to reception and no-one offered him any help. Finally he realised he might be able to go down, so got in the lift and went to reception. Not one word of apology for the cards not working properly and for them not giving him any assistance. If any families are booking here I would be very careful about be allocated different floors. And whatever age your child is, don't allow them to use the lift system on their own...even if they are teenagers. On arriving one room was turned down and had fruit and a note from the manager welcoming us, the other room hadn't been touched. A call to the manager ensured the arrival of someone to sort the room out. The safe also jammed in one of the rooms but they did attend to this swiftly and apologised. The rooms are comfortable and the bathroom was really lovely. There is plenty of space to hang clothes but unfortunately only a coffee making machine in the room. We used quite a lot of the mini bar but found that we weren't ripped off by the prices. The other big let down is the lounge area. It took over 20 minutes for me to get a small glass of red wine and there was only me and two other guests there! And then I was ripped off by being charged 12 euros for a very small glass of wine. I didn't notice until I got home because my husband paid the bill when he arrived back at the hotel. I found the hotel functional, but for the price had a distinct lack of customer focus. I guess they don't feel they need to make an effort. We used the lounge of the Kempinski Bristol which has a lovely blazing fire and soft sofas. I wouldn't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Cazwario
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Not particularly unique or characterful but incredibly attentive to service, like Ive never experienced before. You get an 'orientation' of the hotel when you arrive from the receptionist where they carefully explain the layout, how to operate the lifts, etc. all delivered as if its the first time they've said it and not the 1000th. Rooms nice, liked having a separate bath and shower which you dont always get nowadays. Everything in the room that you could need, and the espresso machine is a nice touch. Make sure you ask for the turndown service even if arriving late. You get robes on the bed, slippers, mat, chocolate on the pillow and even a handwritten weather forecast for the next day! However my greatest praise is for the breakfast. This is the best breakfast in bed I have ever had. I have to confess me and my husband ticked just about everything on the doorcard in a bit of a drunken hungry state. We thought we'd get charged loads extra seeing as we'd ticked so much, but no, nothing extra as our room included breakfast. It arrived on a massive trolley and included waffles with strawberries and syrup, eggs, yoghurt, fresh bread with our own toaster(!), pastries, meat, cheese, a cooked breakfast, sparkling wine... you name it, we got it. Delicious! I would stay here again for the breakfast alone! My only gripe was for the hotel bar. The staff ignored customers for so long that people had to shout for service, and were a bit surly. Other than that its fab, great location too. If you want some authentic German food they recommended a great restaurant just 2 minutes round the corner from the hotel, cant remember the name but the staff should know it.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay - smoke filled environment only negative”
Reviews.Author: Groncho
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice rooms. Good bathroom (although shower pressure weak - a German problem). Very friendly staff. Good internet access (althrough not broadband). The big negative - Smoking!!! Although we booked through Expedia a non-smoking room, Swissotel do not have any in Berlin. Rooms however were cleaned thoroughly and ventilated so that we didnt suffer. The rather compact Bar/lounge/Lobby/Reception "combined area" was a big problem for non-smokers as there was no way to avoid the natives puffing on their pipes, cigars, cigarettes etc... A few UK visitors who smoked went into overdrive and puff away like there's no tomorrow. A trully unusual sight for the average UK visitor (ordinarily non-smokers). This area was very uncomfortable for my wife who is pregnant. US, Scandinavian, Scottish, Irish and Italians would have gone ballistic by these conditions!

Reviews.Title: “quality in good modern setting”
Reviews.Author: duke_clar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a standard room for 4 nights in Nov 2005. Would have rated ***** but gym not adequate Location: Close to the zoo, quiet district, facing a subway stop, less 10 mins away from all major sights. Room: Spacious. Clean. Well decorated with modern furniture. Well equipped (bar,ironing board, complimentary espresso machine,etc.). Bathroom very clean and spacious. Facilities: Nice bars and lobby. Clean small gym (with sauna, tanning machine...) but not well equipped for workout Service: Excellent. Extremely nice and very helpful people (reception, concierge, valet, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Good as long as you don't pay the full price”
Reviews.Author: PhGAR
Reviews.Content: I had never been to the Swiss hotel in berlin, so decided to give it a go. It is as clean as you expect a 4/5 star hotel to be. Staff was very good, but that has always been my experience in Germany. The rooms were quiet and well appointed, although not particuarly luxurious. The bathroom was small. The spa was clean and well provided for, although the gym was more of a corridor with a few machines threwn in than a suitable exercising place. I am afraid the the KuDam has never been my favourite place in Berlin, so the location was not what I would see as the hotel strong point. There is a strong feeling that the center of Berlin is now shifting back towards unter den Linden, and I would recommend to anyone travelling to Berlin to look for a hotel in that area, and avoid at all costs the dreadfully commercial and dull area around the Zoologisher station. In short, I would not stay there again, but would rather look for something less corporate, closer to Unter den Linden. At any rate I would not stay there unless paying only 50% of the listed price. There are plenty of offers on the net for that hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service, Quality and Price”
Reviews.Author: Portugal_Paul
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from 11 to the 14th of Nov. One of the best internet booking prices for a Berlin 5 Star hotel (120 Euros, including taxes, very good breakfast and free Health-Club Access). Rooms are spacious and very well equipped (for example a spacious shower AND a large bathtub). Room service, wake-up call and house keeping are quick and efficient. Reception and concierge go out of there way to make you feel welcome and solve any problem or request you may have. The two bars are well equipped and with a good ambiance. Stuff is always smiling and speaks excellent English. For shopping just go around the corner (famous Kudamm Avenue) or 3 blocks to the world famous KaDeWe department store. Taxis are 24/7 in front of the door. Public transport is around the corner (Buses, tube and tram). Very safe area even late at night. Cheap taxi ride (7-8 Euro) takes you to all the other new attractions (around the district called Mitte). Was initially hesitation between this very recent Swissotel and either the Hyatt (very impersonal area) or the Interncontinental (darker part of downtown and an older hotel) Will definitely stay at the Swissotel again and recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable value”
Reviews.Author: Bobgardiner
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 1 week in swissotel, Berlin, (Nov 4-11). Spotlessly clean rooms, comfortable and convenient. Restaurant one of the best we've ever eaten in, staff professional, friendly and efficient. Executive deal fantastic. Breakfast quiet and comfortable in exec. lounge - more comprehensive in restaurant. The soups, ham, wines, bread, choclate - available almost all day in the exec. lounge very good. Position is very central. Outside rooms have interesting view. Strongly recommended - many good deals available.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: penguinsix
Reviews.Content: Have always enjoyed great stays here. Last trip was on the "Executive" floor which gave me access to the lounge for free food and snacks, which I found quite useful. Hotel is centrally located to many things in Berlin. Very modern rooms. BBC & CNN for English speakers. Definitely would stay again. Internet fees were a bit high, but aren't they always...

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but gym was a joke”
Reviews.Author: urbanguy1974
Reviews.Content: Pluses (1) Good location just off the main shopping street (2) Great deals available during the summer - good value for money in comparison with similar-class hotels in other major European cities (3) Tasty buffet breakfasts Minuses (1) Tiny, windowless "Amrita Fitness Center" with limited equipment (e.g. 1 treadmill). The facility was disappointing relative to the description given on the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night stay in Berlin and the Swissotel was the perfect choice. Everything you'd expect from a five star hotel but at much better prices than you pay in London. The rooms were spotless, breakfast excellent (large buffet style heaps of choice including good old bacon and eggs!), staff incredibly friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend thsi hotel 100% and also Berlin as a city break destination. Gret fun and great people.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!!”
Reviews.Author: Delite7
Reviews.Content: We chose the Swissotel thanks to reviews in Tripadvisor!!! We stayed there for 8 days and had a wonderful time. We chose to pay a bit more for access to the Executive Lounge, which was well worth it!! The staff are absolutely excellent!! The location is great, just off the Ku'dam. Our room was comfy and quiet. I will definitely stay there again!! *****If you stay there, don't forget to dine at Restaurant 44. It's one of Berlin's TOP restaurants and it's right in the hotel. The food is divine and the service is impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Yellowhair
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel thanks to Tripadvisor reviews and were not at all disappointed. The 109 bus from Tegel airport stops virtually outside the door and it's only 2 blocks from the Zoo main bus/rail station. We were on the Executive floor - definitely worth the extra for all day free snacks and drinks in the Lounge. Buffet breakfast is comprehensive and the dinner menu is lovely. Very attentive staff. Would certainly try this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, greatlocation!”
Reviews.Author: icyoubaby
Reviews.Content: This is a top class hotel in a great location. The staff were excellent and thoroughly attentive. The coffee machine in the room was a great extra. Will definately be back. Got a great deal on expedia...cant believe the quality we got for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in a wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: The Innocent Man
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin for 4 nights in September 2005. The city was better than I had hoped for, with so much happening. My only regret is that I didn’t manage to see the city before the wall came down in 1989 … the comparison with today would have been illuminating. Make sure that you visit Check Point Charlie, and the area around there … it’s probably the best place to see what the city was like under the old regime. The Hotel is excellent, with clean rooms and an excellent breakfast. We paid a little extra to enjoy the Executive Lounge – I strongly recommend this to anyone staying at this hotel – a top facility, and worth every penny. The location is also good, with a 5 minute walk to the Zoo Station, where frequent express buses run to the airport, or a 2 minute walk to an underground train station. Even with the Executive Lounge added on, this was a very reasonably priced hotel … great value for money. We will certainly visit Berlin again, and we will certainly stay in this hotel when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we took advice from tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 night stay in Swissotel on recommendation of tripadvisor reviews and it was a superb choice. The hotel was stylish and spotless. The room was first class - loved the expresso machine, the mini toblerones at night and the lovely bathroom. We stayed in an executive room and would highly recommend it. We had great evenings and met some really nice people. Loved the wines, especially the sparkling, and even had Remy Martin for a nightcap. Excellent cheeses, soups and parma ham, olives etc too. Breakfast in the dining room was a treat - wide choice of everything - more breadsand juices than I have had before and the nicest boiled eggs ever. Delicious bircher muesili. Hotel staff all very helpful, and location good for k'damm, bus tours, public transport and great shops - especially the huge Ka de We. All in all a lovely base and great value.

Reviews.Title: “great for valentines break!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for valentines weekend and it is the most amazing city hotel i've ever been to, and trust me, i've been to a few. our suite was excellent, the food was excellent, the experience was wonderful. berlin is a wonderful city and this hotel serves to complement it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug128
Reviews.Content: Location - perfect, 5 minutes walk from the Zoo train station which made getting in Berlin by train, and joining walking tours very easy; the hotel is right on K'damm, U-bahn stations in front of hotel. Airport buses stop across the street. The area is safe, we had to get up at 430 in the morning to catch our flight and we saw many people walking around on the street. Staff - excellent service, all spoke perfect English (and several other languages I am sure). The bellman always greeted us, and offered to help with our luggage. Room - we got an upgrade so our room was very nice, with a nice view of K'damm. Even though it faced the street we didn't hear any loud noices at all. Public areas - yes the hotel lobby was always always filled with smoke which I found annoying so we tried to walk by it really fast. We checked out the gym and sauna rooms and they were small. Restaurant - we had a nice dinner at their restaurant on our last night. Good food but again, the whole place was filled with smoke. I guess that's what we get in Europe. We were on our anniversary trip so they treated us with all kinds of surprises. We got a good deal on the Internet as well. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again, a 5-star hotel with a 3-star price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: emmessduesseldorf
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the last weekend in August. When we arrived at around 2.00 h in the afternoon (!), our rooms weren't ready. Though we checked in our baggage had vanished when we came back two hours later. It took about thirty minutes to retrieve it. My companion couldn't be found on the list of registered guests at all, so she only got her room after quite a hussle. Next day, my card which operated in lieu of a key for the room didn't work, so I couldn't enter my room. Finally, noone of the staff helped me with my bulky luggage when I tried to carry it to a waiting taxi. The hotel certainly is okay for business (access to the internet, computers, etc.), but if you are in Berlin for leisure, try your luck elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “almost the most perfect hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: susanjulia
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel experience! As a woman travelling alone, I could not have had a better experience concerning room (spacious, comfortable, beautiful and modern) and staff (very friendly and knowledgeable). The freebies were great (free internet behind the concierge desk and pretty good breakfasts) and the staff's command of English was very good, and I think they are also fluent in several other languages as well. The central location is perfect and transportation is all around the hotel. However, I didn't like that sometimes late at night there was no door man at the isolated entrance (which is the floor below the lobby and requires a closed elevator to get into the hotel); this happened rarely, but is inexcusable in a city like Berlin. (As a New Yorker who travels a great deal, I'm very conscious of safety in big cities). Also, the hotel is very big and has lots of empty lobby-floor space (full of many smokers, but it's Europe!). BUT the advertised health club is a dinky little room, crowded and unbelievably hot and the water cooler was frequently empty. Next room was a nice place to relax after exercise, but the exercise room was so tiny and hot and unpleasant and this was very frustrating, especially on a rainy morning. so I didn't want to go anymore. There's no pool or jacuzzi, and if you're eating a lot you really need a place to exercise! By the way, in my opinion, Berlin is really overrated, in comparison with a lot of cities. It's nice, and people are friendly, but the city needs some face lifting and graffiti cleanups. This hotel is the best anywhere -- really! -- but I think 3 days is enough (I stayed 5). Gute Reise!!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: ddoran
Reviews.Content: read t/a reviews and absolutely agreed with them great service from the moment we arrived wife even thanked me for choosing such a nice place give it a 5 star for overall service

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic executive Lounge, not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Angela089
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Swissotel Berlin, chosen after reading reviews on this site. It deserves all the praise recieved. Excellent staff and spotlessly clean. Room serviced twice daily. We stayed in a Junior Suite on the 9th floor and had unlimited access to the Executive Lounge. The food on offer in the lounge was very good. The evening snack was substantial enough that, if you didn't feel like going out, easily filled you up for the evening with the free drinks on offer, a very relaxing evening could be had, if wanted. We breakfasted in the main restaurant and I have never seen better, in addition to the impressive buffet one could order pancakes, waffles, omlettes etc. Transport links were very easy for sightseeing as well as getting a train to the airport. We booked directly with the hotel and they gave us a good discount on the normal rate. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well trained staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A complimentary suite upgrade with champers & flowers for our friends who were celebrating their wedding anniversary, was just the start of a wonderful weekend stay at the Swissotel. Impressive, well trained staff, who each gave a superb service. It's worth upgrading to the executive floor for access to the executive lounge and all it's free drinks (oh, and some food too). Breakfast offers everything from humble muesli to champagne and smoked salmon. Inner room views less than impressive as you can only see.... other inner room windows, so ask for a street view. Also, be warned that the lift only allows you access to your own room floor - which makes it kind of awkward if your friends have been upgraded to a sumptuous suite on another floor! This ultra modern hotel was recommended by friends who celebrated their engagement here, and it deserves all the positive reviews it receives on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: eskimo
Reviews.Content: I've used Tripadvisor to book hotels across Europe, and have never been disappointed. The Swissotel adds to this unbeaten record! My husband and I stayed for four nights at the beginning of August. We got a rate of 120 Euros bed & breakfast for the Swiss Advantage Rooms through the hotel's own website. Although the room was smallish it was more than adequate and I'm glad we didn't upgrade to the Executive room. Berlin is a great city, so we found ourselves only coming back to the room to change for dinner and then bed. The breakfast was excellent, although I'm glad we got it included in our room rate and didn't have to fork out 21 Euros each every morning. The choice of fresh fruits, juices, cereals and cooked meals was excellent although be warned - breakfast ends at 10.30 and they don't allow you to sit on for much beyond that! Other reviews were right in that the hotel looks like nothing from the outside but the interior is lovely and very modern. The staff were very pleasant, with the reception staff taking you up to your room and showing you around. The concierge was pleasant and informative, and the free internet access offered is a real bonus. The hotel is excellently located. When we first got there I was concerned that we were remote but having spent some time there I realised that anywhere we would've stayed required some travel, given that the entire centre of the city is a park! There are excellent transportation connections nearby and there is a good selection of restaurants, cafes and shops nearby. All in all, I'd stay there again for sure, and would recommend it to anyone. I just hope you get better weather than we did!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: nikzik
Reviews.Content: the greatest hotel ever. good location, big room. clean and comfy. helpfull and polite staff. i would always look for swissotel where ever i travel

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: DGlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swisshotel during a 3-week, 4-country European vacation in August 2005. The Swisshotel Berlin was, by far, the best hotel we experienced during our trip. The location is excellent, the service is amazingly friendly (for example, they made up our room twice each day, and all staff members were friendly, cheerful, and helpful) and the price was very good for what you get. After staying at 5 different hotels in Spain, Germany and Denmark, the Swisshotel blew all the others away, and was a great value to boot. The only negatives: the bed was a bit small for us, but adequate (we're used to a King Size), and the breakfast was very good but probably not worth the price. Despite these, I would highly recommend staying at the Swisshotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stop talking rubbish!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaws8
Reviews.Content: I simply can not understand some of the luke warm reviews that this hotel has had over recent weeks.The IS as good as any 5 star hotel (in fact better than most) but due to its size is available at 3 star prices.The location is second to none,the rooms superb and the service brilliant. Some people in this world seem to feel the need to complain about the smallest details that can mislead potential viewers of this site into choosing the wrong hotel. Take it from me,I have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world,this is top notch.Coupled with what can only be described as brilliant prices for a major European capital,book it with confidence. p.s Try and get a hotel like this for under $150 in Rome,Paris or London!!!!! lol.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: TanDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days last weekend in the Swissotel Berlin. Like previous reviewers, this hotel doesn't deserve the 5star ranking accredited to it. Overall, the service at the reception was good, and the breakfast was sumptuous. However, there was no turn-down service, even after we have requested for it after the first night. In addition, the acclaimed fitness and wellness center was a disappointment. The gym feels so clostophobic as there were no windows at all. Also, the lavazza coffee machine in our room didn't work at all. Overall, I think it is only worth a 4* rating - thus, I would not pay anything beyond a 4* price for it.

Reviews.Title: “like home for 3 weeks”
Reviews.Author: ladywesson
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I left Berlin which was home for us for 2,5 years, we stayed at the Swissotel for 3 weeks after moving out of our apartment (the furniture was on the ship back to the States). The staff said, we would probably kill each other after two weeks in a standard room, so they upgraded us to a suite without additional charge. Our room had a view over Kurfuerstendamm, which was really nice, although we had to have the windows closed basically all the time due to the traffic noise (but we wanted the view for our last three weeks in Berlin). The service was awesome, the staff is extremely friendly and professional. Everything was taken care of. It was super-clean, we loved the turndown service at night and the fresh fruit on the table. The breakfast buffet left nothing to be desired. When I mentioned my gluten intolerance they brought gluten-free bread for breakfast every single morning (did I mention NO additional charge..!?). We go back for vacation next spring and will stay at this hotel again. The location is perfect - close to bus, underground and train and in walking distance to every wonderful shop, restaurant, bar or department store on Ku'Damm. We highly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights mainly due to some rave reviews on tripadvisor and the cheap rate with expedia (approx. £32 per person per night in a twin room). However, we believe the hotel only merits 5 stars if you pay extra for a Ku'dam view (30 euros extra per night per room) or go for the executive upgrade (approx 50 euros extra per night per room). Our room was very clean and the bathroom was lovely, but there was not enough wardrobe space, coathangers or pillows for 2 people. Although we expected to have an inside view we did not expect such an awful outlook ie. many hotel room windows facing us and a bleak courtyard down below. You don't receive any of the extras mentioned by other reviewers unless you upgrade which contradicts the overall five star rating given to this hotel. The hotel staff were courteous and friendly, however, and the hotel itself was spotless if a bit minimalistic and clinical as was the room which was very bare apart from just one picture on the wall.
