Location was okay, near to the shops and U-Bahn stop but the nearby cafes were always crowded and busy. Not an area for people who want lively nightlife though. In general, it was not the bargain it initially seemed but we got what we paid for. Next time, we would rather look for a hotel with more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: thingummyjig
Reviews.Content: Elegant lounge and breakfast area, but rooms standard corporate style. Carpet stained in both rooms. No evening turndown service. Twin bedded rooms have small beds with hard mattresses. Unexciting toileteries. Would agree that this is a good 4-star and not a 5-star hotel. Price dropped on Expedia, 3 days before we were due to arrive so that we were unable to cancel our Swissotel booking and re-book through Expedia. Concierge very helpful. Exterior of the hotel spoilt by huge C & A shop at ground floor level.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay only if price is right”
Reviews.Author: dtoe5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in july . If you can stay at this hotel for no more than 120eu w/breakfast it is a good buy.21 eu each for breakfast is very expensive. Anything more is not worth the price. Found a dirty sock on check in. Had to beg the waiter in the morning for a second cup of coffee. Coffee machine in room did not work till someone came up to fix it. Two nights out of 8 had no turndown service. And a couple of nights the service came after we had gone to bed. This is not a 5* hotel. Was very disappointed after reading all the rave reviews about this hotel. Will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, but not worth their five stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights together with my mother, as we were visiting friends in Berlin. We booked this hotel partly because of the good reviews it has received here, and partly due to its location, which couldn't be better, right in the centre of town. All the staff were very nice, but I think the standard of the our room was below my expectations for a five-star hotel, with very thin pillows and only one spare pillow. There was no soap in our bathroom when we arrived, and only one bathrobe and one pair of slippers (we did after all have a double room), which was quickly rectified when we alerted the staff to it, but they did seem to find it very odd that we wanted two robes. The breakfast was good, but so I find most hotel breakfasts in Germany. The hotel also provides complimentary internet access to guests (behind the concierge), which was very convenient, since we wanted to check in online before leaving the hotel for the airport. I found the Swissotel Berlin a nice hotel, good value for money, but closer to four stars than five. I might stay there again, but it is definitely not on my list over hotels I really would like to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in style at the Swissotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite simply the best hotel I have stayed in during my trips throughout Europe. I have to congratulate the staff for the wonderful service we received during our stay and can understand why it is the number 1 hotel in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “good value swisshotel”
Reviews.Author: fannyBarcelonaSpain
Reviews.Content: After reading the different reviews we choosed this hotel for our three night stay, although we booked for the internet price Euros 140,- with an exelent breakfast incl. on ariving we preferred a K' dam view- room, which we obtained paying Euros 30 extra.p.n. one observation only, the top sheets were smaller then the bed. All the staff was very professional and friendly, except the ober kellner, the restaurant has an acceptable quite expensive nouvelle cuisine. Situated in the comercial west center of the city a little far from the cultural center but there is a good transportation connection. So we can recommend this hotel as a good value if you can get the special price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good value if you get good offer...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and is is located in the heart of Berlin. My wife and I just spend a day holiday at the Hotel, and choose to do so on the back of the many fine reviews the Hotel has recieved on this web-page. Good things: 1)Deluxe bathroom 2)Nice location 3)Good bed Bad things: 1)Hair in the bathtub on arrival 2)Loud noice from the street, as there is a large construction of a new Hotel just infront of the main entrance, that did gave us a lot off early awakenings on weekdays from 7.am. If you can get a standard room for around 130 euros pr night its ok, but dont pay more, then I would rather see you in another Hotel in Berlin. PS: One piece of advice. Be sure to dress in your better looking clothes as most guest are NOT wearing sneakers or jeans :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Readeverynight
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Berlin Swissotel after reading a favorable review here. We followed the advice given by the previous reviewer and upgraded in order to have access to the executive lounge. The rooms were immaculate; the service was superb; and the upgrade was well worth its modest cost. In addition to the food, soft drinks, cocktails, and wines available in the lounge, the hotel offers a breakfast buffet (included in the price of our room) there. We enjoyed the quiet privacy the lounge afforded, and we were most favorable impressed by the hospitality of the Swissotel people who supervised and operated the lounge. This hotel is situated in western Berlin, in a very good shopping area convenient to Schloss Charlottenberg, the zoo, and KDV, one of Europe's largest department store. Swissotel provides free internet access for its guests, and we found this both convenient and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms are great as well”
Reviews.Author: Holly13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Got a really good deal on the Swissotel website of 140 EUROS including breakfast for their standard room. Very impressed, good furniture, nice bathroom, very clean, bedlinen changed every day and affordable minibar. The hotel was in a great location with amazing shops all around and also close to the Zoogarten Rail Station, so great for travel connections. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: alice87
Reviews.Content: Another very satisfied customer. The hotel is aimed at business travellers but is perhaps an even better experience for those on holiday, who have time to enjoy the room, the hotel design, the service and the food. Honestly, it was hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Long fingers hinder perfection”
Reviews.Author: gueray
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Swiss hotel Berlin the last weekend in May. Room: We stayed on the 9th floor, the executive room floor. It was well worth the extra money. Room was light and just big enough, though we did miss a bigger wardrobe and the bed was a bit on the hard side. As in other Swiss hotels, we enjoyed the espresso machine and a well stocked minibar. The room also proved to be practially sound-proof, as the VERY celebrating football teams outside were not to be heard inside. Service was very good, timely and the turn-down service was also very professional. Food: There is a separate executive lounge on the 9th floor, serving breakfast and other smaller snacks and meals throughout the day, included in the price, also wine and liquor. Buddha Bar music playing on the B&O, modern and light furniture and good service. It's a bit on the small side, so personally, I would have preferred it to be non-smoking.... Restaurant 44: we had lunch on a very hot Saturday out on the terrace. Food was very nice, we tried the red mullet, the fois grois and the vegetarian ravioli dish. The desserts were to die for! Really high class! Service was good and friendly, and there was no rush, and the atmosphere on top of Berlin is just great! We received a 15% discount as guests of the hotel. Bars: We only tried the bar itself, not the lobby lounge. Late night. Very friendly service and good choice, though the Mojtoes would benefit from more sugar :o) Location: Very good, next door to Ku'dam and only a short walk to good shopping and interesting sites. The double decker sightseeing buses stop only a block away, and proved to be an excellent choice in 35 degrees sunshine. Stealing staff: Both the receptionists and the concierge were very friendly and attentive. I praised them when departing and filled out a "Excellent 5 star service form". HOWEVER, while in the car on our way to the airport, we discover we had left some German delicasies we had acquried and intended to bring home, in the minibar. We called the hotel immediately and explained the situation. They promised to look for it, but we were later in the day told that they could not find it, after we called again to check. So obviously, the housekeeping staff had a feast on it.... For a 5 star hotel, this is VERY disappointing! Long fingers are not exactly "Service to your fingertips!" This did reduce the otherwise luxury weekend feeling of the Swiss hotel Berlin. And I believe, for a 5 star hotel, to offer us a compensation or a reduced price on our next visit, would have been a nice gesture, and there would be no hard feelings. But they did not. Therefore it will unfortunately only get 4 points this time!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: sigmund
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive double with lounge access and breakfast for 125 sterling a night via lastminute.com. Like others found the hotel service impeccable, rooms modern and comfortable and the location excellent. We did not know what was entailed by "lounge access" when booking but were very glad that we took this extra option which provides facilities not unlike an airline club lounge. This means you can breakfast there in style and help yourself at any time to drinks (including wine and spirits) , snacks and (in the evening) a buffet. The service here was top notch. The hotel has its own lounge area, which is smart but also open plan; there are no cosy nooks here. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice, once with great success having chosen the 4 course set menu with selected wines. This was quite delicious. The second time was less successful: rather tasteless salad, over-salty lamb, none-too-warm vegetables. Perhaps the chef is a little too ambitious or was having an off night. But overall a wonderful hotel and would strongly recommend at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “excellent cost-benefit rate”
Reviews.Author: Orric
Reviews.Content: I would not repeat all the enthusiastic opinions already expressed below. With them I agree completely, under any point of view. I should just like to recommend this Hotel to everyone goes to Berlin (singles, couples, families, groups) for every purpose (business, leisure).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie0123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin and loved the Swisshotel. The staff is great; breakfast buffet had everything from bacon and eggs to fruit and cereal, and even dim sum. The rooms are spacious. Located just off Ku-damm and near the main train station. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “warm & friendly”
Reviews.Author: cortile
Reviews.Content: Having used this website to help make a booking and having been really pleased with the hotel I felt the need to add to the already glowing report. The hotel lived up to its standard and was exceptional value for money. As with many other travellers we paid extra for the executive floor and this was money well spent. The staff were some of the friendliest I have met on my travels, and were always there with a warm smile and genuine regard. The rooms are modern in style and very functional. They had all you would expect from a swissotel, clean rooms, modern stylish bathrooms, robes, minibar etc. I am hoping to return to Berlin in the next few months and will definitely make this hotel my first choice. If you want style at reasonable costs then this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Top Draw!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nickwhite26
Reviews.Content: What more can be added to the reviews already published? In a brilliant location, next to a U-Bahn stop (Kufferstendam). Its stylish, friendly and relatively inexpensive. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcmdee
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Swissotel Berlin at the beginning of February and have to admit that it was one of the best city hotels we have stayed in. The service was first class from the moment we walked through the revolving doors on arrival, and the staff excelled in making our stay as comfortable as possible throughout our 3 night break. The hotel is superbly located on the Ku'damm, 100 yards from the U-bahn and only a little further from one of Berlin's most famous landmarks: the Kaiser Wilhelm Gedächtniskirche. In fact, the building is a bit of a landmark in itself too, with its futuristic exterior styling and with over one hundred works of modern art displayed throughout its 7 floors! The standard rooms are exactly what you'd expect from a 5* city hotel; spacious, nice marble bathroom, plenty of wardrobe space, etc. There is also a gourmet restaurant, but this can be quite expensive, especially if you're on a budget. Overall, if you are looking to enjoy the beautiful city of Berlin, a stay in the Swissotel Berlin can only enhance your experience. If I return to Berlin, I can't see myself staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel twice last year, and absolutely loved it. Being a young couple in our early twenties we are often treated like children when we go travelling, but the staff at the swissotel treated us very well. The rooms are always tidy and the bathroom clean. Most young people stay in other parts of berlin, but this suited us perfectly as we could get away from the backpackers at the end of the day. Even though there was a building site next door we couldn't hear a thing. Drinking in the bar was expensive, but that applies to most hotels. A fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great weekend stay here. Location very convenient for transport links to other parts of the city and to the airports. Ubahn station outside. The hotel is in an ideal location for shopping - right on the Ku'damm and next to C&A. The hotel is extremely clean and modern. The staff were extremely polite and helpful - the receptionist even took us to our room. If you can't speak German don't worry, everyone we encountered were fluent English speakers. Pay the extra for an upgrade to the Executive floors and lounge. It's 50 Euros per day for breakfast, snacks and all types of drinks! The Exec rooms aren't huge, but are plenty big enough. Two fab showers (one cubicle and one over bath), bathrobes, slippers and even an umbrella in the room in case you get some barmy weather! Most of the interesting sights e.g the Brandenburg Gate are East of this hotel. The Ubahn and Sbahns will take you there, or ten euros in a cab will get you to Checkpoint Charlie Berlin is a fabulous city and the Swissotel staff will help you find your way around, from recommendations for bars or the Concierge service that will advise on restaurants, theatre bookings etc. I got a great discounted rate with Expedia. Hope you do too!

Reviews.Title: “great room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in February 2005 in the executive room - great room with street view, very comfortable bed, spotless bathroom, good breakfast (you may choose btw restaurant and lounge room), access to the lounge room with great coffee, sandwiches, soup, salads, drinks etc, great location. The only turndown thing was the hotel reception that checked us in, she said that only atrium view rooms were available because the hotel was fully booked, next day we've got a street view room which made our stay very pleasant - other than that the service was excellent. You may book all your tours in the hotel, the bus will pick you up from the hotel in this case. We booked it through Expedia and had to walk to the bus. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunshines
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Berlin is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. The price paid was excellent value for money, we paid a little extra to have a room overlooking the Ku'damm which is well worth it as the windows are the full length of the room and stretch from floor to ceiling. The only downside was the various staff who disturbed us early in the morning (before we had chance to put the 'do not disturb' sign out) There was at least five different disturbances from various staff members, trying to refill the minibar, change towels etc. We hardly used the hotel facilities (health spa etc) as we were only staying two nights and wanted to experience as much of the city as possible. We did drink in the hotel cocktail bar where staff were charming (a novelty in Berlin) and the drinks favourably strong!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: I would join the others' comments about this hotel. We had early check-in, polite staff and a convenient room. ONLY that the courtyard view is not stunning at all. The Lavazza coffee maker is fantastic (it is a feature in Swissotel Amsterdam too and also in superiour rooms in Swissotel Basel) and breakfast was good, too. And the West Berlin location most convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in January for a week, based on recommendations from this site (and the Michelin guide). The Swissotel is well located on the Ku'damm shopping street, with plenty of restaurants nearby, U-Bahn, S-Bahn and the major Zoo Garten train station only a block or so away. (So close a taxi refused to take us there on arrival in the rain, but it didn't matter!) The Story of Berlin is just up the road, the Kaiser Wilhelm church just over the road, and in the opposite direction is the famous KaDaWe department store. The breakfasts are excellent, there is free internet access in the lobby for those who aren't business travellers with laptops, an espresso coffee machine in the room, large comfortable rooms, good security for floors, etc. Do bear in mind however that this is a business hotel - which means there will be convention/conference groups. With no offence intended to the previous traveller, they can tend to take over the lobby when you are there, and it is difficult to get a quiet drink in the lobby bar at certain times of the day! A note - as we left, it again started to rain. We were heading for the train station, and the doorman asked us to wait, and reappeared with two large Swissotel umbrellas. When we protested that we could not return them, he shrugged and said never mind! That is the kind of service you expect from an excellent 5 star hotel like this. We booked on the Swissotel website, and got a good rate of 165 Euro for a business room, with a street view, bkfast included. It was worth it - we felt we might have felt claustrophobic with the courtyard view rooms. I would recommend Swissotel to anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel comes through !”
Reviews.Author: HotelGourmand
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing rate through Hotelbase and Swissotel gave us a free room upgrade. Clean, comfortable, great service. Exceded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: nice hotel-not the best in berlin-adlon is the best- smal rooms-inside vieuw sucks-early incheck not poissible-good central posistion

HotelInfo.Name: Swissotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Augsburger Strasse 44 | Am Kurfürstendamm, 10789 Berlin, Germany
